human, κρέα, αἷμα, χρὼς ἀ., Od. 9.297, 22.19, Il. 20.100; ψωμοὶ ἀ. gobbets of manʼs flesh, Od. 9.374; ὅμιλος ἁ. throng of men, Il. 11.538; ἀ. κεφαλή Emp. 134; αὐδή, ἐνοπή, A.R. 1.258, 4.581.

definition: ἀνδρομηκιαῖος, ον, = foreg., POxy. 896 (iv A. D.).
ἀνδρομητόν (i. e. ἀνα-δρ., cf. ἀνέδραμον) ἐγχειρίδιον a dagger

of manʼs form or figure, Apollod. 1.6.3, cf. Eust. 1571.45.
to be imperious, dub. in M.Ant. 10.19 codd.

man-slaying, Homeric epith. of Hector, Il. 24.724, etc.; of Achilles, χεῖρες ἀ. 18.317; homicide, Pl. Phd. 114a; generally, murderous, ἀ. τὴν φύσιν Theopomp.Hist. 217:—rarely exc. of slaughter in battle, but in Od. 1.261 φάρμακον ἀ. a murderous drug:—epith. of αῖμα, Orph. H. 65.4.
murdering their husbands, Pi. P. 4.252.

manly, -έστεροι ἄνδρες Emp. 67, cf. Isoc. 5.76 ( Comp.); ἀ. τὴν φύσιν Arist. EN 1171b6; -έστεροι τὰ ἤθη Id. Rh. 1391a22; ἀ. ῥυθμοί, σχήματα, D.H. Dem. 43, al.; λόγοι Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.110d; δίαιτα Hierocl. in CA 17p.458M.: Sup., J. BJ 7.8.6. Adv. -δῶς, διακεῖσθαι Isoc. 12.31: Sup. -δέστατα X. Mem. 4.8.1.

menʼs apartment in a house, banqueting-hall, Hdt. (v. infr.), etc.; εὐτράπεζοι, εὔξενοι, A. Ag. 244, Ch. 712, cf. E. HF 954, X. Smp. 1.4, etc.; in inscrs. freq. of the dining hall of religious associations, SEG 33.639 ( Rhodes, c. 100 BC), Syria 26.55 (Palmyra).

of which no written evidence exists, ἀδικήματα IG 5(2).357.162 ( Stymphalus, iii B. C.), cf. Sch. Pl. Ap. 19b, Suid.

not vouched for, not accredited, ὤρη ἀ., of uncertain weather, Anacr. 113; of an illegitimate child, νόθος καὶ ἀ. Pl. R. 461b; γάμοι unhallowed, E. ap. Phot. p.128R.; of a woman, unbetrothed, unwedded, Plu. Caes. 14, Comp.Thes.Rom. 6, D.C. 59.12, etc.; ἀ. ποιεῖν τὰς μίξεις D.H. 2.24.

wake up, rouse, ἐξ ὕπνου Il. 10.138; ἐκλεχέων Od. 4.730; τὴν ἀηδόνα Ar. Av. 208:— Pass., E. HF 1055; ἀνηγέρθη X. An. 3.1.12, AP 11.257 ( Lucill.): poet. aor. Med. ἀνεγρόμην A.R. 1.522; ἀναέγρετο Maiist. 31.

without brain, Gal. 5.314.
of indemnity, PLips. 29.13 (iii A. D.), etc.

without reproach, blameless, X. HG 6.1.13, D. Ep. 2.14; διαφυλάττειν τοὺς πολίτας ἀ. Arist. Rh. 1360a16; ἀ. ἑαυτὸν παρέχειν IG 2(2).1271, cf. CIG 2270.7 ( Delos). Adv. -τως D. 17.2, SIG 436. 6 ( Delph., iii B. C.), PIand. 33.14 (ii A. D.).

not afflicted by ghosts, PMag.Par. 1.1063.

levelheadedness, discretion, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.40, Arr. Epict. 3.2.2, D.L. 7.46.

HA 627b12; of wind pent in the bowels, v.l. in Hp. Prog. 11; πνεῦμα -ούμενον Epicur. Ep. 2p.46U.; of sound, Arist. Aud. 804a20; ἀνειλεῖται ἡ γλῶσσα is kept within bounds, Plu. Garr. 2.503c.

EN 1114a5; ἀ. ποιεῖσθαι τοὺς λόγους frankly, Isoc. 8.41; κατηγορίαν τινὸς ποιήσασθαι ἀ. openly, Aristid. 2.116J.; in a milder form, Dsc. 2.153,5.159.
without accent, opp. περισπωμένως, ὀξυτόνως, Anon. in SE 8.23.

Fr. 687; ἱδρὼς ἀνῄει χρωτί came up upon the skin, S. Tr. 767: metaph., reach, attain to, εἰς προβλήματα Pl. R. 531c: Medic., ἐπὶ τὰς ϛʹ raised the dose to six cotylae, Ruf. ap. Aët. 5.84.

definition: ἀνειπεῖν, aor. with no pres. in use, ἀναγορεύω being used instead; imper. ἀνειπάτω IG 2(2).1186.19, but -έτω ib. 1247.13:—

children.definition: announce, proclaim, esp. by herald, ἀ. τινά proclaim conqueror, Pi. P. 1.32, 10.9; στέφανον IG 12(5).129.33 (Paros, cf. Docum. ap. D. 18.55; τῷ ἀπειθοῦντι πάντα τὰ χαλεπὰ ἀνεῖπεν X. Cyr. 4.2.35; τὸν νόμον ἄνειπε Herod. 2.42: c. acc. et inf., make proclamation that . ., τοὺς γεωρλοὺς ἀπιέναι Ar. Pax 550; κήρυγμα τόδε ἀνειπών . . τὸν μὲν βουλόμενον . . μένειν κτλ. Th. 4.105; also εἴ τις εἴη . . ἐκφαίνεσθαι X. Cyr. 4.5.56: abs., proclaim, give notice, in law-courts, theatres, etc., ἀνεῖπεν ὁ κῆρυξ, εἴ τις βούλεται . . ξυμμαχεῖν, τίθεσθαι τὰ ὅπλα Th. 2.2, cf. Pl. R. 580b, etc.; ὁ δʼ ἀνεῖπεν, εἴσαγʼ, ὦ Θέογνι, τὸν χορόν Ar. Ach. 11; ἐν τῷ βουλευτηρίῳ ἀ. Docum. ap. D. l.c. supr.: simply, say aloud, τῷ δὲ ἀνεῖπεν ἔνδοθεν, εἰς κόρακας Luc. Alex. 46.— Pass., aor. ἀνερρήθην, ἀναρρηθεὶς ἡγεμών X. HG 1.4.20, etc.; ἀναρρηθέντος ἐν τῷ θεάτρῳ τοῦ στεφάνου D. 18.83, cf. ib. 149; τὸν ἐν τῇ ἐκκλησία στέφανον ἀναρρηθέντα Aeschin. 3.47: fut. ἀναρρηθήσεται ib. 147: pf. imper. ἀνειρήσθω let the proclamation be taken as made, Pl. R. 580c.

children.definition: restraint, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.584e.

definition: ἀνείρομαι, used by Hom. only in pres., whereas Att. prefer ἀνερωτάω: but Trag. (in lyr.) use aor. ἀνηρόμην S. Aj. 314, inf. ἀνερέσθαι Id. OT 1304; Pl. Men. 85c has fut. ἀνερήσομαι, and Hsch. gives ἀνηρήμεθα· ἠρωτήθημεν:

children.definition: inquire of, question, ὅτε κεν δή σʼ αὐτὸς ἀνείρηται ἐπέεσσι Od. 4.420; so μή μʼ ἀνέρῃ τίς εἰμι S. OC 210, cf. Aj. 314, Pl. Ap. 20a, etc.

data.quote: ὅτε κεν δή σʼ αὐτὸς ἀνείρηται ἐπέεσσι

children.definition: ask about, τήνδε τε γαῖαν ἀνείρεαι Od. 13.238: in Prose also περί τινος Pl. Men. 74c.
ὅ μʼ ἀνείρεαι what thou inquirest of me, Il. 3.177; ἀνήρετʼ . . χαιρεφῶντα Σωκράτης ψύλλαν ὁπόσους ἅλλοιτο . . πόδας Ar. Nu. 145, cf. Pl. Smp. 173b, etc.

data.quote: ἀνήρετʼ . . χαιρεφῶντα Σωκράτης ψύλλαν ὁπόσους ἅλλοιτο . . πόδας

definition: ἀνειρύω, poet. and Ion. for ἀνερύω.

children.definition: fasten on or to, string, ἀνείρας [τὰ ὦτα] περὶ τὸν χαλινόν Hdt. 3.118; ἀ. τὰ κρέα fasten upon a spit, Pl.Com. 201; ἐνώτια ἀργυρᾶ ἀνειρμένα IG ΙΙ(2).161 B 61 ( Delos); ἀ. στεφάνους twine or wreathe them, Ar. Ach. 1006; τρίχας βελόνῃ D.C. 51.14.
not initiated, = ἀμύητος, Iamb. VP 17.75; applied by Stoics to their opponents, Stoic. 2.250.

definition: ἀνεισοδίαστος, ον, ἔσται δὲ ἄπρατον καὶ ἀ. dub.l. in IGRom. 4.1475 (Smyrna; prob. ἀνεξ-

children.definition: inalienable).
without entrance or access, Plu. Dio 7, Pyrrh. 29.
free from pecuniary liability, BGU 1133.13 (i B. C.), POxy. 270, 286.
exemption from taxation, SIG 612 B 3 ( Delph., ii B. C.), Jahresh. 14 Beibl. 126 ( Tralles), Plu. Eum. 4, IPE 2.36.2, BGU 1074.4 (quoting Hadrianʼs decree), etc.
exempt from taxation, τῶν εἰς τὰ στρατιωτικὰ ἀναλισκομένων D.H. 5.22, cf. Plu. Cam. 2, IG 14.951, J. AJ 13.6.7.

definition: ἀνέκαθεν, before a cons. ἀνέκαθε ( Hdt. 6.128 codd.), Adv. of Place (cf. ἀνεκάς),

children.definition: from above, A. Ch. 427, Eu. 369 (lyr.); τἀνέκαθεν ῥεῖ ἐκ . . Hdt. 4.57; cf. ἄγκαθεν.

children.label: II
children.definition: from the first, ἐόντες ἀ. Πύλιοι being Pylians by origin, Id. 5.65, cf. 7.221; more often with the Art., γεγονότες τὸ ἀ. ἀπὸ Αἰγύπτου 2.43, cf. 6.128; γένος ἐόντες τὰ ἀ. Γεφυραῖοι 5.55, cf. 1.170, 6.35; τὰ ἀ. λαμπροί of ancestral renown, 6.125; πόλις ἀ. συγγενίς OGI 566 ( Lycia).
ἀ. κατηγορεῖν narrate from the beginning, Plb. 2.35.10, 5.16.6.

upwards, ὅταν . . μοῖρα πέμπῃ ἀ. ὄλβον Pi. O. 2.22; ἀσπίδα φέρειν . . ἀ. ἐς τὸν οὐρανόν Ar. V. 18, cf. Fr. 188; [ τρέπειν] τὸν αὐχένʼ ἐκ γῆς ἀ. Crates Com. 10; ἀ. δʼ ἐπήρω τὸ σκέλος Eup. 50, cf. Pherecr. 169 (Valck.); εἰς τὸ ἀ. Hp. Mul. 1.1. ( Plu. Thes. 33 wrongly derives the name of the Ἄνακες from this word, τὸ γὰρ ἄνω τοὺς Ἀττικοὺς ἀνέκας (sic) ὀνομάζειν καὶ ἀνέκαθεν τὸ ἄνωθεν, cf. Num. 13: but -κάς perh. as in ἀνδρα-κάς (A) (q.v.), ἑ-κάς : ἀνεκάς does not contain ἑκάς; ἀνεκάς· ψιλῶς, Phot. p.129.13R., i.e. not ἀνhεκάς.)

data.quote: ἀσπίδα φέρειν . . ἀ. ἐς τὸν οὐρανόν
τρέπειν] τὸν αὐχένʼ ἐκ γῆς ἀ.

children.definition: draw out, σκόλοπας καὶ ἀκίδας, of a plaster, Gal. 14.242.
without outlet, χαράσρα Th. 3.98; Ἄϊδος εὐνή Opp. H. 4.392.
not ‘coming off’, ὄνειρος, opp. ἀποβαίνειν, Cat.Cod.Astr. 5(3).89.31.
not to be overpowered, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.64, v.l. in Gell. 1.2.7.
not skinned, and Adv. ἀνεκδαρτί, both in Suid.
unpropitious for a journey, ἡμέρα Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.269e.
indescribable, ineffable, 2 Ep.Cor. 9.15, Hsch., v.l. in Aristeas 99.
unavenged, J. AJ 20.3.1; unpunished, PGoodsp. 15.5; βλασφημίαι Just. Nov. 77.1.1, cf. 137 Pr.

definition: ἀνέκδοτος, Arc. ἀνέσδοτος SIG 306.5 ( Tegea, iv B.C.), ον,

children.definition: not given in marriage, unaffianced, of a girl, Lys. 13.45, D. 45.74, Is. 6.14; ἀ. ἔνδον καταληράσκειν Hyp. Lyc. 13.

children.label: II
children.definition: unpublished, D.S. 1.4, Cic. Att. 14.17.6; of a secret remedy, ἀ. δύναμις Philum. Ven. 10.9.
inevitable, θῶμιγξ AP 9.343 ( Arch.).
not to be escaped from, to interpr. νήδυμος, Eust. 1580.13.
not warmed or to be warmed, Gal. 7.189, Orib. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.175B. Adv. -τως Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.25.27.
not to be removed by sacrifice, μιάσματα Corn. ND 9 (codd. ἀνέκπλυτα).
unendurable, κακόν Phld. D. 1.12. (Less usual spelling of ἀνεγκ-, cf. ἀνέκκλητος 2.)
not used for assemblies of the people, θέατρον Posidon. 41.
unchallenged, of a περιοδονίκης (q.v.), IG 14.1102,1104.
Adv. -τως GDI 1723, 1729 (Delph.).
not to be evaded, Hsch. s.v. ἀλίαστος, Sch. Il. 2.797. Adv. -τως unavoidably, ibid.
without excision (but prob. ἀνεκκόπτως), Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.9.5.
not emptied, γαστήρ Poet. de herb. 137.
unutterable, ineffable, 1 Ep.Pet. 1.8, Eun. VS p.486 B., Ar.Byz. Epit. 26.10, Jul. Or. 5.158d.
not capable of expression or calculation, δύναμις Dsc. Eup. Praef.; ἰδιότης Heliod. ap. Sch. Orib. 45.2.

incessant, uninterrupted, Hyp. Epit. 20 (dub.), D.S. 4.84, PLond. 3.1166.7 (i A.D.); infinite, of divisions of space, S.E. M. 10.141; unfailing, LXX Wi. 7.14, Ev.Luc. 12.33, D.S. 1.36, Procl. Inst. 84. Adv. -τως D.S. 18.50, Hero ap. Procl. Hyp. 4.75.
ἀ. μᾶζα, in Alchemy, of the asem alloy, PHolm. 2.17, PLeid.X. 7 and 39.
not carefully chosen, ὀνόματα D.H. Comp. 3.
without reckoning, BGU 183.24 (i A.D.): regul. Adv. -τως, πίνειν Pherecr. 143.1.
indissoluble, Just. Nov. 39 Pr.
indelible, Poll. 1.44.
fill up or again, f.l. in X. An. 3.4.22.
undaunted, intrepid, Pl. Tht. 165b, Hyp. Fr. 117; ὑπὸ κακῶν Pl. R. 619a:— τὸ -ότατον X. Ages. 6.7. Adv. ἀνεκπλήκτως Plu. Mul.virt. 2.260c, Hierocl. in CA 10p.434M.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., making no impression, λέξις Plu. Lib.educ. 2.7a.
imperturbability, Pl. Def. 412c.
incapable of fulfilment, τἀγαθὸν<οὐκ>-τον Phld. D. 1.12.
indelible, Pl. Ti. 26c, Poll. 1.44.
not alienated, of property, πράγματα Just. Nov. 22.20.2, cf. 22.39.
non-effect, Sch. A. Th. 843.
not suppurating, Hp. Aph. 5.20, Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.21; δακρυώδης καὶ ἀ. exuding serum instead of pus, Hp. Fract. 25.
not set on fire, Olymp. in Mete. 12.25.
not found out by inquiry, J. AJ 17.11.2.
to be borne, ἀνεκτέα (sc. ἐστι τάδε) S. OC 883; ἀνεκτέα τάδε (restored for ἀνεκτά) Ar. Lys. 477: ἀνεκτέον, Clearch. 4.
enduring, patient, τῶν ἰδιωτῶν M.Ant. 1.9; τινός Arr. Epict. 2.22.36. Adv. -κῶς Hierocl. in CA 12p.447M.
unpaid, χρέος D.Chr. 12.43.
not castrated, entire, prob. in Philotim. ap. Orib. 2.69.3.

definition: ἀνεκτός, όν, later ή, όν IGRom. 4.293 ii 4 (Pergam.), D.L. 2.36: Aeol. ὄνεκτος Alc. Supp. 27.9:—

children.definition: bearable, sufferable, tolerable, mostly with a neg. (like ἀνασχετός) , λοίγια ἔργα . . οὐδʼ ἔτʼ ἀνεκτά Il. 1.573; χρειὼ . . οὐκέτʼ ἀνεκτός 10.118, Thgn. 1195, etc.: so mostly in Att., οὐκ ἀνεκτόν A. Ag. 1364; οὐκ ἀνεκτά S. Ant. 282, etc.; or with a question, ἦ ταῦτα δῆτʼ ἀνεκτά; Id. OT 429; ταυτὶ δῆτʼ ἀνέκτʼ ἀκούειν; Ar. Th. 563:— οὐκ ἀνεκτόν [ἐστι] foll. by inf., with or without μὴ οὐ, Pl. Tht. 154c, 181b; τὸ μὲν οὐκ ἀ. ἐμοὶ . . γίγνεσθαι Id. Lg. 861d.

τὸ μὲν καὶ ἀνεκτὸν ἔχει κακόν that can be endured, Od. 20.83; ἀ. χοὖτος ἦν ὅμως ἐμοί Pherecr. 145.13; ἀνεκτὰ παθεῖν Th. 7.77; μέχρι τοῦδε ἀνεκτοὶ οἱ ἔπαινοι ἐς ὅσον . . Id. 2.35; παντὶ τρόπῳ ὅστις καὶ ὁπωσοῦν ἀνεκτός in any tolerable manner whatsoever, Id. 8.90; ἀ. τι λέγειν Isoc. 8.65; συμβίωσιν -όν Phld. Ir. p.78W.; ἀνεκτότερα more tolerable, Cic. Att. 12.45.2; ἀνεκτότερον ἔσται τινί Ev.Matt. 10.15, 11.22, etc.: Sup., Phld. Rh. 2.226S.

data.quote: τὸ μὲν καὶ ἀνεκτὸν ἔχει κακόν
μέχρι τοῦδε ἀνεκτοὶ οἱ ἔπαινοι ἐς ὅσον . .

children.label: b
children.definition: μόγις ἀνεκτοί Lys. 22.20, cf. D. Ep. 3.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -τῶς, in Hom. always οὐκέτʼ ἀνεκτῶς, Od. 9.350, etc.; οὐκ ἀνεκτῶς ἔχει it is not to be borne, X. HG 7.3.1: without neg., Phld. D. 3 Fr. 2, Oec. p.31J.
endurableness, Gloss.
indelible, Poll. 1.44.
not to be revealed or uttered, i.e. mystical, obscure, Procl. in Prm. p.549S., in Ti. 3.169D. Adv. -τως Id. in Prm. p.589 S., cf. Eust. 382.9.
not to be escaped, inevitable, D.S. 20.54, Plu. Superst. 2.166e, Corn. ND 13, Phld. Ir. p.79 W.

not proceeding or emanating: hence, inseparable from . ., τὰ μέρη τῶν ὅλων Procl. in Ti. 1.6 D., in Prm. p.634 S.; τοῦ ὅλου Dam. Pr. 289; τοῦ ἑυός ib. 59; ἀπὸ [τῆς οὐσίας] ib. 66; ἑαυτῆς Eustr. in EN 40.8.
not to be brought to light, Iamb. VP 32.226, Poll. 5.147.
ἀνέκφορα πάντα γίγνεται there is a general stoppage (of intestinal obstruction), Archig. ap. Aët. 9.28.
inexpressible, unutterable, Procl. in Prm. p.549S.
not visiting, τῶν ἐκεῖ Syrian. in Metaph. 109.25.
unpronounced letters, as ι subscriptum, EM 203.7.
not drained of juices, Gal. 13.194.
without oil, Thphr. CP 2.3.8; without olives, Str. 17.1.35.
Olymp. in Mete. 326.38.
undiminished, Procl. in Alc. p.16C. Adv. -τως Id. Inst. 27.
not cross-questioned, safe from being questioned, Th. 5.85; ἡ γλῶττα ἀ. ἡμῖν ἔσται, ἡ δὲ φρὴν οὐκ ἀ. Pl. Tht. 154d, cf. Phlb. 41b.

data.quote: ἡ γλῶττα ἀ. ἡμῖν ἔσται, ἡ δὲ φρὴν οὐκ ἀ.

children.definition: not refuted, ἐᾶν τινὰ ἀ. Id. Grg. 467a; ἵνα μοι καὶ ἀ. ἡ μαντεία γένοιτο irrefutable, Id. Ap. 22a, cf. Ti. 29b. Adv. -τως, λεγόμενον without refutation or reply, Plu. CG 10.

data.quote: ἵνα μοι καὶ ἀ. ἡ μαντεία γένοιτο

children.definition: without trial, ἀ. διαφυγεῖν Th. 6.53.
irrefutableness, Stoic. 2.39.
convince, convict utterly, E. Ion 1470.
merciless, without mercy, Arist. Rh. Al. 1442a13, Ep.Rom. 1.31, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.173:—also ἀνηλεήμων, Nicoch. 20; and in AB 400 ἀνελήμων. Adv. ἀνελεημόνως, ἀπολέσθαι Antipho 1.25, LXX Jb. 6.21.
= sq. Adv. -τῶς mercilessly, PLips. 39.12 (iv A.D.).
without pity, Arist. Phgn. 808b1; εἰς ἀδελφόν Lib. Decl. 47.32.
shake and rouse, Opp. C. 4.302.
unmerciful, Ep.Jac. 2.13.
illiberality of mind, servility, joined with κολακεία, Pl. Smp. 183b, R. 590b, etc.
stinginess, X. Cyr. 8.4.32, Arist. EN 1107b10, 1121b13, etc.
Asp. in EN 101.14.
Arist. MM 1192a8.
not free, σῶμα, of a slave, Pherecr. 8 D.; slavish, of a shameful death, A. Ag. 1494 (lyr.); ἀτιμίαι Arist. Pol. 1336b12.
servile, mean, ἀ. εἶναι νομίζω κακηγορίας δικάζεσθαι Lys. 10.2, cf. Pl. Tht. 182c; ἀ. ἐργασίαι Arist. EN 1121b33; παιδιαί Pol. 1336a29.
niggardly, Ar. Pl. 591, Arist. EN 1107b13, 1122a5, etc.
rude, unpolished, διάλεκτος Ar. Fr. 685.
mean, treacherous, ζῷα ἀ. καὶ ἐπίβουλα, οἷον οἱ ὄφεις Arist. HA 488b16.

data.quote: ζῷα ἀ. καὶ ἐπίβουλα, οἷον οἱ ὄφεις

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -ρως meanly, προσαιτεῖν X. Ap. 9; ζῆν Alex. 265.7.
anything rolled up, ἀ. χαίτης a ringlet, AP 6.210 ( Philet.), cf. 7.485 ( Diosc.).
without turns or twists, Aret. CD 1.4, Gal. UP 5.3.
unfolding: hence, evolution in dancing, Plu. Thes. 21.
unfolding in growth, Simp. in Ph. 632.31.

unfolding, exposition, αἱ -ξεις τῶν λόγων Procl. in Prm. p.542 S., cf. Syrian. in Metaph. 97.4, Prisc.Lyd. 34.23; ἡ μαθηματικὴ ἐπιστήμη γνῶσίς ἐστι . . διεξόδοις τισὶ χρωμένη καὶ ἀνελίξεσιν Iamb. Comm.Math. 1.

data.quote: ἡ μαθηματικὴ ἐπιστήμη γνῶσίς ἐστι . . διεξόδοις τισὶ χρωμένη καὶ ἀνελίξεσιν

definition: ἀνελίσσω, Att. ἀνελίττω, Ep. and Ion. ἀνειλίσσω· (v. ἑλίσσω):—

children.definition: unroll, ἀγαθίδα Pherecyd. 148 J.: but mostly, unroll a book, Arist. Pr. 914a26 ( Pass.); read, interpret it, X. Mem. 1.6.14; λόγον Pl. Phlb. 15e.
unravel, ‘explicate’, τὸ συνεσπειραμένον τῆς νοερᾶς ἐπιβολῆς Procl. in Euc. p.4F., cf. Prisc.Lyd. 34.23; ἀνειλιγμένος ὁρισμός explicit definition, Simp. in Ph. 276.28.
cause to move backward, πόδα E. Or. 171.

children.label: II
children.definition: roll back, i.e. counteract, ἀνελίττουσαι σφαῖραι Arist. Metaph. 1074a2, cf. Simp. in Cael. 32.17, al., Procl. Hyp. 4.98, TheoSm. p.180H.: metaph., ὅπως ἂν στρέφῃ καὶ ἀνελίττῃ τὸν βίον ὁ θεός Plu. Num. 14:— Med., reverse the direction of motion, Arist. GA 741b21:— Pass., to be counteracted, Id. Metaph. 1074a7; μίαν δʼ ἀνελίσσετʼ ἀμοιβήν Opp. H. 1.420; γλῶσσʼ ἀνελισσομένη moving glibly, Ar. Ra. 827.

data.quote: ὅπως ἂν στρέφῃ καὶ ἀνελίττῃ τὸν βίον ὁ θεός

children.label: III
children.definition: πνεύματʼ ἀνειλίσσοντα Nic. Al. 596.
free from ulceration, Hp. Off. 18.
suppurate afresh, Hp. Mul. 2.122, Morb. 1.21, Cass. Pr. 9.
inextensible, Arist. Mete. 385a16, 386b14.
up-drawn, ἀ. ὀφρύσι, Prob. of Pericles, Cratin. 355.
incapable of being pulled, ὑπὸ φαντασίας Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.40.

draw up, τάλαντα . . ἀνέλκει holds them up (in weighing), 1l. 12.434; ἀνελκύσαι ναῦς haul them up high and dry, Hdt. 7.59, Th. 6.44; νῆες ἀνελκυσμέναι Hdt. 9.98; δοκοὺς ἀ. Th. 2.76; haul up a sail, Epicr. 10.

drag up, drag out, ἀνελκύσαι εἰς τὸ φῶς Ar. Pax 307; κᾷτʼ ἀνελκύσας ἐρωτᾷ having dragged him into open court, Id. Ach. 687; τὰ παιδάριʼ εὐδὺς ἀνέλκει drags them into the witness-box, Id. V. 568: — Med., ἀνέλκεσθαι τρίχας tear oneʼs own hair, Il. 22.77:— Pass., κύνα χερσὶν ἀνελκομενον D.P. 790.

children.label: II
children.definition: draw back, ὁ δὲ τόξου πῆχυν ἄνελκεν (in act to shoot) Il. 11.375, cf. Od. 21.128:— Med., ἔγχος ἀνελκόμενον drawing back his spear [out of the corpse], ib. 22.97; τόξον ἀνέλκεται τοξευτής Arat. 305:— Pass., pf. part. ἀνειλκυσμένος Procl. Hyp. 7.39.
suppuration, Cass. Pr. 9.
without ulcers, Dsc. 2.32, Aret. SD 1.12; καρκινώματα, -κρυπτά, Leonid. ap. Aët. 16.42, cf. 15.14, Aret. SD 2.11.
unfailing, πρὸς τὰς ὑπηρεσίας Inscr.Prien. 113.90 (i B.C.). Adv. ἀνελλείπτ-ως ceaselessly, IG 14.2498 ( Nemausus).
un-Greek, outlandish, ὅμιλον ἀνέλληνα στόλον A. Supp. 234 ( ἀνελληνόστολον Bothe).
not Grecian, S.E. M. 1.181, Phryn. 300, EM 777.53.
unfailing, unceasing, ἀ. παρασχεῖν τὴν ἀγοράν SIG 799.17 ( Cyzicus), cf. Ael. VH 1.33; of rivers, Poll. 3.103. Adv. -πῶς Plu. Am. prol. 2.495c, S.E. M. 8.439, CIG (add.) 2775b ( Aphrodisias).

children.label: II
children.definition: not lacking, τινός OGI 194: abs., lacking nothing, Plot. 5.8.7. Adv. = ἀπερίττως, σημαίνειν mean exactly, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 43.3.—Also spelt ἀνελλειπής Eutoc. in Archim. 3.114.16 H., Ammon. in APr. 32.22.
lame, Hsch.
without hope, σωτηρίας E. IT 487.
despair, Suid.
hopelessness, Ascl. Tact. 5.2, Sch. Th. 2.51; non-expectation, Onos. 10.20.

unhoped for, Heraclit. 18; φυγή A. Supp. 330; θαῦμα S. Tr. 673; ἔργον Th. 6.33; τύχη E. Hel. 412; τὸ ἀ. τοῦ βεβαίου the hopelessness of attaining any certainty, Th. 3.83; τὰ ἀ. Arist. Rh. 1383a8; οὐκ ἀ. μοι γέγονεν τὸ γεγονός Pl. Ap. 36a. Adv. -τως unexpectedly, γέγονεν ἀ. μέγας Decr. ap. D. 18.182, cf. Plu. Pel. 4.

data.quote: οὐκ ἀ. μοι γέγονεν τὸ γεγονός

children.label: II
children.definition: Act.,

having no hope, hopeless, Hp. Aph. 7.47, Prog. 19; ἀ. δὲ θανόντες Theoc. 4.42: c. inf., ἀ. σωθήσεσθαι Th. 8.1; ἀ. ἐπιγενέσθαι ἄν τινα σφίσιπολέμιον not expecting that . ., Id. 3.30; ἀ. τοῦ ἑλεῖν X. Cyn. 7.9; ἀ. ἔς τινα Th. 6.17; ἀ. καταστῆσαί τινι ὡς . . Id. 3.46. Adv. -τως, ἔχει he is in despair, Pl. Phlb. 36b.

leaving no hope, desperate, βίοτος S. El. 186 (lyr.), Th. 5.102; πρὸς τὸ ἀ. τραπόμενοι Id. 2.51; ἀ. οὐδέν [ἐστι], c. acc. et inf., it is nowise unreasonable to expect that . ., And. 4.24: Comp., τὰ ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἀνελπιστότερα ὄντα Th. 7.4. Adv. -τως, νουσέειν Aret. CA 2.5.

data.quote: τὰ ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἀνελπιστότερα ὄντα

children.definition: unsharded, of bees, wasps, etc., opp. κολεόπτερα (beetles), Arist. HA 490a15, 532a24, al.
wind-releaser, PMag.Par. 1.1363.
inaccessible, Eratosth. Fr. 16.14, D.H. 1.3; ἀ. δρυμῶνα Babr. 45.11; of a river, σκαφέεσσιν ἀ. AP 9.641 ( Agath.): metaph., ἡ οὐσία τῶν πραγμάτων ἀ. Ocell. 1.15; βελέεσσιν ἀ. AP 5.233.3 ( Paul.Sil.).
not to be trodden, of a spot struck by a thunderbolt. Plu. Pyrrh. 29.
Act., not going to or visiting, AP 9.287 ( Apollonid.).

not incurring the wrath of God, Pl. Cra. 401a: εἰ-ητον εἰπεῖν Id. Smp. 195a; also, not liable to blame, ἀ. [ἐστι] . . τινί, c. inf., Id. Tht. 175e, Aeschin. 3.66, Epicur. Fr. 161, etc. Adv. -τως Pl. Lg. 684e.
without vomiting, Hp. Prorrh. 1.85, Epid. 2.3.1. Adv. -τως Coac. 546.
vomit up, Hp. Prorrh. 1.31, Arist. HA 594a29, al.: metaph., Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.243.
not distributed, οὐσία Aeschin. 1.102, D. 44.10; undivided, Max.Tyr. 35.7.
Act., having no share, Plu. Cat.Mi. 26.
flatulence, Hp. Epid. 2.5.5.
windy, ᾠὸν ἀνεμιαῖον a wind-egg, Arar. 6, Com.Adesp. 5 D., Ath. 2.57e; ἄγονα καὶ ἀ. ἔκγονα ψυχῆς Them. Or. 32.356a.
empty, vain, γόνιμον ἢ ἀ. Pl. Tht. 151e; ἀ. τε καὶ ψεῦδος ib. 161a; ἀ. ἐλπίς Alciphr. 1.21.
to be driven with the wind, Ep.Jac. 1.6, Sch. Od. 12.336: Act. in Hsch. s.v. ἀναψῦξαι.

definition: ἀνέμιος, ον, f.l. for ἀνεμιαῖος in Ph. 1.96, cf. Hsch.

children.definition: stripped by the wind, Eust. 1095.12.
running with the wind, swift as the wind, Luc. VH 1.13.
wind-bringer, PMag.Par. 1.1360.
strong surging sea, Sch. Od. 5.1 (pl.), Id. E. Ph. 1154.
wind-lullers, sorcerers at Corinth, Eust. 1645.42, Hsch.
meeting of contrary winds, Lyd. Mens. 4.13.
to be filled with wind, Pl. Ti. 83d; ἠνεμωμένος τὴν τρίχα with hair floating in the wind, Callistr. Stat. 14; ἠνεμωμένη πτεροῖς Lyc. 1119: of the sea, to be raised by the wind, AP 13.12 ( Hegesipp.).

children.label: II
children.definition: to be inflated, swollen, Hp. Nat.Mul. 64: metaph., ἠνεμῶσθαι περί τι to be eager for . ., Ael. NA 11.7.
wind-creating, PMag.Lond. 121.776.
with feet swift as the wind, EM 20.6.

wind, πέτετο πνοιῇ ἀνέμοιο Il. 12.207; ἀνέμων ἀτάλαντοι ἀέλλῃ 13.795; ὦρσεν . . ἀνέμοιο θύελλαν 12.253; ἀνέμοιο . . δεινὸς ἀήτης 15.626, cf. 14.254; ἀνέμων ἀμέγαρτον ἀϋτμήν Od. 11.407, etc.; ἀνέμων πνεύματα Hdt. 7.16.αʹ, E. HF 102; ῥιπαί S. Ant. 137, 930 (both lyr.); ἀήματα A. Eu. 905; αὖραι E. Med. 838; πνοιαί Ar. Av. 1396; ἀνέμων φθόγγος Simon. 37.10; ἀνέμου κατιόντος μεγάλου a gale having come on, Th. 2.25; ἀνέμου ἐξαίφνης ἀσελγοῦς γενομένου Eup. 320; ἄνεμος κατὰ βορέαν ἑστηκώς the wind being set in the north, Th. 6.104; ἀνέμοις φέρεσθαι παραδιδόναι τι cast a thing to the winds, E. Tr. 419, cf. A.R. 1.1334; κατʼ ἄνεμον στῆναι stand to leeward, Arist. HA 541a26, cf. Plu. Sollert. 2.972a; κατʼ ἄνεμον καὶ ῥοῦν νήχεσθαι ib. 979c: metaph., ἄνεμος . . ἄνθρωπος ‘unstable as the wind’, Eup. 376; φέρειν τινʼ ἄρας (sic l.) ἄ. a very wind to carry off, Antiph. 195.5 (Lobeck); ἀνέμους θηρᾶν ἐν δικτύοις try to catch the wind, and ἀνέμῳ διαλέγεσθαι talk to the wind, Zen. 1.38; ἀνέμους γεωργεῖν ‘plough the sands’, ib. 100.

cardinal point, quarter, ἐκ τῶν τεσσάρων ἀ. LXX Za. 2.6, Annales du Service 19.40 (Theadelphia, 93 B.C.), Ev.Matt. 24.31, al., Vett.Val. 140.6, PFlor. 50.104: sg., ib. 20.19 (ii A.D.); τὸ κατʼ ἄνεμον aspect, POxy. 100.10 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: wind in the body, Hp. Mul. 2.179, al. (From ἀνε- ‘blow, breathe’, cf. Skt. áni-ti ‘breathes’, Goth. uzanan ‘expire’, etc.)
sheltering one from the wind, χλαῖναι Il. 16.224.
whirling with wind, θύελλα prob. for -τρόπῳ in Anacreont. 36.14.
fan: hence, fan-shaped whirlwind, Olymp. in Mete. 200.19.
echoing to the wind, κόλποι Pi. P. 9.5.

fed by the wind, κῦμα ἀ. Il. 15.625; ἔγχος ἀ. a spear from a tree reared by the wind, i.e. made tough and strong by battling with the wind, 11.256 (v.l. ἀνεμοτρεπές or -στρεφές turned, i.e. shaken by the wind,) cf. Philostr. Im. 2.3.
windmill, Hero Spir. 1.43.
blasting, blight, LXX De. 28.22, IG 12(9).955.7, 1179.25 ( Euboea).
blasted by the wind, LXX Ho. 8.7, Ph. 2.431.
carried by the wind, of rumours, Cic. Att. 13.37.4; of delicate vessels, Luc. Lex. 7; dub. sens. in Sammelb. 4324.8 ( -φόρετος), 14.
intrepid, Sch. E. Or. 1479. Adv. -τως Plu. Galb. 23 (nisi legendum ἀνεκπλήκτως).
of which one cannot have oneʼs fill, θέαμα v.l. in Them. Or. 2.40b.
unhindered, ἐνέργεια Arist. EN 1153a15; βίος Pol. 1295a37. Adv. -τως D.S. 1.36, PFlor. 370.17 (ii A.D.), Jul. Or. 6.193d.
not obscured, clear, Procl. Hyp. 4.92. Adv. -τως ib. 88.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., offering no impediment, πρός τι Arist. PA 663b11.
unsold, Sch. S. Ant. 1036.
not falling into, εἰς λύπας Pl. Def. 412c: abs., D.L. 7.117.
without formal notification, δωρεαί, opp. ἐμφανεῖς, Just. Nov. 162.1.
not expressive or indicative, ὕβρεως κτλ. Plu. Aud. 2.45c; πλήθους Procl. in Prm. p.639S.

definition: ἀνέμφατος, ον, v.l. for foreg., Procl. in Prm. l.c., cf. eund. in Ti. 3.1 and 12 D.;

children.definition: without a tinge of, Elias in Cat. 20.26: abs., lacking in expression, πλοκή, of melody without rhythm, Aristid. Quint. 1.13; λέξις Aristid. Rh. 2p.434S. Adv. -τως Hermog. Id. 2.10, 11, Aristid. Rh. 2pp. 434,450 S.

windy, Σκῦρος S. Fr. 553; χώρα Hp. Aër. 24, cf. Nic. Th. 96; ἀκρωτήριον Plu. Sollert. 2.967b; ἔτος ἀ. Arist. Mete. 360b5; κύματα ἀ. bringing wind, Id. Pr. 932b29; σημεῖον ἀ. a sign of wind, Thphr. Sign. 18.
vain, idle, Hsch. s.v. κραπαταλίας.
swift as the wind, νεφέλα E. Ph. 163 (lyr.); δῖναι Ar. Av. 697; κόρα Lyr.Adesp. 106.

windy, Hom., but only metaph., ἀνεμώλια βάζειν talk words of wind, Il. 4.355, Od. 11.464; οἱ δʼ αὖτʼ ἀνεμώλιοι are like the winds, i.e. empty boasters, Il. 20.123; τί νυ τόξον ἔχεις ἀνεμώλιον αὔτως; why bear thy bow in vain? 21.474; δίκη ἀ., of a trial, Maiist. 38; ἔπεσεν . . ἀνεμώλιον αὔτως Theoc. 25.239; εἶπε δʼ ὕδωρ πίνειν, ἀνεμώλιος the empty fool! AP 11.61 ( Maced.); ἀ. ἀσπίδα θεῖναι make it powerless, i.e. harmless, Orph. L. 512.— Ep. and Ion. word, used by Luc. Astr. 2. (From ἄνεμος, with Aeol. ending -ώνιος, by dissimilation -ώλιος, Eust. 1214.27; cf. μετα-μώνιος.)
poppy anemone, Anemone coronaria, Cratin. 98, Pherecr. 108.25, Theoc. 5.92, Thphr. HP 7.10.2; ἀ. ἥμερος Dsc. 2.176.
ἀ. ἀγρία scarlet wind-flower, Anemone fulgens, ibid.; also called ἀ. φοινικῆ Crateuas Fr. 4; ἀ. λειμωνία Thphr. HP 6.8.1.
ἀ. ὀρεία, mountain wind-flower, Anemone blanda, ibid.; αἷμα ῥόδον τίκτει, τὰ δὲ δάκρυα τὰν ἀ. Bion 1.66.

data.quote: αἷμα ῥόδον τίκτει, τὰ δὲ δάκρυα τὰν ἀ.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀνεμῶναι λόγων flowers of speech (with suggestion of emptiness), Luc. Lex. 23.
ass sacrificed to the winds at Tarentum, Hsch.
she that stills the wind, Ἀθηνᾶ Paus. 4.35.8.

in want of naught, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1068c, AP 10.115; sup., Plot. 6.9.6, Dam. Pr. 13; πάντων ἀ. βίος Hdn. 8.7.5; τὸ ἀνενδεὲς τῆς τροφῆς IG 5(2).268.17 (Mantinea, Aug.). Adv. -εῶς faultlessly, unexceptionably, D.H. Rh. 1.5, D.Chr. 12.34; ἀ. ἐκτελέσας CIG 3989 (Laodicea Combusta), cf. 4085 ( Pessinus), SIG 888.21 (Maced.), PLond. 3.974i4 (iv A.D.).
completely, Iamb. Comm.Math. 10.
with no need of, βοηθείας Jul. Mis. 341c.
inadmissible, impossible, Ev.Luc. 17.1, Artem. 2.70.
not bound up with, νοῦς ἀ. σώματι Ph. 1.71.

unhesitating, Ph. 1.440, 2.36; indubitable, Id. 1.302, al., Luc. Herm. 67; unambiguous, Anon. in SE 61.15: Gramm., unquestionably correct, ἀ. καὶ ὑγιές A.D. Synt. 21.1. Adv. -τως 218.19; without doubt, Ph. 2.319; unhesitatingly, unequivocally, 1.351, POxy. 138.25 (610 A.D.).

unyielding, rigid, τόνος κλίνης Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.14.5; not giving way, Ph. 1.154, al.: metaph., προθυμία Hierocl. p.57.3A., Orib. Fr. 55; πάθος Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.89. Adv. -τως, διαθλεῖν Ph. 2.66, cf. Eustr. in EN 297.23.
not put on, Hsch. s.v. ἄφαροι.

definition: ἀνένεικα, Ion. aor. Act. of ἀναφέρω.

children.definition: one must refer, Plot. 4.4.38, Dam. Pr. 277.
inefficacious, Thphr. HP 9.17.1, Dsc. 2.111.
want of exercise, Sor. 1.106; inactivity, Alex.Aphr. de An. 74.27; as criticism of Sceptics by Stoics, Stoic. 2.36.
inefficacious, inactive, Ruf. Anat. 30, S.E. M. 7.30, cf. Alex.Aphr. de An. 39.8, Hierocl. in CA 21p.466M.; οὐσία Plot. 6.8.21.
not possessing an ἐνέργεια, of the Good, Plot. 5.6.6.
not actualized or realized, Procl. in R. 2.160K. in Prm. p.600S., in Ti. 3.32D.
Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).228 ( Comp.).

definition: ἀνενετεῖ ἀρνεῖται, τοῦ ἄνω νεύειν, ἢ ἀπαρνεῖται, Hsch.

children.definition: not liable to distraint, CPR 1.15 (i A.D.), etc.

definition: ἀνενήνοθεν ἀνῆγεν ἢ ἀνέβη, Hsch. ; cf. ἐνήνοθε.

children.definition: unimpassioned, ἡδοναί Plu. Amat. 2.751b; βίος ἀ. εἰς τιμήν ib. Suav. 1098d. Adv. -τως ib. Glor.Ath. 346b.
failing to consider, τοῦ θνητοῦ Phld. Mort. 38.

without conception of, τινός Plb. 2.35.6, Phld. Herc. 862.9, D.S. 1.8, Plot. 6.7.29, Procl. in Prm. p.484 S.; foll. by indirect qn., Alex.Aphr. de An. 175.14. Adv. -τως without the use of concepts, Eustr. in EN 40.7; without discursive thought, i.e. by intuition, Porph. Sent. 10.

children.label: II
children.definition: inconceivable, Cleom. 2.1; ἐννοεῖν τὰ -τα Dam. Pr. 7.
undisturbed, Hdn. 5.7.2, Hld. 5.19; of a sepulchre, CIG 2845.9 ( Aphrodisias), BGU 935.3 (iii/iv A.D.). Adv. ἀνενοχλήτως Ruf. and Aspasia ap. Aët. 16.50, Sch. E. Or. 630, Simp. in Ph. 1176.24.
without tension or force, Theopomp.Com. 71; without over-exertion, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.21.5.
without burial, Eust. 1278.60.
unsociable, ἤθη Plu. Lib.educ. 2.10a.
inaccessible to persuasion or influence, δικαιοσύνη ib. Isid. 355a, etc.
without doubt, An.Ox. 2.341.
ill-adapted, inappropriate, Hierocl. p.50.22A.
not heeding or respecting a thing, Hsch.; δαίμων Eranos 13.87 (inc. loc.).
unheard of, Sch. S. Aj. 318.
indelible, Isoc. 5.71, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.1b, PHolm. 22.43, cf. 1.12. Adv. -τως Hsch.
unchangeable, Procl. in Ti. 1.238D., Id. in Prm. p.599S.
unalienated, BGU 1151.43 (i B.C.), PLond. 2.360.9, etc., cf. Ath.Mitt. 3.58 ( Lydia).
freedom from deception or mistake, Arr. Epict. 3.2.2.
infallible, not to be deceived, Arist. Top. 132a32; πρός τι in a thing, Id. Pol. 1338a42, cf. Hierocl. in CA 23p.470M., al. Adv. -τως Ph. 1.483, Poll. 8.11.
not to be counted or told, Poll. 3.88, 4.162.

incapable of disproof or criticism, Th. 1.21; τὸν λόγον ἀ. ποιεῖν Arist. SE 176b24; ἀ. μᾶλλον ἢ πιθανήν difficult to disprove rather than credible, D.S. 1.40, etc.; ἀ. ἔχει τὸ ἀνδρεῖον leaves their courage without any real test or proof, Th. 4.126; unrefuted, Gal. 15.547. Adv. -τως X. Oec. 10.8, prob. in S.E. M. 7.191.2. of persons, not to be convicted, Antipho 2.1.10: of conduct, etc . . blameless, unexceptionable, X. Cyn. 13.7, D. 25.39, Plu. Pel. 4.
Hsch.
whose development cannot be fully exhausted, ταῖς ἡμετέραις ἐπιβολαῖς Dam. Pr. 177. Adv. -τως dub. l. S.E. M. 7.191.
not worked out, unfinished, Luc. Fug. 21, Gal. Nat.Fac. 2.3.
not to be searched out, Heraclit. 18, Ep.Rom. 11.33, D.C. 69.14.
not searched out, not inquired into or examined, D. 4.36, 21.218, Aeschin. 3.22.

children.label: II
children.definition: without inquiry or investigation, ὁ ἀ. βίος οὐ βιωτός ἀνθρώπῳ Pl. Ap. 38a. Adv. -τως Ph. 1.550, Plu. Mult. 2.94d, etc.

data.quote: ὁ ἀ. βίος οὐ βιωτός ἀνθρώπῳ

children.definition: not to be found out, ἀριθμός Th. 3.87, cf. Hellanic. 194J., Arist. Mu. 392a17, Plu. Sollert. 2.964a.
not to be told, μυστήρια Hsch. s.v. σεμνά.
unexplained, Gal. UP 2.7, Simp. in Ph. 241.21, Sch. Pi. N. 9.95.
unspeakable, ineffable, πέλαγος κάλλους Them. Or. 13.177d.
endurance, resignation, Sicilian word, Cic. Att. 5.11.5.
to be long-suffering, Charito 8.4.
forbearance, Plu. Util. 2.90e, Luc. Par. 53, Hld. 10.12; ἀ. πόνων patient endurance under . ., Hdn. 3.8.8, cf. Eun. Hist. p.258D.

enduring pain or evil, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.30.7, Luc. Jud.Voc. 9, Vett.Val. 38.21, Gal. 5.38, Them. Or. 15.190a ( Sup.), Aret. SA 2.6 ( Comp.); forbearing, long-suffering, 2 Ep.Ti. 2.24. Adv. -κως Luc. Asin. 2.
not dried up, Arist. Pr. 928a29, cf. Gal. 8.367.

definition: ἀνεξικώμη, ἡ, expl. by Hsch. as ἧς οὐκ ἂν ἀνάσχοιτο ὅλη κώμη, Cratin. 383, but rather ἡ ὅλην κώυην ἀνέχουσα.

children.definition: implacable, Ptol. Tetr. 162, Harp. s.v. ἀνίδρυτος.
to be reduced to a metallic state, Zos.Alch. p.153B.
indelible, βαφή Poll. 1.44.
with no outlet: inevitable, Hsch.
unsearchable, inscrutable, LXX Jb. 5.9, Ep.Rom. 11.33, Ep.Eph. 3.8.
with no issue or outlet, ἀ. ἐς φάος τρίβοι IGRom. 4.743 ( Eumeneia).
not to be alienated, CIG 2050 (Philippopolis, cf. BCH 27.318,prob. in IGRom. 4.1475 ( Smyrna).
with no outlet, not to be got out of impassable, Ἀχέρων Theoc. 12.19; δυσχωρίαι D.H. 3.59; λαβύρινθος AP 12.93 ( Rhian.).
ἡμέρα ἀ. unfit for an expedition, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.269e.

children.label: II
children.definition: not coming into public, unsocial, Mul.virt. ib. 242e, Def.orac. 426b, etc.; βίος Suav. 1098d; διάνοια Cons.ux. 610a; λόγοι ἀ. without practical result, Stoic.rep. 1034b.
not to be expressed, ineffable, Plu. QConv. 728d, Gorg. (?) ap. S.E. M. 7.82, Jul. Or. 5.158d.
without power, Gloss.
instaurare ludos, D.C. Fr. 51 ( Pass.).
without holidays or festive joy, βίος Democr. 230, cf. Plu. Suav. 2.1102b.
without festival, Alciphr. 3.49; ἑορταί ἀ. festivals unkept, D.H. 8.25, but, impious festivals, Ph. 2.320: c. gen., ἀ. ἱερῶν without share in festal rites, E. El. 310.
Hsch.
not announced, πόλεμος ἀ. a war begun without formal declaration, Plb. 4.16.4.
uninvited, ἀ. φοιτᾶν ἐπὶ δεῖπνον Cratin. 44.
unperceived, imperceptible, Ti.Locr. 100b, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1062b, Luc. Sat. 33. Adv. -τως Simp. in Cat. 309.3.
Act., not perceiving, τινός Plb. 28.1.6, Longin. 4.1. OGI 194 (Egypt). Adv. -τως Ph. Fr. 70H., Hippiatr. 38, Syrian. in Metaph. 100.38, Simp. in Ph. 1198.39.
inaudible, Agathocl. 2.
having no cause for shame, 2 Ep.Ti. 2.15; μηδὲ -τον ἡγοῦ J. AJ 18.7.1.
unimpeached, J. AJ 4.8.38.
not brought in or home, Ph. 1.139.
not alternating, ἀ. ζῷα animals in which the upper and lower teeth do not lock into one another, but meet flat, opp. καρχαρόδοντα, Arist. HA 501a17.
not to be brought back, ἀ. ἐκβάλλεσθαι Ph. 1.139, cf. 2.338 (dub.).
irreparable, ἀτύχημα J. AJ 16.11.3; incorrigible, Iamb. VP 22.102; uncorrected, Plu. Adul. 2.49b, Arr. Epict. 3.1.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: not to be amended, perfect, Ph. 2.614.
unaugmented, An.Ox. 4.180.

untouched, unharmed, ἀ. παρέχειν τι D. 35.24, cf. Syngr. ib. 11; ἀ. σώματα not liable to seizure, Men. Per. 8; ἐλευθέρα ἔστω καί ἀ. GDI 1532, cf. Thphr. Fr. 97.2, IG 2.584 c, BGU 193.19 (ii A.D.); ὑποθήκη PHamb. 28.8 (ii B.C.); unencumbered, οἰκία PThcad. 1.12 (iv A.D.): c. gen., unharmed by, ὕβρεως M.Ant. 3.4. Adv. -φως Suid.
X. Smp. 8.15, Com.Adesp. 123, Alciphr. 3.60.
not burdensome, without offence, Plu. Cat.Mi. 8, Pomp. 1; σκώμματα Luc. Ep.Sat. 34.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -θῶς, προσομιλεῖν Th. 2.37; λέγειν Luc. Sol. 5.
not taking offence, ἀνεπαχθῶς φέρειν Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.102e.
without discomfort, Jul. Or. 6.191d.
not adventitious, native, instinctive, Sch. Opp. H. 1.705.
not lengthened, A.D. Synt. 110.14, al.; of declensions, parisyllabic, D.T. 632.10.
not coming back, Sch. S. El. 182.
not wrought out, imperfect, Simp. in de An. 4.13, Eust. 499.2.
unexplained, ἀ. καταλιπεῖν Gal. 15.14 (al. ἀνεπιζήτητος).
not supported, Iamb. Comm.Math. 8.
not asked for or arranged for, τὸ μὴ προσήκειν ἀ. τρέχειν τόκον Just. Nov. 136.4.

data.quote: τὸ μὴ προσήκειν ἀ. τρέχειν τόκον

children.definition: free from injury or insult, unmolested, D.S. 31.8, Memn. 2.3, J. AJ 14.10.6, PFlor. 91.17 (ii A.D.), cf. BGU 1022.24: Medic., uninjured, Archig. ap. Orib. 8.1.6, Id. ap. Aët. 8.73. Adv. -τως J. AJ 16.2.5.
without a word, speechless, Hsch.
unburdened, πόλις IGRom 4.219 ( Ilium), cf. IG 7.2711, SIG 799.16 ( Cyzicus), Ath.Mitt. 33.382 (Pergam.).
prohibition of traffic or intercourse, IG 4.752.6 ( Troezen), Heraclit. Ep. 9.8.
not to be climbed, γυμνῷ ποδί Str. 12.3.11; inaccessible, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.228b.
inattentive, heedless, prob.l. Phld. D. 1.14, Mus. p.80K.

without plots, and so, 1. Act., not plotting, τὸ ἀ. πρὸς ἀλλήλους the absence of intrigue, Th. 3.37; not insidious, λόγος Aristid. Rh. 2p.445S. 2. Pass., not plotted against, not liable to attack, ἀ. φθόνῳ Com.Adesp. 1212, cf. Plb. 7.8.4, Agatharch. 42, Ael. NA 9.59, etc. Adv. -τως Ph. 2.645, Suid. s.v. Ξάνθος.
not exposed to treachery, PSI 1.96.3 (V A.D.). Adv. -λως without treachery, Fust.905.57.
ignorant, unconscious, τινός Porph. Abst. 1.45.
not distinctly known, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.41.44; τὸ ἀ. τῆς συμβολῆς J. AJ 12.2.11:— Act., not knowing distinctly, τινός Simp. in de An. 299.37. Adv. -τως not noticeably, Plb. 18.18.16.
without title or inscription, χιτωνίσκιον ἀ. (for the names of those who offered vestments were embroidered upon them) IG 2.754.28, al., ib. 7.303.102 ( Oropus), etc.; μέσσοροι Tab.Heracl. l.c.
unregistered: hence, free of charge, of a harvest, γένημα ἀ. PGnom. 234 ( ii A.D., cf. Plb. 8.31.6, D.S. 1.64, etc.: metaph., without distinguishing marks, Luc. Nec. 15; unmarked, Cat. 25.
on which no money has been borrowed, not mortgaged, IG 12(7).515 ( Amorgos), BGU 193.19 (ii A.D.), Sch. Luc. JTr. 48.
v.l. in Pl. Lg. 947e, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.16; ἀ. τινος Ph. 1.334, al., Luc. DMort. 8[26].2.
make clear, show, Gal. 1.172.
not able to be shown, Herophil. ap. S.E. M. 11.50.
not exhibited, IG 7.3073.172 (Lebad.).
unsupported by proof, αἰτία Gorg. Pal. 4.
not accepting or admitting, νόμων Phld. Rh. 1.383S.; κοκοῦ S.E. M. 9.33, cf. D.L. 3.77, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 393.13, Id. in Top. 210.16.
not bandaged, Hp. Fract. 20; not requiring a bandage, of plasters, Dsc. 5.85, Damocr. ap. Gal. 13.915.
not manifest or observable, Ptol. Harm. 1.4.

without the process of ἐπιδικασία, by which claims to inheritance or guardianship were enforced, ἀ. ἔχειν τά πατρῷα Is. 3.59; παραλαμβάνειν ἀ. τὴν ἀγχιστείαν Id. 8.34 (cj.); ἀ. ἔχειν κλῆρον D. 46.22, cf. Poll. 3.33.
unexpected, Simon. 62.
not growing or sprouting, Thphr. HP 7.4.8, CP 4.6.3.
unfairness, unkindness, D. 29.3.

unreasonable, unfair, Th. 3.66, Ar. Fr. 50D., Phld. Ir. p.57W., Alex.Aphr. in Top. 208.9: neut. as Adv., without consideration, PGiss. 39.3 (ca. 200 B.C.): regul. Adv. -κῶς Arr. An. 7.29.1, Poll. 8.13.
absence of inquiry, Andronic.Rhod. p.572 M., [add Chrysipp. fr. 432].
leaving nothing to be desired, IPE 12.39.8 ( Olbia). 2. v.l. for ἀνεπεξήγητος, uninvestigated, Gal. 15.14.
admitting no addition, Dicaearch. 59.7.
not overlooked, or controlled, Gal. 19.548.
untroubled, unpolluted, S.E. M. 1.303, Procl. in Alc. p.251C.
without desire, opp. ἐπιθυμητικός, Stob. 2.6.14, Chaerem.Hist. 4.
openly, v.l. in D.S. 2.21.
free from sunburn, πρόσωπα Dsc. 2.50.
not under orders, φύσις, metaph. of untilled land, Ph. 2.207. Adv. -τως 1.115.
Hsch.; πολέμιοι Procop. Aed. 4.1.
without danger, Procop. Aed. 5.3.
not assigned by lot, IG 2.789a28, al.
free from blame, unimpeachable, X. Cyr. 2.1.22; πίστις J. AJ 18.9.4: Comp. -ότερος X. Ages. 1.5. Adv. -τως D.C. 39.22.

children.label: II
children.definition: without preferring any charge. Adv. -τως Th. 1.92.
unwavering, Simp. in Cat. 201.31.
not liable to inundation, τεῖχος J. AJ 2.10.2.
not social or gregarious, Eust. 73.38.
not insulted, EM 103.35, cf. Hsch.
without succour, Philem. 213.2, Onos. 3.

definition: ἀνεπικράτητος [ρᾰ], ον, without dominant planet, γένεσις Vett.Val. 151.
ἀνεπικρισία, ἡ, inability to form a judgement, S.E. M. 11.182.

children.definition: not decided, indeterminate, πράγματα Aristocl. ap. Eus. PE 14.18, cf. S.E. P. 1.98, etc. Adv. -τως Id. M. 11.230.
indistinct, indeterminate, φαντασία Plot. 3.6.4.
untested, untried, ἡ διαφωνία ἡ ἀ., t.t. of the Empirics, Gal. 1.78.
not officially examined, POxy. 257.23 (ii A.D.), etc.; of a question, etc., unexamined, Simp. in Ph. 1148.29.
unconcealed, M.Ant. 1.14.
unhindered, J. AJ 18.6.4, Onos. 35.2. Adv. -τως without let or hindrance, IPE 2.52 ( Panticapaeum); without restraint, D.S. 17.116, Decr. ap. J. AJ 19.5.3, Alciphr. 3.8.
unfailing, Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 89.13, Them. in Ph. 81.27.

not open to attack, τοῖς ἐχθροῖς Th. 5.17; not censured, blameless, βίος v.l. in E. Or. 922, X. Cyr. 1.2.15; perfect, τέχνη Ph. 1.15; ἀνεπιληπτότερον less open to criticism, Pl. Phlb. 43c; ἐξουσία ἀ. not subject to control, D.H. 2.14; unassailable, not subject to cancellation, συγγραφαί PTaur. 1.7.15. Adv. -τως X. An. 7.6.37, Ph. 2.2, al.
not to be forgotten, Aristaenet. 2.13, Hsch. s.v. ἀλαστοῖς. Adv. -τως Sch. Od. 14.174.

unable to consider, c. gen., τῶν ἐναργειῶν Diogenian.Epicur. 3.25; inconsiderate, thoughtless, Epicur. Sent.Vat. 63, Sor. 1.48; τῶν παθῶν Phld. Ir. p.24W., Mitteis Chr. 361 (iv A. D.). Adv. ἀνεπιλογίστως Pl. Ax. 365d, 369e:— Subst. ἀνεπιλογιστία, ἡ, Sch. Od. 15.225:—Verb ἀνεπιλογιστέω, Phld. Ir. p.19 W. ( Pass.).
unbandaged, Crito ap. Gal. 13.708.

children.label: II
children.definition: unsolved, Olymp. in Cat. 111.15.
uncared for, Sch. A.R. 1.1175, Gp. 12.29.1.
unmixed with, τῷ ἔξω Arist. Spir. 483b1; pure from, ῥυπαρίας Dsc. 5.126, cf. Eup. Praef., Eustr. in EN 294.12: abs., σπέρματα J. AJ 4.8.20, cf. Max.Tyr. 40.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: avoiding contact, Epicur. Sent. 39; not mixing with others, unsocial, βίος ἀ. ὁμιλίαις Plu. Def.orac. 2.438c; δίαιτα ἀ. Id. Rom. 3; τό ἀ., = ἀνεπιμιξία, Str. 8.1.2: of a country, unfrequented, unvisited, ξενικαῖς δυνάμεσι D.S. 5.21, cf. Plu. Exil. 2.604b; ψυχὴ ἀ. πάθεσι ib. Bruta anim. 989c; ποιῆσαί τι ἀ. ἑαυτῷ to make it alien from oneself, D.S. 5.17, cf. Phld. Rh. 1.121S.
want of intercourse or traffic, Plb. 16.29.12, App. Mith. 93.
not enduring long, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.7b, Vett.Val. 40.22.
Od. 13.42:—also ἀνεπί-μωμος, ον, Phot.
inconceivability, S.E. M. 3.57.
unintelligible, σημεῖα τοῖς ἄλλοις ἀ. D.S. 19.94; inconceivable, unthinkable, S.E. P. 2.104, Dam. Pr. 22. Adv. -τως inconceivably, Procl. in Prm. p.864S., Id. in Ti. 1.3D.
Act., having no experience of, τινός D.S. 2.59.
= sine adinventione, Just. Nov. 59.7.
not polished, not finished, δόμος Hes. Op. 746, Them. Or. 26.388b.
not plastered over: metaph., unaffected, D.L. 2.117.
without connexion with others, isolated, Str. 2.5.8, al.
not liable to be reproved, Eup. 397; βίος E. Or. 922, Men. Epit. 489. Adv. -τως Hsch., f.l. in Ph. 2.454.
not reproved, licentious, τροφῇ ἀ. τραφῆναι Pl. Lg. 695b, cf. Eus.Mynd. 62.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not reproving or blaming, τὸ ἀ. abstinence from blame or criticism, M.Ant. 1.10.
impunity, licentiousness, Pl. Lg. 695b.
not occultable, Procl. Hyp. 5.12, cf. Eustr. in APo. 192.33: metaph., τῷ ἀσωμάτῳ τὸ ἔνογκον -θητον the material forms no obstacle to the incorporeal, Porph. Sent. 27. Adv. -τως Eust. 1138.59.
not dedicated, χυτρόποδες Hes. Op. 748.
without demur or subterfuge, PAmh. 2.147.11 (iv/v A.D.).
undistinguished, κατὰ τὴν ἐσθῆτα Plb. 5.81.3; unrecorded, unnoticed, ἀ. τινα or τι παραλιπεῖν Id. 11.2.1, D.S. 11.59, cf. Phld. Sign. 34. Adv. -τως without notice, Aps. p.259H.

children.label: II
children.definition: without an attack of ἐπισημασία (q.v.), Gal. 14.277.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., not conferring distinction, σοφοῖς ἀνδράσι Darius ap. D.L. 9.14.
inattentive, inconsiderate, πρᾶγμα Ph. 5.143 C.; ἀλογία Porph. Abst. 1.43; ὁρμή Procop. Goth. 4.32. Adv. -τως Hdt. 2.45; ἀ. ἔχειν τινός to give no consideration to . ., Arist. GA 778b10.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., not examined, unregarded, X. Mem. 2.4.3; unobserved, Anon. in SE 12.27.
without equipment, IG 2.789b27, al.
disregard, Arist. APo. 79a6.
not in the shade, Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 19.15.
unregarded, Eustr. in APo. 202.19.
Hsch.
not obscured or overclouded, Gal. UP 10.2, Ptol. Tetr. 100, Heph.Astr. 1.25 [76]; and so prob. Procl. Par.Ptol. 144 ( -ιστος codd.).
exemption from billeting, IGRom. 4.295, Sammelb. 4224.15.
exempt from billeting, Plb. 15.24.2:—also ἀνεπί-σταθμος, ον, OGI 262.13 ( Baetocaece), PTeb. 5.168 (ii B.C.).
inattention, thoughtlessness, Pl. Ax. 365d; distraction, insensateness (of passion), Phld. Ir. p.33 W.; want of reflection, Simp. in Cael. 163.35, al.
without inspector, without tutelary genius, Max.Tyr. 14.8, cf. Hsch.
inattentive, Plb. 5.34.4, Phld. Ir. p.44 W.; τινός to a thing, Porph. Abst. 1.9. Adv. -τως Plb. 1.4.4, Longin. 33.4, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.5.11; without a check, Plb. 10.47.9, etc.
Pass., not attended to, unregarded, Ptol. Alm. 10.6, cf. Simp. in Cael. 163.35. Adv. -τως Porph. in Cat. 65.22.
without guidance, ὀχεῖαι Ph. 2.309.4. ill-considered, Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 9.2, Simp. in Cael. 157.11. Adv. ἀνεπιστάτως ib. 89.12.
to be ignorant, EM 23.24.
non-scientific, πρᾶξις Arist. EE 1220b25.

want of knowledge, ignorance, unskilfulness, Th. 5.7; of bees, Arist. HA 626b4; τινός Pl. R. 560b: want of science, opp. ἐπιστήμη, ib. 350a, al., Plot. 6.1.10: pl., X. Oec. 20.21; of κακία, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.60.

definition: ἀνεπιστήμων, Dor. -άμων Archyt. 3, ον, gen. ονος,

children.definition: ignorant, unskilful, Hdt. 9.62, Th. 7.67, etc.; νῆες ἀνεπιστήμονες ships with unskilful crews, opp. ἔμπειροι, Id. 2.89: so μηδὲν ἀ. ἐᾶν leave no part untrained, Pl. Lg. 795c; ἀ. τινός or περί τινος unskilled in a thing, Hp. VM 1, Pl. Prt. 350b, Tht. 202c: c. inf., not knowing how to do a thing, X. Mem. 2.3.7: foll. by relat., ἀ. ὅτι . . not knowing that . ., Th. 5.111; ἀ. ὅπῃ τράπωνται Id. 3.112. Adv. -μόνως Pl. Lg. 636e, X. Cyn. 3.11, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: without knowledge, unintelligent, Pl. R. 350b, etc.; ἡ δʼ ἑτέρη [γνώμη] ἀνεπιστημονεστέρη μέν ἐστι τῆς ἑτέρης less intelligent, Hdt. 2.21.

data.quote: ἡ δʼ ἑτέρη [γνώμη] ἀνεπιστημονεστέρη μέν ἐστι τῆς ἑτέρης

children.definition: not the object of knowledge, Eustr. in APo 45.9.
to be indifferent, pay no heed, D.L. 6.91, Arr. Epict. 2.5.9, Vett.Val. 43.27, Artem. 3.42, POxy. 486.10 (ii A.D.).

without turning round: hence metaph., indifferent, heedless, πάντων Phld. Herc. 1251.17, cf. Artem. 2.37. Adv. -τως Arr. Epict. 2.9.4, PMag.Par. 1.45: also -τεί or -τί Ph. 1.90 ( -τί), Plu. Aud. 2.46e, Def.orac. 418b, PMag.Lond. 121.439.
= foreg., ἀ. τινος careless of, Placit. 1.7.7; inexorable, τὸ ἀ. τῆς δίκης Corn. ND 21.
want of regard, heedlessness, Arr. Epict. 2.1.14.

Ar.Byz. Epit. 100.10; ἀ. πρός τι Simp. in de An. 79.5; τινός Eustr. in EN 110.2; ἀ. τι ἔχειν to be inattentive to, Sophon. in de An.20.34. Adv. -φως dub. in Hdn. 7.10.4; ἀ. κρέμασθαι, of a bat, Trypho Trop. 1.4.
not capable of inversion, Procl. Inst. 44.
Them. Or. 15.190a, Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 40.18, 41.3.
not to be stopped, ὁρμή J. Vit. 51; φορή Aret. SD 2.5; σακρύων ἀ. πηγαί Aristaenet. 2.5; of persons, Ph. 2.268. Adv. -τως Id. 1.296, Plu. Ages. 27.
subject to no control, τῆς ἀ. πᾶσιν ἐς τήν δίαιταν ἐξουσίας Th. 7.69, cf. Plu. Bruta anim. 2.987b. Adv. -τως without orders or command, J. AJ 19.2.2, D.L. 5.20.

data.quote: τῆς ἀ. πᾶσιν ἐς τήν δίαιταν ἐξουσίας

children.definition: not to be extended farther, S.E. M. 10.272.

not capable of τὸ μᾶλλον, opp. ἀνάνετος, διαφορά Porph. Intr. 20.4; ἕξεις in Cat. 138.5. Adv. -τως without augmentation or intensification, Procl. Inst. 52; without stress, opp. μετʼ ἐπιτάσεως, Ammon. in Int. 11.26 (misplaced).
enjoin, Eustr. in EN 370.24.
not properly executed (incorrect form). Sammelb. 4512.79.
not hitting the mark, vain, Sch. E. Ph. 1387: c. gen., ἀ. ἀγαθῶν βίος Vett.Val. 173.14, cf. Ptol. Tetr. 157. Adv. -τως Heph.Astr. 3.20.
failure to attain, Heph.Astr. 2.30.
without design. Adv. -τως Placit. 4.11.3.

definition: ἀνεπιτήδειος, ον ( α, ον Gp. 5.26.3), Ion. ἀνεπιτήδεος, η, ον:—

children.definition: unserviceable, unfit, of persons and things, X. HG. 6.4, etc.; πρός τι Pl. Sph. 219a; in a positively bad sense, mischievous, prejudicial, Hdt. 1.175, Th. 3.71; γνῶναί τι ἀ. περί τινος And. 2.28; of bad omens, X. HG 1.4.12; of food, Hp. Acut. 17 ( Comp.), VM 20: c. inf., unfitted to . ., Lys. 31.2. Adv. -ως, πράττειν fare ill, opp. εὖ πράττειν, ib. 5; ἀ. ἔχειν Plu. Praec. 2.819a: Comp. -ότερον Pl. Lg. 813b.
unkind, unfriendly, X. HG 7.4.6; ἄλλους τινὰς ἀ. ἀνήλωσαν, i.e. political opponents, Th. 8.65; στῆλαι ἀ. IG 2(2).43A34.
unfitness, inconvenience, inaptitude, Ph. 1.191, 521, M.Ant. 5.5, Procl. Inst. 143.
made without care or design, artless, D.H. Comp. 22, cf. 25, Onos. 10.3, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 44. Adv. -τως Phld. Rh. 1.156 S., D.H. Lys. 8, Luc. Pisc. 12.

children.label: II
children.definition: unpractised, untried, οὐδέν ἀμίμητον οὐδʼ ἀ. Plu. Alc. 23. Adv. -τως, γλώττης οὐκ ἀ. εἶχεν Philostr. VA 7.27.
not to be censured, Arist. EN 1154b4, etc.; τινός for a thing, D. 61.54; uncriticized, Isoc. 12.245.
unpunished, Plb. 35.2.8, Onos. Praef. 6, Ph. 1.219.

children.label: II
children.definition: not estimated or rated, IG 2(2).1241.14, cf. 2.1059.7.
subject to no deduction or restriction, μισθώσεις, ἀπολογία, Hsch.
without permission, LXX 3 Ma. 1.20.
without guardian, Ph. 1.219: metaph., ib. 696, cf. Gal. Nat.Fac. 2.3:— also ἀνεπί-τροπος, ον, Phryn. PS p.12 B.
undistinguished, obscure, J. AJ 17.10.7: Comp., Ptol. Tetr. 168.
without ostentation, Ph. 2.76, Vett.Val. 16.21; insignificant, ἀποτελέσεις Paul.Al. F. 1. Adv. -τως M.Ant. 1.9.
unexpected, Ph. 2.533 (v.l. for -φαντος), Hsch. Adv. -τως Ph. 2.521, Suid.
unenvied, EM 81.25.

without reproach, ἔγχος S. Tr. 1033 (lyr.); ἀ. ἐστι πᾶσιν it is no reproach to any one, Th. 6.83, cf. Pl. R. 612b, Epicur. Fr. 161; οὕτω γάρ μοι . . ἀνεπιφθονώτατον εἰπεῖν least invidious, D. 18.321; ungrudging, ἔπαινος Onos. Praef. 10. Adv. [ τὴν ἀρχὴν] ἀνεπιφθόνως κατεστήσατο so as not to create odium, Th. 6.54, cf. Plu. Cam. 1; ἀ. εἰπεῖν Isoc. 15.8.
unthought of, δύαι Semon. 1.21.
lacking in refinement, Vett.Val. 75.23.
unassailable, Plu. Caes. 25; = ἀνεπιβούλευτος, Hsch.
unattempted, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1075d.
not admitted among the ἐπόπται, Hyp. Fr. 174, cf. Poll. 8.124.
not to be discerned or distinguished, Poll. 5.150.
to be roused by anger, Phld. Lib. p.41 O.
not in sight, Suid.
love again, love anew, c. gen., And. 1.127, and perh. X. Mem. 3.5.7 (cj.).
ignorance of love, Them. Or. 13.163d.
loveless, ἔρωτες D.Chr. 7.133, cf. Plu. Pyth. 2.406a, etc.; ἀ. κοινωνία, ὁμιλία, ib. Amat. 752c, 756e; τὸ ἀ. ἑτέρων want of love for . ., ib. QConv. 634b; βίος AP 12.18 ( Alph.).
not loved. Luc. DMort. 16[6].3.
unlovely, Chor. in Rh.Mus. 49.498.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not loving, Hld. 3.9, Aristaenet. 1.10; unloving, cruel, harsh, Call. Epigr. 34.4 ( Sup.), Luc. DDeor. 16[14]1; ἀνέραστα ποιεῖν Plu. Adul. 2.61a.
knead, work up, Orib. 9.39.2.
unemployment, idleness, in pl., Artem. 1.67, 2.28 (v.l. ἀνεργίας.).

not thoroughly wrought, imperfect, Arist. Metaph. 1048b4; λίθος ἀ. unwrought, D.S. 14.18; γῆ ἀ. untilled, dub. l. in Luc. Prom. 11; σῖτος ἀ. raw, J. BJ 5.10.2: - of a subject, not thoroughly handled or treated, Plb. 10.43.1.
cessation from work, holiday, J. BJ 4.9.12 (dub.).
Artem. 2.28.
not done, ἔργα ἄ., Lat. facta infecta, E. Hel. 363.
Edict.Diocl. 8.13, al.
inactive, opp. ἐνεργός, v.l. in J. AJ 16.2.4.
provoke, stir up, excite, J. AJ 19.7.1, Plu. Thes. 6:— Pass., to be in a state of excitement, Th. 2.21, X. An. 6.6.9, Plu. Pyrrh. 11; εἴς τι Dam. Pr. 150.
prop up, rest a thing on, τὸ πρόπσωπον τῇ χειρί dub. in Aristaenet. 1.22.
not bruised, unground, Hp. Aff. 52.

definition: ἀνερείπομαι, Ep. Dep., used by Hom. only in 3 pl. aor.,

children.definition: snatch up and carry off, ἀνηρείψαντο, of the gods, Il. 20.234, cf. Pi. Pae. 6.136, A.R. 2.503; of the Harpies, Od. 1.241, etc.; of storms, 4.727; so παῖδα . . Ἀφροδίτη ὦρτʼ ἀνερειψαμένη Hes. Th. 990; τὴν Ἀργὼ οὐρανὸς ἀνηρείψατο Them. Or. 27.333a:—later, take upon oneself, πόνον Orph. A. 290. (The true spelling is prob. ἀνηρεψ-, which has Ms. authority in Hes. l.c. and A.R. 1.214; cf. ἀ[νᾱ]ρέψατο Pi. Pae. l.c., and ἀνερεψάμενοι, Hsch.: v. ἅρπυια.)

definition: ἀνερέπτομαι, Pass., στόμαχος ἀνερεπτόμενος the stomach

children.definition: drawn up spasmodically so as to cause vomiting, dub. l. in Nic. Al. 256, cf. AB 401.
throw up, disgorge, ἀνήρῠγεν ἀτμόν ( aor. 2) Nonn. D. 1.239; ἰωήν ib. 485:— Pass., discharge itself, of a river, Arist. Mu. 392b16, A.R. 2.744.
pallid, Archig. ap. Aët. 16.106 (bis), but prob. f.l. for ἐνερευθής.
search out, examine, investigate, λόγους Pl. Phd. 63a; ἔγγραφα POxy. 146818 (iii A. D.):—in Med., Pl. Lg. 816c, J. AJ 19.1.15:— Pass., BJ 2.8.6.
a searching out, Tz.ad Lyc. 11.
not investigated, Pl. Hp.Ma. 298c; ἀ. παραλιπεῖν τι Arist. EN 1181b12.
that cannot be searched or found out, v.l. in Pl. Cra. 421d; ἀνερεύνητα δυσθυμεῖσθαι harass oneself about inscrutable things, f.l. in E. Ion 255.
unbribed, uncorrupted, GDI 13585 ( Calymna), Michel 473 ( Mylasa); not honeycombed by intrigues, ἡγεμονία Ph. 2.555, cf. 538.
not ripened by caprification, of figs, Thphr. HP 2.8.3, CP 2.9.12, Suid.; cf. ἀνηρίναστος.
unprotected, Q.S. 3.494.
without ballast, ὥσπερ τὰ ἀ. πλοῖα Pl. Tht. 144a; unstable, Olymp. in Mete. 147.4, cf. Gal. UP 2.14.
ἀ. τράπεζα an empty table, Plu. QConv. 2.704b; unstable, εἶδος Dam. Pr. 413; also of persons, without ballast, Ph. 2.451, Plu. Affect. 2.501d, Plot. 1.8.8; ἀ. ἐαθέντα τὰ μεγάλα Longin. 2.2.
with none to interpret, E. Hyps.Fr. 1 iv18.

children.label: II
children.definition: inexplicable, indescribable, τῷ πέλας S.E. M. 7.65; ὀδύνη Aristaenet. 2.5.

definition: ἀνερπύζω, = sq., Opp. H. 4.289, Dionys. Av. 1.31.

children.definition: creep upwards, E. Ph. 1178: aor. ἀνείρπῠσα Ar. Pax 585, Luc. Nec. 22, etc.; of ivy, E. Fr. 88; spring up, of water, Call. Ap. 110; ἀ. πρὸς τὸ μετεωρότερον Arist. PA 688a10; ἐστὰς ῥῖνας Hp. Vict. 3.76.
go quite away, take oneself off, Eup. 221 (in aor. ἀνήρρησα).
unblushing, Ph. 2.664.
begin to blush, blush up, Pl. Chrm. 158c, X. Smp. 3.12.
draw up, ἀνά θʼ ἱστία λεύκʼ ἐρύσαντες Od. 9.77, 12.402; ἀνειρύσαι νῆας, = ἀνελκύσαι, Hdt. 9.96, cf. A.R. 2.586; ἀ. πέπλως Theoc. 14.35:— Med., ἐκ νούσου ἀνειρύσω AP 6.300 ( Leon.).

go up, ἀνελθὼν ἐς σκοπιήν Od. 10.97; εἰς τὴν ἀκρόπολιν X. HG 2.4.39; ἐπὶ τὴν σκηνήν Arr. Epict. 3.22.26; ἐπὶ βῆμα Hdn. 1.5.2: abs., mount the tribune, Plu. Aem. 31; go up from the coast inland, Od. 19.190; come up from the nether world, ἀ. ἐξ Ἀΐδεω Thgn. 703; κἀξ Ἅιδου θανὼν πρὸς φῶς ἀ. S. Ph. 625; ἐξ Ἅιδου εἰς θεούς Pl. R. 521c.

data.quote: κἀξ Ἅιδου θανὼν πρὸς φῶς ἀ.

children.definition: grow up, shoot up, Od. 6.163, 167; of the sun, rise, A. Ag. 658; ἀ. ὠκεανοῖο A.R. 3.1230; of water, rise, Arist. Mete. 358b32, Heph.Astr. 1.23: metaph., ὄλβος ἀ. E. Or. 810.
go up to a first principle, in argument, ἐπʼ ἀρχὴν ἀνελθόντες σκοπεῖν Pl. R. 511d.

children.label: II
children.definition: go or come back, return, ἂψ or αὖθις ἀ. Il. 4.392, Od. 1.317.
come back to a point, recur to it and say, ἄνελθέ μοι πάλιν τί . . E. Ph. 1207, cf. Ion 933; πάλιν ἐπʼ ἀρχὴν ἀ. v.l. in Pl. Ti. 69a.
νόμος . . εἴς σʼ ἀνελθὼν εἰ διαφθαρήσεται being brought home to you, E. Hec. 802. [In Il. 4.392, A.R. 1.821, ᾱνερχομένῳ is corrupt.]

children.label: III
children.definition: traverse, νειόν Call. Aet. Fr. 7.4P. [Fr. 24.4 Pf.]

definition: ἀνερῶ, Att. fut. of ἀναγορεύω; v. ἀνεῖπον.

children.definition: question, c. acc. pers., καί μιν ἀνηρώτων Od. 4.251, cf. Pl. R. 454c; ἐμαυτὸν ὑπέρ τινος Id. Ap. 22d; τινὰ περί τινος Hdt. 9.89:— Pass., Pl. Grg. 455d.
inquire into, τὰς δόξας Id. Men. 84d, al.
question a person about a thing, E. IT 664, Ar. Pl. 499, Pl. Tht. 143d.
one must interrogate, Pl. Phlb. 63c.
eat away, of ulcers, etc., in Pass., Hp. Epid. 4.1, Aret. SD 1.13. ἀνεσθίων· μηκέτι ἐσθιομένων, Hsch.
Cratin. 20.
given up to idleness, ἀ. ἡμέρα a holiday, Sch. Th. 7.73; loose, Sch. Lyc. 18.

definition: ἄνεσις, gen. εως, Ion. ιος, ἡ: ( ἀνιημι):—

children.definition: loosening, relaxing, τῶν χορδῶν of the strings, opp. ἐπίτασις, Pl. R. 349e; coupled with χάλασις, ib. 590b; τῆς αἰσθήσεως . . δεσμὸν τὸν ὕπνον εἶναί φαμεν, τὴν δέ . . ἄνεσιν ἐγρήγορσιν Arist. Somn.Vig. 454b27; ἀέρος Thphr. CP 2.1.6; πάγων ἄ., i.e. a thaw, Plu. Sert. 17; of the ebb-tide, Str. 7.2.1.

data.quote: τῆς αἰσθήσεως . . δεσμὸν τὸν ὕπνον εἶναί φαμεν, τὴν δέ . . ἄνεσιν ἐγρήγορσιν

children.definition: remission, abatement, κακῶν Hdt. 5.28; opp. θλῖψις, 2 Ep.Cor. 8.13, al.; λύπης, μοχθηρίας, etc., Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.102b, etc.; τὴν ἡδονὴν ἄνεσιν λαμβάνειν Phld. D. 3 Fr. 1; ἄ. φόρων, τελῶν, remission of tribute, taxes, Plu. Sert. 6, IG 7.2227 ( Thisbe), etc.; κολάσεως Plot. 4.3.24; of fevers, opp. παροξυσμός, Gal. 7.427.
relaxation, recreation, opp. σπουδή, Pl. Lg. 724a, Arist. Rh. 1371b34, cf. Cleanth.Stoic. 1.122; ἄ. καὶ σχολή Plb. 1.66.10; ψυχῆς Mnesith.Ath. ap. Ath. 11.484a.
solution, Dsc. 5.96.
Archig. ap. Gal. 7.424.

children.label: II
children.definition: indulgence, licence, ἡδονῶν Pl. R. 561a; ἡ τῶν γυναικῶν παρʼ ὑμῖν ἄ. Id. Lg. 637c, cf. Arist. Pol. 1270a1; δούλων ib. 1313b35; relaxation of custody, Act. Ap. 24.23.

data.quote: ἡ τῶν γυναικῶν παρʼ ὑμῖν ἄ.

children.label: III
children.definition: Aristid.Quint. 1.5; of an unaccented syll., Phld. Po. 2.18.

definition: ἀνέσσυτο, 3 sg. Ep. aor. Pass. of ἀνασεύω, Il. 11.458.
ἀνεσταλμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἀναστέλλω,

children.definition: tucked up, gloss on ἐπιστολάδην, Sch. Hes. Sc. 287.

without hearth and home, homeless, Il. 9.63; ἄπαις τε κἀγύναιξ κἀνέστιος S. Fr. 4, cf. Ar. Eq. 1266; ἄοικος καὶ ἀ. Luc. Sacr. 11, cf. Eus.Mynd. 59: metaph., ψυχή Max.Tyr. 14.8; savage, ἄγρη Opp. H. 2.417.

definition: ἀνεστραμμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἀναστρέφω,

children.definition: inversely, EM 584.20; perversely, PTeb. 25.16 (ii B. C.).
inquire of, ἀλλήλους τὴν αἰτίαν LXX Su. 14 ( Thd.), Jd. 6.29 (cod. A).

children.label: II
children.definition: examine documents, POxy. 34i13; examine by torture, τινά Act.Ap. 22.24, cf. 29.
without friends or fellows, Plu. Praec. 2.807a.
one must relax, Pl. Sph. 254b: c. gen., τῆς ἀκριβεστέρας οἰκονομίας Phld. Oec. p.73 J.; one must loosen, Gal. 17(1).434; one must let slip, Pl. Smp. 217c, Plt. 291c.
one must permit, Sor. 1.108.
one must dilute, Orib. Fr. 54.
unchangeable, Arist. Mu. 392a32; unaltered, Phld. Po. 994.3, S.E. M. 8.455; undifferentiated, Dam. Pr. 68, Procl. in Prm. p.926S.
relaxing, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.21.30, cf. Crito ap. Gal. 13.1041. Adv. -κῶς Stob. 2.6.6.
unready, not ready, Plb. 12.20.6, D.S. 12.41, J. Vit. 22; εἴς τι APl. 16.242 ( Eryc.). Adv. -ως, ἔχειν πρός τι App. Mith. 12.
out of reach, unattainable, ἀνέτοιμα διώκειν Hes. Fr. 219.

relaxed, slack, ἡνίαι γαστρός Philostr. VA 6.11; of the hair, Luc. Alex. 13; τὸ ἄ. τῆς κόμης Philostr. VA 1.32:—of bodily parts, relaxed, Arist. GA 738a2. Adv. ἀνετῶς (sic Hsch.) S. Fr. 641, Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 121.32, dub. in Call. Aet. 3.1.39 [Fr. 75.39 Pf.].
set free from labour, esp. of men and animals dedicated to a god, Hyp. Fr. 72; θηρία Philostr. Im. 1.28, cf. App. BC 1.110; of land, consecrated and lying untilled, Ael. NA 11.2, Poll. 1.10.
τὴν τῶν μειρακίων ὁρμὴν ἄνετον εἴασαν νέμεσθαι f.l. for ἄφετον in Plu. Lib.educ. 2.12a; uncontrolled, licentious, ἐξουσία Hdn. 2.4.4; intemperate, ἁμάρτημʼ ἄνετον Phld. Lib. p.60.
of unknown derivation, S.E. M. 1.245.

definition: ἀνέτυμος, ον, = foreg., S.E. M. 1.245. Adv. -μως ib. 244.
ἄνευ, Megarian and Hellenistic ἄνις (q. v.); ἄνευν IG 4.1484.58 (Epid.); ἄνευς GDI 1157 ( Olymp.):—

children.definition: GDI l.c.), without, opp. σύν, ἄνευ ἕθεν οὐδὲ σὺν αὐτῷ 11.17.407; ἄ. κέντροιο without the goad, 23.387; μόνος ἄ. τινός Ar. Lys. 143, Pl. Smp. 217a; in pregnant sense, ἄ. θεῶν, mostly with neg., οὔτι ἄ. θεοῦ ἥδε γε βουλή Od. 2.372; οὔ τοι ἄ. θεοῦ ἔπτατο . . ὄρνις 15.531; οὐκ ἄ. θεῶν τινος A. Pers. 164; μηδὲ θύεσθαι μέν τινʼ ἰδίᾳ ἄ. τοῦ ἄρχοντος Aen.Tact. 10.4; also without neg., ἄ. ἐμέθεν without my knowledge and will, 11.15.213; ἄ. πολιτᾶν without their consent, A. Ch. 431; ἄ. τοῦ κραίνοντος S. OC 926; ἄ. τοῦ ὑγιεινοῦ without reference to health, Pl. Grg. 518d, cf. 519a; οὐκ ἐνδέχεται ζῆν ἄ. κακοῦ τινος Diph. 32.12, etc.

data.quote: σύν, ἄνευ ἕθεν οὐδὲ σὺν αὐτῷ 11.17.407
οὔτι ἄ. θεοῦ ἥδε γε βουλή
οὔ τοι ἄ. θεοῦ ἔπτατο . . ὄρνις
μηδὲ θύεσθαι μέν τινʼ ἰδίᾳ ἄ. τοῦ ἄρχοντος
οὐκ ἐνδέχεται ζῆν ἄ. κακοῦ τινος

children.label: II
children.definition: away from, far from, ἄ. δηΐων 11.13.556; ἄ. ὄψου ποιεῖν τινας ἑστιωμένους Pl. R. 372c, cf. Hp.Ma. 290e.

children.label: III
children.definition: except, besides, πάντα ἄ. χρυσοῦ Id. Criti. 112c; ἄ. τοῦ καλὴν δόξαν ἐνεγκεῖν praeterquam quod attulerit . ., D. 18.89; καὶ ἄ. τοῦ λαμβάνειν even without it, X. Cyr. 5.4.28.—In early writers it rarely follows its case, ὑφηγητοῦ δʼ ἄ. S. OC 502; ὧν ἄ. X. Cyr. 6.1.14; freq. in later Prose, as always in Arist., Metaph. 1071a2, al., cf. Plu. Aud. 2.47c, etc. (Cf. Goth. inu, OHG. ᾱνο ‘withoutʼ; perh. akin to neg. pref. ἀ-.)
utter cries of εὖα, D.P. 579, AP 9.139 ( claud.).

children.label: II
children.definition: honour with such cries, Lyc. 207, Arr. An. 5.2.7.
discredit, Phld. Ir. p.80 W.
discredited, Phld. Ir. p.53 W.

definition: ἀνευένδοτος, ον, f.l. for εὐένδοτος, Ph. 2.269.

children.definition: disobedient, PGen. 50.12.

definition: ἄνευθε, before a vowel ἄνευ-θεν ( ἄνευ):— Ep. and Lyr. word:

children.definition: without, οἶος ἄνευθʼ ἄλλων Il. 22.39; μούνω ἄνευθʼ ἄλλων Od. 16.239; ἄ. πόνου 7.192; ἄ. θεοῦ, = ἄνευ θεοῦ, Il. 5.185, cf. Pi. O. 9.103 (v.l.).

away from, ἄνευθεν ἄγων πατρός τε φίλων τε Il. 21.78.—Hom.always puts it before its case, though sts. parted from it, as ἄ. δέ σε μέγα νῶϊν ib. 22.88; later it freq. follows, as πατρὸς ἄνευθεν A.R. 4.746.

data.quote: ἄνευθεν ἄγων πατρός τε φίλων τε

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. far away, distant, αἱ δέ τʼ ἄνευθε [νῆσοι] Od. 9.26; τοὶ δʼ ἄλλοι ἄνευθεν καίοντʼ Il. 23.241; ἐγγύθι μοι θάνατος κακὸς οὐδʼ ἔτʼ ἄνευθεν 22.300; οὐδέ . . ἄνευθʼ ἔσαν ἀλλὰ μάλʼ ἐγγύς 23.378; ἄ. λείπειν leave far away, Pi. P. 1.10:—often with part., ἄ. ἐών Il. 2.27, cf. 4.277.

data.quote: ἐγγύθι μοι θάνατος κακὸς οὐδʼ ἔτʼ ἄνευθεν
οὐδέ . . ἄνευθʼ ἔσαν ἀλλὰ μάλʼ ἐγγύς

children.definition: inconvenient, λιμὴν ἀ. πρὸς παραχειμασίαν Act.Ap. 27.12.

not accountable, irresponsible, opp. ὑπεύθυνος, τῇ [μουναρχίῃ] ἔξεστι ἀνευθύνῳ ποιέειν τὰ βούλεται Hdt. 3.80, cf. Arist. Pol. 1271a5; ὑπεύθυνον τὴν παραίνεσιν ἔχοντας πρὸς ἀνεύθυνον τὴν ὑμετέραν ἀκρόασιν Th. 3.43; free from liability or censure, POxy. 906.8 (ii/iii A. D.), Lib. Or. 59.100; not open to objection, of a statement, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 425.5.

data.quote: ὑπεύθυνος, τῇ [μουναρχίῃ] ἔξεστι ἀνευθύνῳ ποιέειν τὰ βούλεται
ὑπεύθυνον τὴν παραίνεσιν ἔχοντας πρὸς ἀνεύθυνον τὴν ὑμετέραν ἀκρόασιν

children.definition: guiltless, innocent, Luc. Abd. 22: c. gen., ἀ. ἁμαρτήματος Id. Nigr. 9; irreproachable, ἀ. τὸ ἰσχίον, of athletes, Philostr. Gym. 48. Adv. -νως Poll. 3.139, Just. Nov. 8.12 Intr.—In Att., ἀνυπεύθυνος was more common.
which cannot be straightened, Arist. Mete. 386a8.
straighten, in Pass., Gal. 18(1).776.
not wishing, not praying, εὐχομένοις καὶ ἀνεύκτοις AP 10.108.
irreverent, impious, Aq. Is. 57.11.
malevolence, Vett.Val. 37.19.
that does not prosper, Aq., Sm. Je. 22.30.
unseemly:—in Adv. -πῶς Hsch. s.v. σχέδιον.
discovery, E. Ion 569, v.l. in D.H. 11.27, cf. Ph. 1.285, Plu. Thes. 12, etc.
one must find out, Pl. Plt. 294d.
inspector, τῶν χωρίων τῶν δημοσίων SIG 279.3 ( Zeleia).
undiscovered, Pl. Lg. 874a, D.S. 5.20, Plu. QConv. 2.700d, POxy. 472.14 (ii A. D.), etc.
invention, discovery, Paus. 5.9.2.

definition: ἀνευρίσκω, fut. -ευρήσω: aor. -εῦρον, later -ευράμην A.R. 4.1133:— Pass., aor. -ευρέθην:—

children.definition: find out, discover, Hdt. 1.67, 2.54, etc.; ἀγαθὰ ἀ. λογιζόμενος Id. 7.8.γʹ; ἀ. φόνον A. Ag. 1094; σὸν χρέος ἀνευρίσκειν πότερον . . E. IT 883; ἀ. τὴν αἰτίαν Pl. Phd. 100b; τὴν τοῦ θεοῦ φύσιν Phdr. 252e, etc.:— Med., win, gain, ἱερὸν χῶρον ἀνευρομένην Epigr.Gr. 259:— Pass., to be found out or discovered, ὡς ὕστερον ἀνευρέθη Th. 1.128: c. part., ἀνεύρηται ὁμοῖα παρεχομένη Hdt. 4.44.

children.label: II
children.definition: think out, invent, μόνος ἀνευρηκὼς τέχνην Antiph. 113, cf. Timocl. 37, Pl. Phdr. 273c; ἀ. πρόφασίν τινα Philem. 88.10, etc.
without sinews, Hp. Mochl. 41.
nerveless, slack, S. Ichn. 143, Theopomp.Com. 71, Arist. HA 538b7 ( Comp.), al.; νεῦρα ἄνευρα Phld. Ir. p.69 W.
dilatation, Gal. 1.402; ἀρτηρίας Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.2.

dilate, Hp. Superf. 29, Placit. 5.16.2; ἡ ῥὶς τοὺς μυκτῆρας ἀνευρύνετο Philostr. Her. 19.9; -υσμένον στόμα ἀγγείου Aët. 8.69; esp. of arterial aneurism, Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.1; ἀ. πάλιν ὁ Ὠκεανός broadens out, Arist. Mu. 393b6: metaph., νοῦς ἀ. τὰς δυνάμεις Ph. 1.249, cf. Dam. Pr. 74 ( Pass.).
aneurism, Ruf. ap. Aët. 14.51, Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.1, Gal. 7.725, 10.335.
like an aneurism, Aët. 15.10, Paul.Aeg. 6.38.
dilatation, ἀρτηρίας Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.2; μήτρας Dsc. 1.13.

shout εὐφήμει or εὐφημεῖτε: hence, as this was mainly done on sorrowful occasions, cry aloud, shriek, ἅπας δʼ ἀνηυφήμησεν (so Brunck for ἀνευφώνησεν) οἰμωγῇ λεώς S. Tr. 783, cf. E. Or. 1335, Pl. Phd. 60a.
proclaim, c. acc. et inf., Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 767.30, cf. Simp. in Ph. 1360.20: c. dupl. acc., Dam. Pr. 58.

children.label: II
children.definition: receive or honour with auspicious cries, τινὰ ὡς εὐεργέτην J. BJ 4.2.5, cf. 2.21.4, Hdn. 6.4.1.
joylessness, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.161.
joyless, ἀπόλαυσις Secund. Sent. 9, cf. Annales du Service 22.9 ( Egypt, i A. D.), Ptol. Tetr. 158, Suid.
joyless, θήρη Sch. Opp. H. 4.533.
unsay a prayer, Pl. Alc. 2.142d, 148b.
leap up at, used only in part. ἀνεπάλμενος, v. ἀναπάλλω.
not to be claimed as a slave (cf. ἀνέπαφος), GDI 1684 sqq. (Delph.).
without drawing a bye, ἀ. νικᾶν SIG 1070.6 ( Olymp.), IG 5(1).680, al. ( Sparta).
draw up for oneself, ἐξ ἁλὸς ἰχθύν Man. 5.279.

unclouded, cloudless, αἴθήρ Od. 6.45; ἀήρ Arist. Mu. 394a23; νύξ Plu. Arat. 21, etc.: metaph., not to be veiled or hidden, κακόν S. El. 1246 (lyr.). ( ἀνν. is v.l. in Arat. 415, etc.; Eust. 945.4 has also the form ἀνεφής, ές.)
unboiled, Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.24.3, Gal. 6.354: Comp., Paul.Aeg. 1.74, Gp. 10.67.1.
ἄ. πλίνθος unbaked, Agath. 2.16.
out of reach, unattainable, Ph. 1.228, al., Phld. Rh. 1.27S., Plu. Adul. 2.54d, Luc. Herm. 67, Jul. Or. 2.82d.
undetected, unexamined, Phld. Lib. p.39O.
not liable to invasion, Lyd. Mag. 3.32.
συμπτώματα not-nephritic, Gal. 17(1).136.
unwarranted, διὰ τὸ τὴν γνώμην ἀνεχέγγυον γεγενῆσθαι because they had no sure confidence in themselves, Th. 4.55.

definition: ἀνέχραζεν ἀνέχριμπτεν, ἀνῄρει δʼ ἀνεκούφιζεν, Hsch.

ἀνέχω, impf. ἀνεῖχον: also ἀνίσχω, impf. ἀνῖσχον: fut. ἀνέξω Archil. 82, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 4 (s. v l.), also ἀνασχήσω Hdt. 5.106, 7.14, E. IA 732: aor. ἀνέσχον Il. 17.310, etc.; poet. ἀνέσχεθον ib. 10.461, E. Med. 1027, Ep. inf. ἀνσχεθέειν Od. 5.320: pf. ἀνέσχηκα S.E. M. 7.190, Phalar. Ep. 105:— Med. ἀνέχομαι: impf. ἠνειχόμην (with double augm.) A. Ag. 905, S. Ph. 411, Th. 1.77, etc.: fut. ἀνέξομαι Il. 5.895, S. El. 1028, D. 18.160, etc.; also ἀνασχήσομαι A. Th. 252, Ar. Ach. 299, Ep. inf. ἀνσχήσεσθαι Il. 5.104: aor. ἀνεσχόμην 18.430, A. Ch. 747 codd., E. Hipp. 687 (where ἠνέσχου is contra metr.); more freq. with double augm. ἠνεσχόμην Hdt. 5.48, A. Ag. 1274; and Att., as Ar. Nu. 1363, Th. 3.28, Lys. 3.3, etc.; sync. ἠνσχόμην S. Ant. 467; 2 sg. imper. ἄνσχεο (v. infr. C. II):— Pass., D.H. 3.55, LXX 4 Ma. 1.35.

children.label: A
children.definition: hold up, lift up, χεῖρας ἀνέσχον held up their hands in fight (v. infr. C.I), Od. 18.89 (later of pugilists, hold up the hands in token of defeat, Theoc. 22.129):—freq. lift up the hands in prayer, θεοῖσι δὲ χεῖρας ἀνέσχον Il. 3.318, cf. 1.450, Archil. 82, etc.; so ἄνακτι εὐχὰς ἀ. offer prayers, perhaps with uplifted hands, S. El. 636; ἄνεχε χέρας, ἄνεχε λόγον E. El. 592; also ἀ. τὴν χεῖρα offer the hand (to shake), Theopomp.Com. 82 (dub.).

lift up as an offering, τάγʼ Ἀθηναίῃ ληΐτιδι . . ὑψόσʼ ἀνέσχεθε χειρί 11.10.461; as a testimony, σκῆπτρον ἀ. πᾶσι θεοῖσι 7.412; μαζὸν ἀ., of Hecuba entreating her son Hector, 22.80; κενεὰς . . ἀνέσχε γλήνας A.R. 2.254; ἄκουε δʼ ἀνʼ οὖς ἔχων A. Fr. 126.

data.quote: τάγʼ Ἀθηναίῃ ληΐτιδι . . ὑψόσʼ ἀνέσχεθε χειρί

children.definition: ἀ. φλόγα hold up a torch, esp. at weddings, E. IA 732: hence the phrase ἄνεχε, πάρεχε sc. τὸ φῶς) hold up, pass on the light in procession, Id. Tr. 308, Cyc. 203, cf. Ar. V. 1326; also ἀ. φάος σωτήριον E. Med. 482; τὸ σημεῖον τοῦ πυρός Th. 4.111.
lift up, exalt, τὰ κείνων Pi. P. 2.89.
hold up, prop, sustain, οὐρανὸν καὶ γῆν, of Atlas, Paus. 5.11.5; κίων ἀ. τὴν στέγην Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 5.34:— Pass., γέφυρα σκάφαις ἀνεχομένη D.H. 3.55:—but more freq.,

children.label: b
children.definition: uphold, maintain, εὐδικίας Od. 19.111; πολέμους Th. 1.141; ὄργια ἀ. keep up the revels, Ar. Th. 948; Βάκχης ἀνέχων λέκτρʼ Ἀγαμέμνων remaining constant to, E. Hec. 121 (v. infr. B. 3); οἰνῶπʼ ἀνέχουσα κισσόν keeping constant to, haunting the ivy, S. OC 674 (s. v. l.); βαρὺν ἀνὰ θυμὸν ἔχοισα keeping up his anger, Theoc. 1.96.
put forth, δάφνα ἀ. πτόρθους E. Hec. 459 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: hold back, check, ἄνεχʼ ἵππους Il. 23.426; ἀ. τὰ ὅπλα διὰ τῶν ἀνακλητικῶν D.H. 9.21; ἀ. Σικελίαν μὴ ὑπʼ αὐτοὺς εἶναι keep it from being . ., Th. 6.86; ἑαυτὸν ἀπό τινος Plu. Garr. 2.514a:— Pass., ἀνέχεται τὰ πάθη ὑπὸ τοῦ λογισμοῦ LXX 4 Ma. 1.35.

data.quote: ἀ. τὰ ὅπλα διὰ τῶν ἀνακλητικῶν
ἀνέχεται τὰ πάθη ὑπὸ τοῦ λογισμοῦ

children.label: B
children.definition: rise up, emerge, ἀνσχεθέειν . . ὑπὸ κύματος ὁρμῆς Od. 5.320; of a diver, Hdt. 8.8; σκόπελοι ἐν τῷ Νείλῳ ὀξέες ἀ. Id. 2.29; ἀ. ἐς ἀέρα A.R. 3.1383.

data.quote: σκόπελοι ἐν τῷ Νείλῳ ὀξέες ἀ.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἀνίσχω, of the sun, πρὸς ἥλιον ἀνίσχοντα Hdt. 3.98, etc.; so λαμπὰς ἀνίσχει A. Ag. 93 (lyr.); ἅμʼ ἡλίῳ ἀνίσχοντι X. Cyn. 6.13, cf. Eub. 119.9.

children.label: c
children.definition: arise, happen, Hdt. 5.106, 7.14.

children.label: d
children.definition: appear, show oneself, ἄελπτον ὄμμα . . φήμης ἀνασχόν S. Tr. 204; turn out, prove to be, μελοποιὸς ἢ τραγῳδὸς ἄριστος Eun. Hist. p.209D.

children.label: e
children.definition: stand up, κίονες περὶ τοίχοις A.R. 3.217.

come forth, αἰχμὴ παρὰ . . ὦμον ἀνέσχεν Il. 17.310, cf. Plu. Caes. 44; of a headland, jut out into the sea, Hdt. 7.123, Th. 1.46, etc.; ἀ. πρὸς τὸ Σικελικὸν πέλαγος Id. 4.53, cf. D. 23.166; ἐς τὸν πόντον [τὴν ἄκρην] ἀνέχοντα jutting out with its headland into the sea, Hdt. 4.99 (dub. l.); reversely, κοιλάδες ἐς μεσόγαιαν ἐκ θαλάσσης ἀ. Str. 3.2.4.

data.quote: κοιλάδες ἐς μεσόγαιαν ἐκ θαλάσσης ἀ.

children.definition: hold on, keep doing, c. part., ἀ. διασκοπῶν Th. 7.48; σε . . στέρξας ἀνέχει is constant in his love for thee, S. Aj. 212 (lyr., cf. supr. A.I.5b): c. dat., τελεταῖς practise regularly, Eun. Hist. p.249 D.: abs., wait, ταύτῃ ἀνέχειν Th. 8.94, cf. 2.18.
hold up, cease, Ζεὺς οὔθʼ ὕων πάντεσσʼ ἁνδάνει οὔτʼ ἀνέχων Thgn. 26, cf. X. HG 1.6.28; dub. l. in Hp. Epid. 5.20.

data.quote: Ζεὺς οὔθʼ ὕων πάντεσσʼ ἁνδάνει οὔτʼ ἀνέχων

children.definition: cease from, οὐδὲ . . καμάτων ἀνέχουσι γυναῖκες S. OT 174; τοῦ πολέμου App. Pun. 75; τοῦ φονεύειν Plu. Alex. 33.— Hom. uses no tense intr. exc. aor.

children.label: C
children.definition: Med., hold up what is oneʼs own, ὁ δʼ ἀνέσχετο μείλινον ἔγχος Il. 5.655; δούρατʼ ἀνασχόμενοι 11.594, etc.: hence ἀνασχόμενος is often used abs. (sc. ἔγχος, ξίφος, etc.), πλῆξεν ἀ. 3.362; κόψε δʼ ἀ. Od. 14.425; πὺξ μάλʼ ἀνασχομένω πεπληγέμεν Il. 23.660; also ἄντα δʼ ἀνασχομένω χερσί ib. 686.

children.label: II
children.definition: hold oneself up, bear up, οὐδέ σʼ ὀΐω δηρὸν ἔτʼ ἀνσχήσεσθαι ib. 5.285, cf. Od. 11.375: aor. imper. ἀνάσχεο, = τέτλαθι, be of good courage, Il. 1.586; ἄνσχεο be patient, 23.587; ἀνὰ δʼ ἔχευ is prob. l. for ἀνὰ δʼ εὖ in Archil. 6.2: in pres. part., ἀνεχόμενοι φέρουσι τὸν χειμῶνα they bear with patience, Hdt. 4.28; Stoic motto ἀνέχου καὶ ἀπέχου Gell. 17.19.

τοσσάδʼ ἐνὶ φρεσὶν ᾗσιν ἀνέσχετο κήδεα 11.18.430; ἦ δὴ πολλὰ κάκʼ ἄνσχεο σὸν κατὰ θυμόν 24.518; τὴν δουλοσύνην οὐκ ἀ. Hdt. 1.169; τὰ πρὶν κακὰ ἠνειχόμεσθα A. Ag. 905, etc.; χαλκὸν ἀνασχέσθαι Il. 4.511, etc.: c. acc.pers., οὐ γὰρ ξείνους . . ἀνέχονται they do not suffer or bear with strangers, Od. 7.32, cf. 17.13; τῶν ἵππων οὔτι ἀνεχομένων τὰς καμήλους Hdt. 7.87; τούτους ἀνάσχου δεσπότας E. Alc. 304, cf. Eup. 6 D.: c. acc. rei et gen. pers., οὐδεὶς ἂν αὐτοῦ ἀγελαστὶ ἠνέσχετο ταῦτα τὰ ἔπη Ath. 5.188c, cf. Ar. Lys. 507.

data.quote: τοσσάδʼ ἐνὶ φρεσὶν ᾗσιν ἀνέσχετο κήδεα 11.18.430
ἦ δὴ πολλὰ κάκʼ ἄνσχεο σὸν κατὰ θυμόν 24.518
τῶν ἵππων οὔτι ἀνεχομένων τὰς καμήλους
οὐδεὶς ἂν αὐτοῦ ἀγελαστὶ ἠνέσχετο ταῦτα τὰ ἔπη

children.definition: Hom., δουλοσύνης ἀνέχεσθαι v.l. in Od. 22.423; so ἅπαντος ἀνδρὸς ἀ. Pl. Prt. 323a, cf. D. 19.16; to be content with, τοῦ ἐν σώματι κάλλους Plot. 5.9.2.

Hom.) in part., οὐ μάν σε . . ἀνέξομαι ἄλγεʼ ἔχοντα I will not suffer thee to have . ., Il. 5.895; οὐ γὰρ ἀεργὸν [ὄντα] ἀνέξομαι I will not suffer one [to be] . ., Od. 19.27; εἰ τὸν . . θανόντʼ ἄθαπτον ἠνσχόμην νέκυν S. Ant. 467; οὐκ ἀνέξεται τίκτοντας ἄλλους E. Andr. 712; καὶ γάρ κʼ . . ἀνεχοιμην ἥμενος for I would be content to sit . ., Od. 4.595; σοῦ κλύων ἀνέξεται A. Pers. 838, cf. S. El. 1028, Ph. 411; ἀνάσχεσθε σιγῶσαι Id. Fr. 679; also οὐ σῖγʼ ἀνέξει; Id. Aj. 75: freq. in Prose, Hdt. 1.80, 206, 5.19, al., Th. 2.74, etc.; ἄποτος ἀ. Arist. HA 596a2; also ἀ. τοῦ ἄλλα λέγοντος Pl. R. 564d; ἀ. τῶν οἰκείων ἀμελουμένων Id. Ap. 31b; οὐδʼ ἂν ἠνέσχεσθε εἴ τις . . D. 21.170:—also in Act., ἀνέσχηκα Phalar. Ep. 105.

data.quote: εἰ τὸν . . θανόντʼ ἄθαπτον ἠνσχόμην νέκυν

children.definition: inf., suffer, οὐκ ἀνέξομαι τὸ μὴ οὐ . . A. Eu. 914; κοκκύζειν τὸν ἀλεκτρυόνʼ οὐκ ἀνέχονται Cratin. 311; ἀνακεκλίσθαι οὐκ ἀ. Aret. SA 1.9; ἀ. πάντα ὑπομένειν Alciphr. 3.34; σὺν ἄλλοις βιοῦν οὐκ ἀ. Ael. NA 6.30.

children.label: b
children.definition: dare to do, ἀνέσχοντο τὸν ἐπιόντα δέξασθαι Hdt. 7.139.

children.label: c
children.definition: οὐκ ἀ., c. inf., refuse to do . ., POxy. 903.36, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: hold on by one another, hang together, ἀνά τʼ ἀλλήλησιν ἔχονται Od. 24.8.
bad for cooking, ὕδατα Hp. Aër. 7.
unboiled, Dsc. 1.102, Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 190.34, Tim. Lex. s.v. κερασβόλον:—later form ἀνέψετος PMag.Par. 1.53.

children.label: II
children.definition: undigested, δόρπος Sch. Nic. Al. 66.

definition: ἀνεψιά, ἡ, fem. of ἀνεψιός, X. Mem. 2.7.2, Isoc. 19.8, etc.

children.definition: first cousinʼs daughter, Ar. Fr. 745.

definition: ἀνεψιάδης, ου, ὁ, = sq., Sammelb. 176, Iamb. Protr. 21.κζ, Poll. 3.28.

children.definition: first cousinʼs son, Pherecr. 203, Hermipp. 86, D. 44.26, Is. 11.12; also, of second cousins, acc. to Poll. 3.28, but this rests on a misinterpretation of D. 45.54.

first cousin, or generally, cousin, Il. 9.464, Hdt. 5.30, 7.82, A. Pr. 856, Com.Adesp. 58D., etc., v. esp. And. 1.47; ἀ. πρὸς πατρός Is. 11.2; ἐκ πατρός Theoc. 22.170: comically, ἐγχέλεων ἀ. Stratt. 39. [ ἀνεψιοῦ κταμένοιο Il. 15.554, = ἀνεψιόο κτ., cf. Q.S. 3.295.] (Cf. Skt. ναπᾱτ ‘grandson’, Lat. nepos, etc.)
relationship of cousins, esp. in phrase ἐντὸς ἀνεψιότητος Pl. Lg. 871b, Lex ap. D. 43.57.
boil again, Arg. E. Med. (in aor. part. ἀνεψήσασα); ἔλαιον ἀνεψήτασθαι f.l. for ἀναψ. in Carm.Pop. ap. Sch. Ar. Eq. 725.
Ar. Fr. 694 (v.l. αἰνεῖθʼ), Ath. 10.4553, Paus.Gr. Fr. 21, prob. in Poll. 7.24 ( ἀλεῖν codd.). Cf. αἵνω, ἀφᾱνέω.

without a sound, in silence, δὴν δʼ ἄ. ἦσαν Il. 9.30, 695; τίπτʼ ἄ. ἐγένεσθε; 2.323; οἱ δʼ ἄ. ἐγένοντο 3.84, Od. 7.144, 10.71; ἅπαντες ἧσθʼ ἄ. 2.240.—In all the places cited it is joined with a pl. Verb, and is commonly written ἄνεῳ (as if nom. pl. from ἄνεως).

definition: ἀνεῳγότως, Adv. pf. part. of ἀνεῳγώς (from ἀνοίγω),

children.definition: openly, Gloss.
fulfilment, A. Th. 713, Call. Jov. 90.

definition: ἀνηβάσκω, = sq., D.H. Rh. 2.6 (censured by Thom.Mag. p.171 R.), POxy. 1381.197.

children.definition: grow young again, Hes. Op. 132 (prob.), A. Supp. 606 (Tyrwh. ἀνηβῆσαί με for ἂν ἡβήσαιμι), E. Ion 1465, Pl. Lg. 666b; δὶς ἀ. Thgn. 1009; πάλιν X. Cyr. 4.6.7; μόνος ὁ νοῦς παλαιούμενος ἀνηβᾷ Plu. Lib.educ. 2.5e.

children.label: II
children.definition: grow up, attain to ἥβη, Call. Jov. 56.
making young again, ἀ. ῥώμη the returning strength of youth, E. Andr. 552.

not yet come to manʼs estate, opp. ἔφηβος, παῖς Heraclit. 117, cf. Leg.Gort. 11.19, Lys. 14.25, Theoc. 8.3; οἱ ἄ. pueri, CIG 2034 ( Byzantium), cf. SIG 1028.32 ( Cos); ἄνηβοι καὶ ἄγονοι ἐκ γενετῆς impotent, Arist. HA 581b22; of a girl, Pl. Lg. 833c.
childhood, minority, Just. Nov. 159 Pr.
without leader, unguided, ψυχή Ph. 1.337, cf. 696, Luc. Icar. 9; φυρμός M.Ant. 12.14.
relate, rehearse, Pi. N. 10.19, cf. I. 6(5).56, Hdt. 5.4.
ἀ. πρόσφορος ἐν Μοισᾶν δίφρῳ advance worthily in the Muses’ car, Pi. O. 9.80.
renounce oneʼs enjoyment of a thing, no longer enjoy it, ἃ τόθʼ ἥτθην, ταῦτα νῦν ἀ. Hermipp. 77.

data.quote: ἃ τόθʼ ἥτθην, ταῦτα νῦν ἀ.

children.definition: disagreeable, J. AJ 17.3.1, Them. Or. 26.319d.

children.label: II
children.definition: without pleasure, Plot. 4.8.8.
not sweetened or seasoned, Hp. Int. 21, al., Arist. Pr. 925b18, etc.
Id. Pol. 1340b16; ἀ. βραχυλογία Plu. Phoc. 5; ὕμνος Them. Or. 18.218b; so, unpleasant, Hegesand. 26; γυνή, φωνή, Plu. Coniug. 2.142b, Pyth. 405d; ἦθος ἀ. πρὸς χάριν ib. Praec. 799d.

definition: ἀνήδυστος, ον, v.l. for foreg., Plu. Phoc. 5.

children.definition: oil of dill, Gal. 19.666, Orib. Fr. 1.
without characteristic, Sch. Lyc. 14.
made of dill, στέφανος (in form ἀνήτ-) Theoc. 7.63; οἶνος Dsc. 5.65; μύρον Id. 1.51, cf. Aret. CA 1.2; cf. ἀνήτινος, ἀννήθιον.
flavoured with dill-seed, Gp. 8.3.
like dill, Dsc. 4.164.

definition: ἄνηθον or ἄννηθον, τό, Aeol. ἄνητον Alc. 36, Sapph. 78,128, also Anacr. ap. Poll. 6.107. ἄννητον Thphr. HP 9.7.3:—

children.definition: dill, Anethum graveolens, Ar. Nu. 982, Th. 486, Thphr. HP 1.11.2, Alex. 127.5, Theoc. 15.119, Ev.Matt. 23.23, Dsc. 3.58, SIG 1170.26 (ii A. D.), Bilabel Ὀψαρτ. p.10. ( ἀνν- in Ar. ll.cc. Not to be confused with ἄννησον, q.v.)
not giving exact delineation of character, D.H. Lys. 8. Longin. 34.3.
unprincipled, Cic. Att. 10.10.5.

incurable, desperate, fatal, ἄλγος, χόλος, Il. 5.394, 15.217; ἀ. πάθος ἔρδειν τινά Hdt. 1.137; ἀ. λώβην λωβᾶσθαί τινα Id. 3.154; λυμαίνεσθαί τινα λύμησι ἀ. Id. 6.12, cf. A. Ch. 516, etc.; κακόν, κακά, συμφοραί, Hes. Th. 612, Archil. 9.5, Th. 5.111; μίασμα . . ἀ. τρέφειν keep it till it is past cure, S. OT 98; ἁμαρτάδες Hp. Acut. 39; ἔργον Antipho 5.91; πονηρία X. Mem. 3.5.18; ἀνήκεστα ποιεῖν τινα ruin utterly, Id. An. 2.5.5; ἀνήκεστα πάσχειν to be utterly ruined, Th. 3.39; ἀ. τι παθεῖν D. 54.5; ἀ. τι βουλεῦσαι περί τινος Th. 1.132; ἁπάντων τῶν ἀνηκέστων αἴτιον D. 21.70, etc.
ἀ. πλεονέκται X. Oec. 14.8; χρήσασθαί τινι τῶν ἐχθρῶν ὡς ἀνηκέστῳ Plu. Per. 39; ἀ. εἴς τι J. AJ 18.6.10: Comp. -έστερος f.l. in Antipho 5.91: Sup., Ph. 2.316.

data.quote: χρήσασθαί τινι τῶν ἐχθρῶν ὡς ἀνηκέστῳ

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., damaging beyond remedy, pernicious, πῦρ S. El. 888; χαρά Id. Aj. 52.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. ἀνηκέστως, διατιθέναι treat cruelly, Hdt. 3.155, cf. 8.28; ἀ. ἔχειν Aret. SD 1.5, App. BC 2.123.

definition: ἀνηκής, ές, ( ἄκος) = foreg., S. Fr. 49.

children.definition: without point, A. Fr. 279; opp. ἠκιδωμένος, βέλη IG 2.807b138.
to be deaf, Hdn. Epim. 188.
not hearing, Plu. Aud. 2.38b, Hierocl. in CA 25p.477M.
ignorance, Plu. QConv. 2.676f.
disobedience, Steph. in Rh. 288.36.
without hearing, Arist. Pr. 903b38; of the dead, Mosch. 3.103; πέτραι Lyc. 1451.

not hearing a thing, never having heard or learnt it, Pl. Phdr. 261b, X. Mem. 2.1.31: hence, ignorant of it, παιδείας Aeschin. 1.141; with no ear for, τῶν Διοννσίου ῥυθμῶν Philostr. VS 1.22.3; not attending the lectures of . ., c. gen., ib. 2.2. Adv. ἀνηκόως, ἔχειν ἀστρολογίας Plu. Coniug. 2.145c; ἔς τι Paus. 10.17.13.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἀνήκοος εἶναι ἔνια γεγενημένα (where ἀ. εἶναι = ἀγνοεῖν) Pl. Alc. 2.141d.

children.label: c
children.definition: σκαιὸς καὶ ἀ. ignorant, untaught, D. 19.312, cf. Sallust. 5.
not willing to hear, not listening, Call. Del. 116; τὸ ἀ. disobedience, D.H. 6.35.

children.label: II
children.definition: unheard, Philostr. Her. 12.3; without result, ἀ. τέθυται Alciphr. 3.35.

to be unwilling to hear, disobey, c. gen., οὐδʼ ἄρα πατρὸς ἀνηκούστησε Il. 15.236; τῶν πατρὸς λόγων A. Pr. 40; τῶν νόμων Th. 1.84: c. dat., ἀ. τοῖσι στρατηγοῖσι Hdt. 6.14: also abs., 1.115, Aen.Tact. 10.3.
want of hearing, deafness, Hp. Morb. 3.4.
disobedience, Pl. Lg. 671b.
not to be heard, inaudible, Arist. de An. 421b5.
unheard of, ἤκουσʼ ἀνήκουστα . . ὥστε φρῖξαι S. El. 1407, cf. E. Hipp. 363 (lyr.).
not to be granted, Antiphο 1.22.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not willing to hear: τὸ ἀ. disobedience, X. Cyn. 3.8.

to have come up to a point, reach up to, of persons and things, ἐς μέτρον τινὸς ἀ.
