flowerlike, Thphr. HP 1.13.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: full of flowers, τόπος Sch. Nic. Th. 438.
to be in a diametric aspect with the horoscope, Ptol. Tetr. 200, Vett.Val. 135.3.
seventh τόπος in an ἀποτελεσματογραφία, Paul.Al. M. 2.

definition: ἀνία, Ion. ἀνίη, Aeol. ὀνία, ἡ,

children.definition: grief, sorrow, distress, trouble, Hes. Th. 611, Sapph. 1.3 (pl.), Thgn. 76, etc.; ὑπὸ τῆς ἀνίας ἀνεθολοῦθʼ ἡ καρδία Pherecr. 116; εἰς ἀνίαν ἔρχεταί τινι is like to be a mischief to him, S. Aj. 1138, cf. Pl. Grg. 477d, Prt. 355a, al.: in pl., ὀνίαισι Sapph. l.c.; ἀντʼ ἀνιῶν ἀνίαι Thgn. 344; ἐμοὶ λιπὼν ἀνίας S. Aj. 973, cf. 1005, Ph. 1115, Pl. Prt. 353e.

data.quote: ὑπὸ τῆς ἀνίας ἀνεθολοῦθʼ ἡ καρδία

children.definition: δαιτὸς ἀνίη the killjoy of our feast, Od. 17.446; ἄπρηκτος ἀνίη inevitable bane, of Scylla, 12.223; ἀνίη καὶ πολὺς ὕπνος an annoyance, 15.394. [In Hom. and S. always ῑ, also E. IT 1031 (s.v.l.). Other Poets made the ι long or short as the verse required, though the Homeric quantity prevailed in Ep.]

definition: ἀνιάζω, only pres. and impf. (exc. aor. ἠνίᾰσα AP 11.254 ( Lucill.)): Ion. impf. ἀνῑάζεσκον A.R. 3.1138:—

children.definition: Ep. Verb, grieve, distress, like ἀνιάω, c. acc. pers., ὅς κεν τοῦτον ἀνιάζῃ Od. 19.323; ἀλλʼ ὅτε δή ῥʼ ἀνίαζον . . Ἀχαιούς Il. 23.721 (v.l. Ἀχαιοί).

data.quote: ἀλλʼ ὅτε δή ῥʼ ἀνίαζον . . Ἀχαιούς

children.label: II
children.definition: to be grieved or distressed, θυμῷ ἀνιάζων grieving at heart, Od. 22.87; ἀλλʼ ὅτε δή ῥʼ ἀνίαζε was grieving, growing weary, 4.460, cf. A.R. 4.1347; κτεάτεσσιν ὑπερφιάλως ἀνιάζει he grieves for his goods, Il. 18.300; ἐπὶ παιδί Arat. 196. [ ῐ metri gr. in Hom. and other Ep.]

definition: ἀνιακκάς, apptly. the name of a

children.definition: tune, Eub. 46.
cure again, repair, τὸ παρεὸν τρῶμα ἀνιεῦνται (which in sense at least is an Ion. fut.) dub. in Hdt. 7.236 (leg. ἀκεῦνται).
dedicate, IG 14.644 ( Bruttii).

definition: ἀνιαρός, ά, όν, Ion. and Ep. ἀνιηρός, ή, όν:—

children.definition: grievous, troublesome, annoying, of persons, πτωχὸν ἀνιηρόν Od. 17.220; ἐχθροῖς ἀνιαροί Ar. Pl. 561, cf. Lys. 25.20 ( Sup.):—of animals, σχέτλια καὶ ἀ. Hdt. 3.108. Adv. ἀνιαρῶς, λέγειν S. Ant. 316.

painful, grievous, πτωχεύειν πάντων ἔστʼ ἀνιηρότατον Tyrt. 10.4, cf. Thgn. 124; πόλλʼ ἀνιηρὰ παθών Id. 276; πᾶν γὰρ ἀναγκαῖον χρῆμʼ ἀ. ἔφυ Id. 472 (= Even. 8); opp. ἡδύ, E. Med. 1095 (lyr.), cf. Pl. Prt. 355e; τοῖς γεγενημένοις ἀνιαροῖς D. 18.291: Comp. ἀνιαρότερος Lys. 10.28; irreg. Comp. ἀνιηρέστερος Od. 2.190: Sup. -ότατος Pl. Grg. 477d.

data.quote: πᾶν γὰρ ἀναγκαῖον χρῆμʼ ἀ. ἔφυ

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., grieved, distressed, X. Cyr. 1.4.14. Adv. -ρῶς wretchedly, ξῆν Id. Mem. 1.6.4; ἔχειν Sor. 1.53. [ ῑ Hom. and S., ῐ Eleg., E., Com.]
incurable, Hp. Aph. 7.87; ἕλκος, τραῦμα, Pl. Lg. 877a, 878c: also in moral sense, πράγματα ib. 660c; ἀ. καὶ ἀνήκεστα κακά Aeschin. 3.156; ἀνελευθερία ἀ. ἐστιν Arist. EN 1121b13.
incurable, incorrigible, Pl. R. 410a, Grg. 526b; ἀ. κατὰ τὴν μοχθηρίαν Arist. EN 1165b18, al. Adv. ἀνιάτως, ἔχειν to be incurable, Pl. Phd. 113e, D. 18.324; οἱ ἀ. κακοί Arist. EN 1137a29.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., ἀ. μετάνοια unavailing repentance, Antipho 2.4.12.
= foreg., Suid. s.v. βρύω.
heal again, Tz. H. 6.665.
uninstructed in medical science, Vitr. 1.1.13.
no-physician, Hp. Praec. 7, Arist. Ph. 191b6, Plot. 6.7.37, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 33.2: Adj., unworthy of a physician, ἀ. τι ἔχειν Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.23.24.

definition: ἀνίαχος, f.l. for αὐΐαχος (q.v.) in Hom. and Q.S.

children.definition: proclaim loudly, APl. 16.296 (Antip.); ἔπος Nonn. D. 44.190.

definition: ἀνιάω [ᾰν], S. Aj. 266, etc.: 3 sg. impf. ἠνία ib. 273, Pl. Grg. 502a: fut. ἀνιάσω [ᾱς] X. An. 3.3.19, Ep. ἀνιήσω Hom.: aor. ἠνίᾱσα And. 1.50, etc.; Dor. ἀνίᾱσα Theoc. 2.23: pf. ἠνίᾱκα Hld. 7.22:— Pass., ἀνιῶμαι Od. 15.335, etc., Ion. 3 pl. opt. ἀνιῴατο Hdt. 4.130: 3 pl. impf. ἠνιῶντο X. Cyr. 6.3.10: fut. ἀνιάσομαι Ar. Fr. 488.11, X. Mem. 1.1.8 ( ἀνιαθήσομαι only in Gal. Anim.Pass. 9); Ep. 2 sg. ἀνιήσεαι Thgn. 991: aor. ἠνιάθην X. HG 6.4.20; Ion. -ήθην Il. 2.291: pf. ἠνΐημαι Mosch. 4.3: the aor. Med. ἀνιάσασθαι is v.l. for ἀνιᾶσθαι in Gal. UP 6.16: ( ἀνία) . [ῑ always in Hom. and S.; ῐ̄ in Thgn. and late Poets; ῐ in Ar. l.c., etc.]:—

children.definition: Ep. ἀνιάζω, grieve, distress, c. acc. pers., ἀνιήσει . . υἷας Ἀχαιῶν Od. 2.115, cf. 20.178; μηδὲ φίλους ἀνία Thgn. 1032; φίλους ἀνιῶν S. Aj. 266: c. acc. rei, ἀνιᾷ μου τὰ ὦτα Pl. Grg. 485b: c. dupl. acc., ὁ δρῶν σʼ ἀνιᾷ τὰς φρένας S. Ant. 319: c. acc. pers. et neut. Adj., τί ταῦτʼ ἀνιᾷς με; ib. 550; παῦρʼ ἀνιάσας, πόλλʼ εὐφράνας (sc. ὑμᾶς) Ar. Pax 764; ἠνίασά σε οὐδὲν πώποτε And. 1.50:— Pass., to be grieved, distressed, c. dat. pers. vel rei, ἀνιᾶται παρεόντι he is vexed by oneʼs presence, Od. 15.335; ἀ. ὀρυμαγδῷ 1.133; σύν σοι . . παθόντι κακῶς ἀνιώμεθα Thgn. 655; πάσχων ἀνιήσεαι Id. 991; ἀ. ὑπομιμνῄσκων Lys. 13.43; δαπανὼντα ἀνιᾶσθαι X. Cyr. 8.3.44; περί τινος Ar. Lys. 593: c. neut. Adj., τοῦτʼ ἀνιῶμαι πάλαι I have long been vexed at tnis, S. Ph. 906; πολλὰ μὲν αὐτοὺς ἀνιωμένους, πολλὰ δὲ ἀνιῶντας τοὺς οἰκέτας X. Oec. 3.2: abs., οὐδʼ ἂν . . ἀνιῷτο Thgn. 1205: esp. in aor. part. Pass. ἀνιηθείς disheartened, Od. 3.117, Il. 2.291.

data.quote: ὁ δρῶν σʼ ἀνιᾷ τὰς φρένας

definition: ἀνιγροδέτης βυρσοδέψης, Hsch. ἄνιγρον, v. ἄναγρον.

children.definition: Nic. Th. 8, Call. Iamb. 1.164 (prob.), Opp. H. 3.188; νοῦσος Call. Aet. 3.1.14 [Fr. 75.14 Pf.]; cf. ἀνιγρόν· ἀκάθαρτον, φαῦλον, κακόν, δυσῶδες, ἀσεβές, Hsch.; ἀ. ἀντίπαλοι AP 7.561 ( Jul.Aegypt.); δαίμων IG 14.2123.
look up, dub. in A. Ch. 808.
without sweat or toil, Pl. Lg. 718e.
perspire so that the sweat stands on the surface Pl. Ti. 74c (prob.).
get into a sweat, Hp. Coac. 24.

definition: ἀνίδρυτος (v. ἀΐδρυτος), ον, Ph. 2.451, Dam. Pr. 413.

children.definition: set up, e.g. a statue, D.C. 37.34.
without perspiration, Ruf. Ren.Ves. 6.2, Aret. SD 1.16, 2.7; and so, with v.l. ἄνιδρος, in Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 17.
sweating, Hp. Epid. 7.105.
without sweat, Hp. Prorrh. 1.61, X. Cyr. 2.1.29: metaph., without toil or trouble, Il. 15.228; lazily, slowly, X. Cyr. 2.2.30, Oec. 21.3.
without having sweated or exercised oneself, ἀ. γενόμενοι εἰσίοιεν X. Cyr. 2.1.29: not accompanied by perspirations, ἴκτερος Hp. Judic. 9.
AB 405, Suid.
Men.Eph. 1.
unholy, unhallowed, A. Ag. 220, 769, Supp. 757; ἀνίερος ἀθύτων πελάνων unhallowed because of the unoffered sacrifices, E. Hipp. 146 (all lyr. passages); of a child born out of wedlock, Pl. R. 461b.

children.label: II
children.definition: receiving no victims, Ἄρης E. Fr. 992 (lyr.).

dedicate, devote, Arist. Oec. 1346b5; τινί τι Plu. Cor. 3:— Pass., PTeb. 60.10 (ii B. C.), BGU 1202.5 (i B.C.), etc.: used of persons invoking the wrath of the gods upon themselves or others in case of breach of faith, SIG 1179 ( Cnidus).
consecration, ἱεροῦ D.H. 5.35, cf. SIG 563.9,16 ( Teos), IG 9(1).278 ( Locr., ii B. C.); dedication of a manumitted slave, Boeot. ἀνιάρωσις IG 7.3315 ( Chaeronea).
one must consecrate, Ph. 1.184.

definition: ἀνίημι, ης ( ἀνιεῖς, as if from ἀνιέω, dub. in Il. 5.880), ησι: impf. ἀνίην, Hom. and Att. 2 and 3 sg. εις, ει, Ion. 3 sg. ἀνίη SIG 1 ( Abu Simbel, vi B. C., Iterat. ἀνίεσκε Hes. Th. 157; also ἠνίει Hp. Epid. 7.46; 1 sg. ἀνίειν Luc. Cat. 4: fut. ἀνήσω: pf. ἀνεῖκα: aor. 1 ἀνῆκα; Ion. ἀνέηκα.:—the Homeric forms ἀνέσει Od. 18.265, aor. opt. ἀνέσαιμι 14.209, part. ἀνέσαντες 13.657 should be referred to ἀνέζω, but ἄνεσαν Il. 21.537 is from ἀνίημι: aor. 2, 3 pl. ἀνεῖσαν Th. 5.32, imper. ἄνες A. Ch. 489, S. Ant. 1101, E. Hel. 442, subj. ἀνῇς A. Eu. 183, Ep. 3 sg. subj. ἀνήη Il. 2.34, opt. ἀνείη, inf. ἀνεῖναι, part. ἀνείς:— Pass., ἀνίεμαι: pf. ἀνεῖμαι Hdt. 2.65, A. Th. 413, 3 pl. pf. ἀνέωνται Hdt. 2.165 (v.l. ἀνέονται), inf. ἀνἑῶσθαι (sic) Tab.Heracl. 1.153: aor. part. ἀνεθείς Pl. R. 410e: fut. ἀνεθήσομαι Th. 8.63. [ ἀνῐ- Ep., ἀνῑ- Att.: but even Hom. has ἀνῑει, ἀνῑέμενος, and we find ἀνῐησιν in Pl.Com. 153 (anap.).]: —

children.definition: send up or forth, Ζεφύροιο . . ἀήτας Ὠκεανὸς ἀνίησιν Od. 4.568; of Charybdis, τρὶς μὲν γάρ τʼ ἀνίησιν . . τρὶς δʼ ἀναροιβδεῖ 12.105; ἀφρὸν ἀ. spew up, vomit, A. Eu. 183; σταγόνας [αἵματος] ἀ. S. OT 1277; of the earth, καρπὸν ἀ. make corn or fruit spring up, h.Cer. 333; κνώδαλα A. Supp. 266; also of the gods, ἀ. ἄροτον γῆς S. OT 270, etc.; so of females, produce, ib. 1405:—in Pass., σπαρτῶν ἀπʼ ἀνδρῶν ῥίζωμʼ ἀνεῖται A. Th. 413: then in various relations, συὸς χρῆμα ἀ. S. Fr. 401; κρήνην E. Ba. 766; of a forest, πῦρ καὶ φλόγα Th. 2.77; πνεῦμʼ ἀνεὶς ἐκ πνευμόνων E. Or. 277:— send up from the grave or nether world, A. Pers. 650, Ar. Ra. 1462, Phryn.Com. 1 D., Pl. Cra. 403e, etc.:— Pass., ἐκ γῆς κάτωθεν ἀνίεται ὁ πλοῦτος ibid.; of fruit, Thphr. CP 5.1.5.

data.quote: τρὶς μὲν γάρ τʼ ἀνίησιν . . τρὶς δʼ ἀναροιβδεῖ

children.definition: let come up, give access to, τινά X. HG 2.4.11; εἰς τὸ πεδίον ib. 7.2.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: let go, from Hom. downwds. a very common sense, ἐμὲ δὲ γλυκὺς ὕπνος ἀνῆκεν, i.e. left me, Il. 2.71, etc., cf. Pl. Prt. 310d: — Pass., ἀνίεσθαι wake up, D.S. 17.56; set free, ἐκ στέγης ἀ. S. Ant. 1101; let go unpunished, ἄνδρα τὴν ὀλιγαρχίαν λυμαινόμενον X. HG 2.3.51, cf. Lys. 13.93; ἄνετέ μʼ ἄνετε leave me alone, forbear, S. El. 229 (lyr.); of a state of mind, ἐμὲ δʼ οὐδʼ ὣς θυμὸν ἀνίει . . ὀδύνη Il. 15.24; ὅταν μʼ ἀνῇ νόσος μανίας E. Or. 227; ὥς μιν ὁ οἶνος ἀνῆκε Hdt. 1.213, etc.; ἀ. ἵππον to let him go (by slackening the rein), S. El. 721; ἵππους εἰς τάχος ἀ. X. Eq.Mag. 3.2; τῷ δήμῳ τὰς ἡνίας ἀ. Plu. Per. 11.

data.quote: ἐμὲ δʼ οὐδʼ ὣς θυμὸν ἀνίει . . ὀδύνη

children.label: b
children.definition: loosen, unfasten, δεσμόν Od. 8.359 (v.l. δεσμῶν) ; δεσμά τʼ ἀνεῖσαι Call. Hec. Fr. 260.29 [updated ref.]: hence, open, πύλας ἄνεσαν Il. 21.537; ἀ. θύρετρα E. Ba. 448; ἀ. σήμαντρα break the seal, Id. IA 325:— Pass., πύλαι ἀνειμέναι D.H. 10.14.

ἀ. τινί let loose at one, slip at, ἀ. τὰς κύνας X. Cyn. 7.7: hence ἄφρονα τοῦτον ἀνέντες Il. 5.761, cf. 880: c. acc. et inf., Διομήδεα μαργαίνειν ἀνέηκεν ib. 882: generally, set on or urge to do a thing, c. inf., Μοῦσʼ ἄρʼ ἀοιδὸν ἀνῆκεν ἀειδέμεναι Od. 8.73, cf. 17.425, Il. 2.276, 5.422: freq. c. acc. pers. only, let loose, excite, as οὐδέ κε Τηλέμαχον . . ῷδʼ ἀνιείης Od. 2.185; μέγας δέ σε θυμὸς ἀνῆκεν Il. 7.25; τοῖσιν μὲν Θρασυμήδεα δῖον ἀνῆκεν urged Thrasymedes to their aid, 17.705:—so in Pass., ἅπας κίνδυνος ἀνεῖται σοφίας Ar. Nu. 955.

ἀ. τινὰ πρός τι to let go for any purpose, τὸν λεὼν . . ἀνεῖναι πρὸς ἔργα τε καὶ θυσίας Hdt. 2.129; ἐς παιγνίην ἑωυτὸν ἀ. ib. 173; τὰ μικρὰ εἰς τύχην ἀνείς E. Fr. 974 (v.l. ἀφείς) ; τὰ σώματα ἐπὶ ῥᾳδιουργίαν X. Cyr. 7.5.75; ἐὰν δʼ ἀνῇς, ὕβριστον χρῆμα κἀκόλαστον [γυνή] if you leave her free, Pl.Com. 98.

data.quote: τὸν λεὼν . . ἀνεῖναι πρὸς ἔργα τε καὶ θυσίας

children.definition: let, allow, c. acc. et inf., ἀνεῖναι αὐτοὺς ὅ τι βούλονται ποιεῖν Pl. La. 179a; ἀ. τρίχας αὔξεσθαι Hdt. 2.36, cf. 4.175: with inf. omitted, ἀνεῖσα πένθει κόμαν E. Ph. 323; ἀ. στολίδος κροκόεσσαν τρυφάν ib. 1491; κόμας Plu. Lys. 1: c. dat. pers. et inf., ἀνεὶς αὐτῷ θηρᾶν having given him leave to hunt, X. Cyr. 4.6.3.

data.quote: ἀνεῖναι αὐτοὺς ὅ τι βούλονται ποιεῖν

children.definition: Med., loosen, undo, c. acc., κόλπον ἀνιεμένη baring her breast, Il. 22.80; αἶγας ἀνιέμενοι stripping or flaying goats, Od. 2.300; so ἀνεῖτο λαγόνας E. El. 826; so in Act., ἀνιέναι· δέρειν, Hsch.

let go free, leave untilled, of ground dedicated to a god, τέμενος ἀνῆκεν ἅπαν Th. 4.116; ἀργὸν παντάπασι τὸ χωρίον ἀνιέντες τῷ θεῷ Plu. Publ. 8; generally, τὴν χώραν ἀ. μηλόβοτον Isoc. 14.31; ἀρούρας ἀσπόρους ἀ. Thphr. HP 8.11.9; στέλεχος ἀνειμένον allowed to run wild, LXX Ge. 49.21:—but this sense mostly in Pass., devote oneself, give oneself up, ἐς τὸ ἐλεύθερον Hdt. 7.103; esp. of animals dedicated to a god, which are let range at large (cf. ἄνετος) , ἀνεῖται τὰ θηρία Id. 2.65; of a person devoted to the gods, νῦν δʼ οὗτος ἀνεῖται στυγερῷ δαίμονι S. Aj. 1214; of places, etc., θεοῖσιν ἀ. δένδρεα Call. Cer. 47; ἄλσος ἀνειμένον a consecrated grove, cj. in Pl. Lg. 761c; of land, ἀ. εἰς νομάς PTeb. 60.8, 72.36 (ii B.C.): hence metaph., ἀνειμένος εἴς τι devoted to a thing, wholly engaged in it, e.g. ἐς τὸν πόλεμον Hdt. 2.167; ἀνέωνται ἐς τὸ μάχιμον they are given up to military service, ib. 165; ἐς τὸ κέρδος λῆμʼ ἀνειμένον given up to . ., E. Heracl. 3: hence pf. part. Pass. ἀνειμένος as Adj., going free, left to oneʼs own will and pleasure, at large, S. Ant. 579, El. 516; ἀ. τι χρῆμα πρεσβυτῶν γένος καὶ δυσφύλακτον E. Andr. 727; πέπλοι ἀνειμένοι let hang loose, ib. 598; τὸ εἰς ἀδικίαν καὶ πλεονεξίαν -μένον unrestrained propensity to . ., Plu. Num. 16; σώματα πρὸς πᾶσαν ἐπιθυμίαν ἀνειμένα Id. Lyc. 10.

data.quote: ἀργὸν παντάπασι τὸ χωρίον ἀνιέντες τῷ θεῷ
νῦν δʼ οὗτος ἀνεῖται στυγερῷ δαίμονι
ἀ. τι χρῆμα πρεσβυτῶν γένος καὶ δυσφύλακτον

children.definition: slacken, relax, opp. ἐπιτείνω or ἐντείνω, of a bow or stringed instrument, unstring, as Hdt. 3.22, cf. Pl. R. 442a, Ly. 209b, X. Mem. 3.10.7, etc.; esp. of musical scales, ἁρμονίαι ἀνειμέναι, opp. σύντονοι, Arist. Pol. 1342b22, al.; ἀνειμένα Ἰαστὶ μοῦσα Pratin.Lyr. 5: metaph., ὀργῆς ὀλίγον τὸν κόλλοπʼ ἀ. Ar. V. 574, cf. Pherecr. 145.4, Pl. R. 410e; πολιτεῖαι ἀνειμέναι καὶ μαλακαί Arist. Pol. 1290a28; τοῖς γηράσκουσι ἀνίεται ἡ συντονία GA 787b13; ἀνειμένη τάσις the grave accent, Sch.D.T. p.130H.; οἱ πάγοι τὰς φλόγας ἀ. temper, Arist. Mu. 397b2: hence,

children.label: b
children.definition: remit, neglect, give up, στέρνων ἀραγμούς S. OC 1608; φυλακὰς ἀνῆκα E. Supp. 1042; φυλακήν, ἄσκησιν, etc., Th. 4.27, X. Cyr. 7.5.70, etc.; ἀ. θάνατόν τινι to remit sentence of death to one, let one live, E. Andr. 531; ἔχθρας, κολάσεις τισί Plu. Vit.pud. 2.536a; ἀ. τὰ χρέα, τὰς καταδίκας, Id. Sol. 15, D.C. 64.8, cf. 72.2; ἄνες λόγον speak more mildly, E. Hel. 442; so ἀ. τινὸς ἔχθραν Th. 3.10; ἀ. ἀρχήν, πόλεμον, etc., Id. 1.76, 7.18, etc.:— Pass., to be treated remissly, ἀνεθήσεται τὰ πράγματα Id. 8.63; ὁ νόμος ἀνεῖται has become effete, powerless, E. Or. 941: freq. in pf. part. ἀνειμένος as an Adj., ἐν τῷ ἀνειμένῳ τῆς γνώμης when their minds are not strung up for action, Th. 5.9; ἀνειμένῃ τῇ διαίτῃ relaxed, unconstrained, of the Athenians, Id. 1.6; δίαιτα λίαν ἀ., of the Ephors, Arist. Pol. 1270b32; ἀ. ἡδοναί dissolute, Pl. R. 573a; ἄνανδρος καὶ λίαν ἀ. ib. 549d; ἀ. χείλεα parched, Theoc. 22.63; of climate, ἀ. καὶ μαλακός Thphr. CP 5.4.4; ὀσμὴ μαλακὴ καὶ ἀ. 5.7.1: Comp. ἀνειμενώτερος Iamb. VP 15.67:—but,

relaxation occurs also as an intr. usage of the Act., slacken, abate, of the wind, ἐπειδὰν πνεῦμʼ ἀνῇ S. Ph. 639, cf. Hdt. 2.113, 4.152; ἕως ἀνῇ τὸ πῆμα S. Ph. 764, cf. Hdt. 1.94; ἐμφῦσα οὐκ ἀνίει, of a viper, having fastened on him she does not let go, Id. 3.109: esp. in phrase οὐδὲν ἀνιέναι not to give way at all, X. HG 2.3.46, cf. Cyr. 1.4.22; τὰς τιμὰς ἀνεικέναι ἤκουον that prices had fallen, D. 56.25, cf. Arist. Rh. 1390a15; σιδήρια ἀ. ἐν τοῖς μαλακοῖς lose their edge, Thphr. HP 5.5.1.

children.label: b
children.definition: part., give up or cease doing, ὕων οὐκ ἀνίει [ὁ θεός] Hdt. 4.28, cf. 125, 2.121.βʹ, E. IT 318, etc.

children.label: c
children.definition: cease from a thing, μωρίας Id. Med. 457; τῆς ὀργῆς Ar. Ra. 700, D. 21.186; φιλονικίας Th. 5.32; ἀνῆκε τοῦ ἐξελθεῖν forbore to come forth, LXX 1 Ki. 23.13.
dilute, dissolve, διά τινος or τινί, Gal. 13.520, al., Gp. 4.7.3, cf. Arr. An. 7.20.5 ( Phryn. 19 says that διΐημι is more correct in this sense); διυγραινομένων καὶ ἀνιεμένων Thphr. Vent. 58.

definition: ἀνιηρός, ή, όν, Ion. for ἀνιαρός.

children.definition: insufficient, incapable, Babr. 92 Subscr., Hld. 2.30.
dissatisfied with everything, Arr. Epict. 4.1.106.
without victory, D.C. 61.21.
without prayer, not entreating, E. IA 1003.

unconquered, unconquerable, Hes. Th. 489, Tyrt. 11.1, Thgn. 491, Pi. P. 4.91, S. Ant. 781, Ph. 78, E. Andr. 997, etc. Adv. -τως Phld. Ir. p.67 W., Hsch. s.v. ἀτρώτως.—Poet., but used by Gorg. Fr. 11, Pl. R. 375b, X. Cyn. 1.17, and in later Prose, LXX 2 Ma. 11.13, Plu. Alex. 14, etc.; λεύκη ἀ., name of a plaster, Crito ap. Gal. 12.487.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀνίκητον, τό, = ἄνηθον, Plin. HN 20.186, Ps.- Dsc. 3.58.2. = σμῖλαξ τραχεῖα, Id. 4.142.
non-victory, Pythag. term, f.l. for ἀδικία, Arist. Metaph. 990a24, cf. Alex.Aphr. ad loc.
draw up, Sch. Nic. Al. 524:— Pass., evaporate, Dsc. 4.64:—hence -αστέον, Philum. Ven. 16.6.
unmoistened, Lyc. 988.
winnow, sift out, in Pass., Pl. Ti. 53a ( ἀνικλ- Hsch.); cf. ἰκμάω, ἀπικμάω.
without moisture, Arist. Pr. 906b19, Plu. Frig. 2.951b; sapless, Thphr. CP 6.20.2.
attain to, εἰς δόξαν SIG 560.16.
unappeased, merciless, Plu. Superst. 2.170c.

definition: ἀνίλεως [ῑ], ων, Att. for ἀνίλαος (not in use),

children.definition: unmerciful, Ep.Jac. 2.13 (s. v.l.), Hdn. Epim. 257.

definition: ἀνίλλω, = ἀνείλλω, Phryn. PS p.31 B., Olymp. in Phlb. p.240 S.:— Pass.,

children.definition: shrink back, of the soul, Plot. 1.6.2, cf. Porph. Plot. 14.
Poll. 2.54.
wind oneʼs way or struggle upwards, Hsch.; wrongly written ἀνειλ-.

definition: ἀνιμάω, used by early writers only in pres. and impf. ( aor. ἀνίμησα Hierocl. p.63.19 A., Plu. Phoc. 18),

children.definition: draw up, raise water by means of leather straps ( ἱμάντες) , ἀπὸ τροχιλιᾶς Thphr. HP 4.3.5, cf. Hierocl. l.c.; generally, draw out or up, ἀλλήλους δόρασι ἀνίμων X. An. 4.2.8, cf. Eq. 7.2; κάδον Sor. 1.93:— Pass., aor. ἀνῑμήθην App. Mith. 32, D.L. 1.116, Antig. Mir. 157: pf. ἀνίμημαι Luc. Pisc. 50:— freq. used by later writers in Med., ἀνιμῶμαι Id. Alex. 14; τῇ προβολῇ φόρτον, of an elephant, Aret. SD 2.13; of the sun causing evaporation, Stoic. 1.35, 2.197, Gp. 1.13.1: fut. -ήσομαι Longus 1.12: aor. -ησάμην Plu. Amat.narr. 2.773d, Luc. VH 2.42, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἑαυτόν), get up, X. Eq. 7.1.
drawing up, of water, Simp. in Ph. 571.6, Suid.
A. Pers. 256, 1055, 1061; ἄνιος· ἀνατεπείς (sic), Hsch.

definition: ἀνιοχίων, Dor. ( Lacon.) for ἡνιοχέων, IG 5(1).213.

children.definition: ride on high, -οντος ἡλίου E. Ion 41.
tax paid in lieu of service in cavalry, PSI 4.388.36 (ii B.C.), PPetr. 2p.129 (iii B. C.), PTeb. 99.56 (ii B. C.).
without horse, not serving on horseback, ἱππόται καὶ ἄνιπποι Hdt. 1.215, S. OC 899; without a horse to ride on, Ar. Nu. 125, Plb. 10.40.10; unable to ride, Plu. Fort. 2.100a.
unsuited for horses, ἄ. καὶ ἀναμάξευτος Hdt. 2.108, cf. Aen.Tact. 8.4, D.H. 2.13.
Max.Tyr. 22.6.

with unwashen feet, epith. of the Σελλοί, Dodonaean priests of Zeus, Il. 16.235, cf. BCH 7.276 ( Lydia); applied to parasites by Eub. 139; to the Great Bear, as metuens aequore tingi, by Nonn. D. 40.285.
unwashen, χερσὶ δʼ ἀνίπτοισιν (v.l. -ῃσιν) Διὶ λείβειν . . ἅξομαι Il. 6.266, cf. Hes. Op. 725, Ev.Matt. 15.20: prov., ἀ. ποσί, i.e. unprepared, Luc. Pseudol. 4.
not to be washed out, αἷμα A. Ag. 1459.
Ar. Ach. 798, 834, cf. IG 14.432 ( Tauromenium); also in late Poets, Lyc. 350, Nic. Al. 419, Epigr.Gr. 418.3.
equalize, Hp. Vict. 3.85, Arist. IA 708b14, Cael. 293a2:— Pass., ib. 297b12.
an unequal number of times, Theo Sm. p.26H., al., Nicom. Ar. 2.17.
unequal, ἐτῶν ὅρον X. Ep. 3.
σπέρμα aniseed, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.97,124.
equalization, Eust. 42.6.
decoction of aniseed, Alex.Trall. 8.2: also ἀννησᾶτον Orib. 5.33.10 (interpol.).
having unequal plane faces, of certain solid numbers, e.g. βωμίσκος (q.v.), Iamb. in Nic. p.93P.
unequal in age, Procl. in Prm. pp. 945,949 S.
flavoured with aniseed, οἶνος Gp. 8.4 tit.
unequal in weight, Simp. in Cael. 225.34, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 166.24, 173.18.
having unequal angles, Iamb. in Nic. p.93P.
having their three dimensions unequal, Iamb. in Nic. p.93P.
of unequal course, περίοδοι τῶν ἑπτὰ ἀστέρων Ph. 1.143.
of unequal strength, Sch. Heph. p.103C.
of uneven form, Porph. VP 50.
to be unequal in strength, S.E. M. 10.28.
shining unequally, κύκλος PMag.Par. 1.1132.
not commensurate with, τινί Aret. SD 2.2.
of unequal length, Gal. 13.545.
to be of unequal thickness, Hero *Stereom. 2.59.4.
of unequal thickness, Gal. 13.545.
of unequal breadth, Euc. Opt. 6.
scalene, τρίγωνον Ti.Locr. 98a, Theo Sm. p.113H.
unequal in number, ἀ. γωνίας ἔχειν, of polygons, Papp. 308.6.
unequally balanced, unfair, Plu. Nob. 6, Phlp. in Ph. 677.25.

definition: ἄνισος, ον ( η, ον Aesar. ap. Stob. 1.49.27),

children.definition: unequal, uneven, Hp. Fract. 37, Pl. Ti. 36d, etc.; τὸ ἄ. inequality, Arist. EN 1129b1, etc.; ἄ. πολιτεία, of an oligarchy, Aeschin. 1.30: so of persons, οἱ ἄ. Arist. Pol. 1280a13; ἄ. κατά τι ib. 23; but also, not content with equality or justice, unjust, Id. EN 1129a33, 1129b10; unfair, χεῖρες AP 9.263 ( Antiphil.). Adv. unequally, Hp. Art. 61; unfairly, ἀ. σχεῖν πρός τινας D. 24.168; ἀ. νενεμῆσθαι τὰς ἀρχάς Arist. Pol. 1282b24.
of unequal strength, Gal. 5.415.
with uneven legs, Sch. D.P. 175; with tails of unequal length, of a bandage, Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.63 tit.
revolving unevenly, Tz. H. 10.563.
unequally rapid, παλμοί Ph. 2.637; φορά Theo Sm. p.189H. Adv. -ῶς Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 39.17, Them. in Ph. 133.11, Procl. Hyp. 2.14.
inequality, Pl. Phd. 74c, al., Arist. Pol. 1302a26, etc.: pl., Procl. Hyp. 5.3.
to be out of trim, lean over to one side, metaph. from a ship, Simp. in Epict. p.108D.
unequally stretched, βρόχος Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.14.2; not in unison, Ptol. Harm. 2.2.
of unequal height, Apollod. Poliorc. 142.5, Hero Dioptr. 12.
of unequal duration, Herodic. ap. Orib. 8.4.6; in Metric, composed of unequal times, Aristid.Quint. 1.24.

equalize, balance, Pl. Plt. 289e; ὁ σίδηρος τοὺς ἀσθενεῖς ἀ. τοῖς ἰσχυροῖς puts them on a par with . ., X. Cyr. 7.5.65; of giving late-comers an equal share of wine, AB 80, Hsch. (cf. ἀνίσωμα):— Pass., to be equal in a thing πλήθεϊ ἀνισωθῆναι Hdt. 7.103:— Med., make oneself equal, contend with, ζυγαίναις Opp. H. 5.37.

children.label: II
children.definition: make smooth, level, στενωπούς J. BJ 5.5.1:— Pass., ibid.

children.label: B
children.definition: ἄνισος) make unequal, Phlp. in Ph. 364.16 ( Pass.), Dam. Pr. 401 ( Pass.), Elias in Cat. 200.22.

children.label: A
children.definition: pres. ἀνίστημι (later ἀνιστάω S.E. M. 9.61): impf. ἀνίστην: fut. ἀναστήσω, poet. ἀνστήσω: aor. 1 ἀνέστησα, Ep. ἄνστησα, Aeol. 3 pl. ὄστασαν Hsch.: pf. ἀνέστακα LXX 1 Ki. 15.12, Arr. Epict. 1.4.30: also in aor. 1 Med. ἀνεστησάμην (v. infr. I.5, III.6).

children.label: I
children.definition: make to stand up, raise up, γέροντα δὲ χειρὸς ἀνίστη he raised the old man up by his hand, Il. 24.515, cf. Od. 14.319; τί μʼ αὖ . . ἐξ ἑδρας ἀνίστατε; S. Aj. 788; ἀ. τινὰ ἐκ τῆς κλίνης Pl. Prt. 317e; ὀρθὸν ἀ. τινά X. Mem. 1.4.11; ἀπὸ τοῦ καθαρμοῦ τινα D. 18.259.

data.quote: τί μʼ αὖ . . ἐξ ἑδρας ἀνίστατε;

children.definition: raise from sleep, wake up, Il. 10.32, etc.; εἰς ἐκκλησίαν ἀ. τινά Ar. Ec. 740; ἀ. τινὰ ὠμόϋπνον Eup. 305: metaph., ἀ. νόσον S. Tr. 979.
raise from the dead, οὐδέ μιν ἀνστήσεις Il. 24.551, cf. A. Ag. 1361, S. El. 139; from misery or misfortune, Id. Ph. 666, Aeschin. 1.67.
produce a witness, etc. (cf. III.6), προφήτην ὑμῖν ἀ. ὁ Θεός Act.Ap. 3.22, al.

Hom., also of things, set up, build, στήλας v.l. in Hdt. 2.102; πύργους X. Cyr. 7.5.12, etc.; τρόπαια Διί E. Ph. 572; ἀνδριάντα ἐς Δελφούς Philipp. ap. D. 12.21; so ἀ. τινὰ χρυσοῦν, χαλκοῦν (in pure Attic ἱστάναι), set up a golden, brazen statue of him, Plu. Superst. 2.170e, Brut. 1 ( Pass., v. infr. B):—so in aor. 1 Med., ἀναστήσασθαι πόλιν build oneself a city, Hdt. 1.165; ἀνεστήσαντο δὲ βωμούς they set them up altars, Call. Dian. 199.

children.label: b
children.definition: build up again, restore, τείχη D. 20.68: metaph., θεῶν τιμάς E. HF 852.
put up for sale, Hdt. 1.196.

children.label: II
children.definition: rouse to action, stir up, ἀλλʼ ἴθι νῦν Αἴαντα . . ἄνστησον Il. 10.176, cf. 179, 15.64, etc.: c. dat. pers., raise up against another, τούτῳ δὲ πρόμον ἄλλον ἀναστήσουσιν ib. 7.116 (v. infr. B. I.5): rouse to arms, raise troops, Th. 2.68, 96; ἀ. πόλεμον ἐπί τινα Plu. Cor. 21; ἀναστήσας ἦγε στρατόν he called up his troops and marched them, Th. 4.93, cf. 112, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: make people rise, break up an assembly by force, Il. 1.191; but ἐκκλησίαν ἀναστῆσαι adjourn it, X. HG 2.4.42.

make people emigrate, transplant (cf. infr. B. II.2), ἔνθεν ἀναστήσας ἄγε Od. 6.7; ἀνίστασαν τοὺς δήμους Hdt. 9.73; Αἰγινήτας ἐξ Αἰγίνης Th. 2.27; even γαῖαν ἀναστήσειν A.R. 1.1349; οἴκους Plu. Publ. 21; also ἀ. τινὰ ἐκ τῆς ἐργασίας D. 18.129.
make suppliants rise and leave sanctuary, Hdt. 5.71, Th. 1.137, S. OC 276, etc.: also ἀ. στρατόπεδον ἐκ χώρας make an army decamp, Plb. 29.27.10; τὰ πράγματα ἀνίστησί τινα Plu. Alc. 31.
ἀ. ἐπὶ τὸ βῆμα make to ascend the tribune, Id. An seni 2.784c, cf. Cam. 32.
put up game, X. An. 1.5.3, cf. Cyr. 2.4.20 ( Pass.), Cyn. 6.23, D.Chr. 2.2.
μάρτυρα ἀναστήσασθαί τινα call him as oneʼs witness, Pl. Lg. 937a.

children.label: B
children.definition: pres. and impf. ἀνίσταμαι, -μην, in fut. ἀναστήσομαι, in aor. 2 ἀνέστην (but ἀναστῶ, for ἀναστήσω, Crates Com. 4D.), imper. ἄστηθι (for ἄν-στηθι) Herod. 8.1, part. ἀστάς IG 4.951.112 (Epid.): pf. ἀνέστηκα, Att. plpf. ἀνεστήκη; also pf. ἀνεστέασι Hdt. 3.62: aor. Pass. ἀνεστάθην, Aeol. part. ὀσταθείς Hsch.:— stand up, rise, esp. to speak, τοῖσι δʼ ἀνέστη Il. 1.68, 101, etc.; ἐν μέσσοισι 19.77: in Att. c. fut. part., ἀ. λέξων, κατηγορήσων, etc.: so c. inf., ἀνέστη μαντεύεσθαι Od. 20.380: in part., ἀναστὰς εἶπε E. Or. 885; παραινέσεις ἐποιοῦντο ἐν σφίσιν αὐτοῖς ἀνιστάμενοι Th. 8.76; also, rise from oneʼs seat as a mark of respect, θεοὶ δʼ ἅμα πάντες ἀνέσταν Il. 1.533; ἀπὸ βωμοῦ (cf. A. ΙΙΙ.3) Aeschin. 1.84.

data.quote: παραινέσεις ἐποιοῦντο ἐν σφίσιν αὐτοῖς ἀνιστάμενοι

children.definition: rise from bed or sleep, ἐξ εὐνῆς ἀνστᾶσα Il. 14.336, cf. A. Eu. 124; εὐνῆθεν Od. 20.124; ὄρθρου ἀ. Hes. Op. 577; ὀψέ Ar. V. 217; οὐδʼ ἀνιστάμην ἐκ κλίνης, of a sick person, And. 1.64: abs., rise from sleep, Hdt. 1.31.
rise from the dead, Il. 21.56, cf. 15.287, Hdt. 3.62, A. Ag. 569; παρὰ τῶν πλειόνων Ar. Ec. 1073.
rise from an illness, recover, ἐκ τῆς νούσου Hdt. 1.22, cf. Pl. La. 195c: abs., Th. 2.49.

rise as a champion, Il. 23.709; θανάτων χώρᾳ πύργος ἀνέστα [Oedipus] S. OT 1201: hence c. dat., stand up [to fight against . .], Ἀγκαῖον . ., ὅς μοι ἀνέστη Il. 23.635; μή τίς τοι . . ἄλλος ἀναστῇ Od. 18.334; Τυφῶνα θοῦρον πᾶσιν ὃς ἀνέστη θεοῖς A. Pr. 354 codd.; v. supr. A. II.

data.quote: Τυφῶνα θοῦρον πᾶσιν ὃς ἀνέστη θεοῖς

children.definition: rise up, rear itself, πύργοι E. Ph. 824 (lyr.), cf. Plb. 16.1.5; of statues, etc., to be set up, Plu. Util. 2.91a, Apophth.reg. 198f: metaph., μή τι ἐξ αὐτῶν ἀναστήῃ κακόν Pi. P. 4.155; πόλεμος D.H. 3.23; θορύβου ἀναστάντος App. BC 1.56.

data.quote: μή τι ἐξ αὐτῶν ἀναστήῃ κακόν

children.definition: to be set up, βασιλεύς as king, Hdt. 3.66 codd.
rise, ἐξ ὀρέων Plu. Pomp. 34.
pf. part., γῆ γηλόφοισιν ἀνεστηκυῖα Arr. Ind. 4.7: metaph., lofty, ἀ. τὴν ψυχὴν γενόμενος Eun. Hist. p.233 D.

children.label: II
children.definition: rise to go, set out, go away, εἰς Ἄργος E. Heracl. 59, cf. Th. 1.87, 7.49, 50; ἀνίστατο εἰς οἴκημά τι ὡς λουσόμενος Pl. Phd. 116a.

data.quote: ἀνίστατο εἰς οἴκημά τι ὡς λουσόμενος

children.definition: to be compelled to migrate (supr. A. ΙΙΙ.2), ἐξ Ἄρνης ἀναστάντες ὑπὸ Θεσσαλῶν Th. 1.12, cf. 8: of a country, to be depopulated, χώρα ἀνεστηκυῖα Hdt. 5.29; πόλις . . πᾶσʼ ἀνέστηκεν δορί E. Hec. 494; ἡσυχάσασα ἡ Ἑλλὰς καὶ οὐκέτι ἀνισταμένη no longer subject to migration, Th. 1.12; τὴν ἀσφάλειαν . . περιείδετʼ ἀνασταθεῖσαν D. 19.84.
cease, οὐκ, ἀνέστη ἕως ἐνίκησε σκορπίσαι Psalm.Solom. 4.13.

make inquiry into, ask about, ἄρνησις οὐκ, ἔνεστιν ὧν ἀνιστορεῖς S. OT 578: c. acc. pers. et rei, ask a person about a thing, πεύσει γὰρ οὐδὲν ὧν ἐκείνων ἃ) ἀνιστορεῖς ἐμέ A. Pr. 963, cf. S. OC 991, Ph. 253; σε . . ἀνιστορῶ E. Supp. 110; ἀ. τινὰ περί τινος Id. Hipp. 92; investigate, τι Thphr. CP 1.5.5.
ignorance of history, Cic. Att. 6.1.17.
ignorant of history, uninformed, περί τινος Plb. 12.3.2; τινός Phld. Rh. 1.188S., Arr. Epict. 1.6.23, cf. D.Chr. 12.59. Adv. -τως, ἔχειν τινός Plu. Demetr. 1.

children.label: II
children.definition: uninvestigated, Ph. Bel. 78.36; unrecorded, Phld. Mus. p.28K., Plu. QConv. 2.731c; χώρα, ἰδέαι ὀρνέων, Agatharch. 58, 84.

definition: ἀνίστωρ, ορος, ὁ, ἡ, late form for ἀΐστωρ, Tz. H. 3.272.
ἀνίσχαλος ἄτοκος, ἀνήμελκτος, ἀθήλαστος, EM 110.32, cf. Hsch. s.v. σχαλίσαι ( -αδον EM 739.43, Suid.).

children.definition: ἀνέχω, Orph. A. 445.
without prominent haunches, Arist. HA 499b1.
not strong, without strength, Str. 2.1.36, v.l. in D.H. 4.54, Sch. Theoc. 14.15: Comp., ῥῖγος -ότερον Hp. Flat. 8; invalid, of a document, ἄκυρος καὶ ἀ. PSI 183.9 (V A.D.), Just. Nov. 72.5.
want of strength, Gloss.
without strength, LXX Is. 40.30.

definition: ἀνίσωμα, ατος, τό, = ἐπίστιος, ἡ, prob. in Ath. 10.447a; cf. ἀνισόω.

children.definition: equalization, Th. 8.87, Pl. Lg. 740e.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ- priv.) inequality, Mich. in EN 15.22.
one must make equal, Aristid. 1.423J.
one must return, ὅθεν ἐξέβημεν D.H. Lys. 13.
squeal, of swine, Q.S. 11.177.
without fish, λίμνη Str. 16.1.21.
tracing out, investigation, Eust. 1437.16.
not tracked, Luc. Am. 35; βυθοί Ps.-Callisth. 2.38.

track, as a hound, Il. 22.192, cf. Arist. HA 624a28 (of bees), AP 5.301 ( Agath.), Porph. Sent. 43, Jul. Or. 6.183b: generally, trace out, search out, Plu. Caes. 69; χέρσον ἀ. Lyc. 824:—also ἀνιχνεῖν, Epigr.Gr. 270.
unhurt, Stes.76 (v.l. ἀνίψανον).
not liable to rust, Arist. Mir. 833b31, PLeid.X. 36B.

definition: ἀννεῖται, Ep. for ἀνανεῖται, from ἀνανέομαι.
ἀννήθιον, τό, = neut. of ἀνήθινος, POxy. 1923.13 (v/vi A.D.).

children.definition: like ἄννησον: neut., = κώνειον, Hsch., Sch. Nic. Al. 186.

definition: ἄννησον or ἄνησσον ( PSI 4.422.28 (iii B.C.), Dsc. 3.56), τό,

children.definition: anise, Pimpinella Anisum, Hdt. 4.71, Hp. Acut. 23, Thphr. HP 1.11.2, 1.12.1 (prob.), Alex. 127.7, Nic. Th. 650, Phaenias ap. Ath. 9.371d, POxy. 1088.67 (i A.D.), Bilabel Ὀψαρτ. p.10.— ἄννισον, ἄνισον, and ἄνησον are variants in codd.
of or for Hannibal, Plb. 2.71.9, D.S. 2.5.
side with Hannibal, Plu. Marc. 10.

definition: ἀννίς μητρὸς ἢ πατρὸς μήτηρ, Hsch.
ἀννωδέως τρυφερῶς, σοβαρῶς, Hsch. ἄννωμα· θρυπτόμενα, ( Tarent.), Id.

children.definition: to be curator annonae, IGRom. 3.1412.
cura annonae, Lyd. Mag. 3.38.
praefectus annonae, PFlor. 75.20 (iv A.D.).
to have as an allowance (annona), ἀ. καθʼ ἑκάστην ἡμέραν ἄρτους μβ OGI 200.20 ( Axum).

data.quote: ἀ. καθʼ ἑκάστην ἡμέραν ἄρτους μβ

children.definition: = Lat. annona, CIG 4447 ( Syria), OGI 200.16 ( Axum), POxy. 1192.4 (iii A.D.), al.
belonging to the annona, εἴδη PFlor. 377.15 (vi A.D.).
concerning the annona, PLips. 6 ii 11.
impassable, Aq. Je. 18.15; πεζῇ φήσαντος ἀνόδευτα εἶναι στρατοπέδοις Str. 16.4.23, cf. App. BC 4.106.

children.label: II
children.definition: trackless, χεῦμα Hedyl. ap. Str. 14.6.3; ἐρημίαι Lyd. Mag. 1.50.
guide back, dub.l. in Babr. 95.55.

a road that is no road, ὁδὸν ἢ κυριώτερον εἰπεῖν ἀνοδίαν Ph. 2.156, al.; ἐρήμην ἀνοδίαν ἑαντοῖς συντεμεῖν Porph. Chr. 1; mostly in dat. ἀνοδίᾳ, ἀνοδίαις, through places with no roads, Plb. 5.13.6, 4.57.8, D.S. 19.5, Plu. Garr. 2.508d, cf. Mar. 37.

children.label: II
children.definition: ascent, ἀνοδίαι καὶ στάσεις τοῦ ἡλίου Vett.Val. 343.18.
without smell, having no smell, Hp. Acut. 63 (vv. ll. ἄνοσμος, ἄοσμος), Arist. Pr. 873a2.
Pherecr. 74, 82.
having no way or road, impassable, ὁδοὶ ἄ. E. IT 889 (lyr.); opp. εὔοδος, X. An. 4.8.10.
way up, e.g. to the Acropolis at Athens, Hdt. 8.53; τὴν ἄ. οἰκοδομήσασα CIG 1948 (incert. loc.): metaph., ἡ εἰς τὸν νοητὸν τόπον τῆς ψυχῆς ἄ. Pl. R. 517b, cf. Phld. D. 1.6.

data.quote: ἡ εἰς τὸν νοητὸν τόπον τῆς ψυχῆς ἄ.

children.label: b
children.definition: journey inland, esp. into Central Asia, like ἀνάβασις, τριῶν μηνῶν ἄ. Hdt. 5.50; ἄ. παρὰ βασιλέα ib. 51, cf. X. An. 2.1.1.
rising, τοῦ ὑγροῦ Arist. Mete. 355a6; rising of a star, κατηλυσίη τʼ ἄνοδός τε Arat. 536; slope of a hill, Plb. 5.24.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Alciphr. 3.39, cf. Sch. Ar. Th. 86, Hsch.

children.label: III
children.definition: ascent of the soul to its original source, Hierocl. in CA 24p.471M.

children.label: IV
children.definition: increasing progression, Theol.Ar. 58.
toothless, Arist. PA 674b20, Fr. 294.
break into wailing, E. Hyps.Fr. 1 iv 7, X. Cyr. 5.1.6, Plu. Sanit. 2.123c.
not mourning, Trag.Adesp. 303.

definition: ἀνόζεστα τὰ μὴ ἐζεσμένα, Hsch. (fort. ἀπόζεστα).

children.definition: with no, or very few, branches, Thphr. HP 1.8.1, etc.: Comp. -ότερος ib. 3.13.3:—also ἄοζος, ον, ib. 1.5.4, al.
a foolish act, f.l. for ἀνόμημα, Stoic. 3.136.
without understanding, Od. 2.270, 17.273, Democr. 197, al.
want of understanding, Suid. s.v. ἀβέλτερος.
νόησις, un-knowing, i.e. mystical vision, θεωρεῖται ἀνοησία κρείττονι νοήσεως Porph. Sent. 25.
mindlessness, ib. 44.
to be devoid of intelligence, Pl. Phlb. 12d, Henioch. 5, Plot. 5.5.1; opp. νοεῖν, 2.9.1:—also ἀνο-ητεύω, Sch. Ar. Nu. 1480.

definition: ἀνοητία, ἡ, Att. for ἀνοησία, Ar. Fr. 746, cf. Moer. 28.

children.definition: not thought on, unheard of, ἄφραστʼ ἠδʼ ἀνόητα h.Merc. 80.

not within the province of thought, νοήματα ὄντα ἀνόητα εἶναι Pl. Prm. 132c; not the object of thought, unthinkable, Plot. 5.3.6 and 10. Adv. -τως without discursive thought, of vision, βλέψαι ἀ. Id. 6.7.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not understanding, unintelligent, senseless, silly, Hdt. 1.87, 8.24; ὦ ἀνόητοι oh fools! Ar. Lys. 572; ὦνόητε Id. V. 252; opp. προνοητικός, X. Mem. 1.3.9: Comp. -ότερος Luc. Peregr. 33; τὸ ἀ., opp. τὸ νοῦν ἔχον, Pl. Ti. 30b; τῷ θνητῷ καὶ ἀ. Id. Phd. 80b; τὸ ἀ. [τῆς ψυχῆς] Id. R. 605b, etc.:—of animals, τὸ τῶν προβάτων ἦθος εὔηθες καὶ ἀ. Arist. HA 610b23, cf. 622a3.

data.quote: τὸ τῶν προβάτων ἦθος εὔηθες καὶ ἀ.

children.label: b
children.definition: not understanding, θεοῦ Max.Tyr. 41.5; τῆς φωνῆς Luc. Asin. 44, cf. Ecphant. ap. Stob. 4.7.64.
ἀ. γνῶμαι S. Aj. 162 (lyr.); δόξαι Pl. Phlb. 12d; εὐχειρίη Hp. Art. 35; ἀ. καὶ κενόν Ar. Ra. 530; οἴνου . . καὶ τῶν ἄλλων ἀνοήτων and all other follies, Id. Nu. 417.

children.label: b
children.definition: without mind, ἀνόητα καὶ ἄνευ ζωῆς Plot. 5.5.1.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -τως Ar. Lys. 518, Pl. R. 336e, etc.; ἀ. διακεῖσθαι Lys. 10.4: Sup. -ότατα D.C. 44.35:—also ἀνο-ητεί, AB 1327, An.Ox. 2.313.
pure, genuine, χρυσίον Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 7.4: metaph., μαρτυρία D.S. 1.72; βίος Ph. 2.267: φίλος Gal. 14.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: free from adultery, γάμος arist. Mir. 846a30, Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 5.2.
pure, genuine, unadulterated, εὔνοια Ph. 1.454; κάλλος 2.156. Adv. -θως ib. 216, al., Hsch.

the character of an ἄνοος, want of understanding, folly, ἀνοίη in folly, Hdt. 6.69; ὑπʼ ἀνοίας A. Pr. 1079, Philem. 143; νεότητι καὶ ἀνοία Pl. Lg. 716a; ἄ. λόγου S. Ant. 603; τὴν ἄ. εὖ φέρειν E. Hipp. 398; πολλῆ ἀνοια χρῆσθαι to be a great fool, Antipho 3.3.2; πολλὴ ἄ. [ἐστι] πολεμῆσαι Th. 2.61; ἄνοιαν ὀφλισκάνειν to be thought a fool, D. 1.26; δύο ἀνοίας γένη, τὸ μὲν μανίαν, τὸ δʼ ἀμαθίαν Pl. Ti. 86b; but opp. μανία, Id. R. 382c, 382e, etc.: pl., follies, Isoc. 8.7. [In Trag. sts. paroxyt. ἀνοίᾱ (cf. ἀγνοίᾱ), cf. A. Th. 402, S. Fr. 583.5, E. Andr. 519.]

data.quote: δύο ἀνοίας γένη, τὸ μὲν μανίαν, τὸ δʼ ἀμαθίαν

children.definition: opener, Dam. Pr. 125ter.
opening, door, LXX 3 Ki. 14.6 (cod. Alex.); value, Zos.Alch. p.225B., etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄ. σφαίρας, used of the diameter of a sphere, IGRom. 4.503.12 (Pergam.).

definition: ἀνοίγνυμι Lys. 12.10; ἀνοίγω Pi. P. 5.88, Hdt. 3.37, 117, and Att. as IG 1.32 ( συν-), al.: later ἀνοιγνύω Demetr. Eloc. 122, Paus. 8.41.4: impf. ἀνέῳγον Il. 16.221, al., Hdt. 1.187, etc.; also ἀνῷγον Il. 14.168; rarely ἤνοιγον X. HG 1.1.2 and 6.21; Ion. and Ep. ἀναοίγεσκον Il. 24.455; late ἀνεῴγνυον App. BC 4.81, etc.: fut. ἀνοίξω Ar. Pax 179: aor. ἀνέῳξα Id. V. 768, Th. 2.2, Hp. Vict. 2.56, part. ἀνεῴξας CIG (add.) 4300d ( Antiphellus); also ἤνοιξα X. HG 1.5.13 and in late Prose; Ion. ἄνοιξα Hdt. 1.68 (best codd. ἀνῷξα), 4.143, 9.118; poet. ἀνῷξα Theoc. 14.15, κἀνῷξε Phld. Acad.Ind. p.103 M.: pf. ἀνέῳχα D. 42.30, Men. 229; ἀνέῳγα Aristaenet. 2.22 (v. infr.): plpf. ἀνεῴγει Pherecr. 86 (Pors.):— Pass., ἀνοίγνῠμαι E. Ion 923, Ar. Eq. 1326: late fut. ἀνοιχθήσομαι LXX Is. 60.11, Epict. Ench. 33.13 (v.l.); ἀνοιγήσομαι LXX Ne. 7.3, PMag.Par. 1.358; ἀνεῴξομαι X. HG 5.1.14: pf. ἀνέῳγμαι E. Hipp. 56, Th. 2.4, etc.; ἀνῷγμαι Theoc. 14.47; later ἤνοιγμαι ( δι-) best reading in Hp. Epid. 7.80, cf. J. Ap. 2.9; plpf. ἀνέῳκτο X. HG 5.1.14 ( pf. 2 ἀνέῳγα is used in pass. sense in Hp. Morb. 4.39, Cord. 7, and later Prose, as Plu. QConv. 2.693d, Ev.Jo. 1.51, 2 Ep.Cor. 6.11, Luc. Nav. 4 (though he condemns it Sol. 8); but in Att., only Din. Fr. 81): aor. ἀνεῴχθην E. Ion 1563, subj. ἀνοιχθῆ D. 44.37, opt. ἀνοιχθείην Pl. Phd. 59d, part. ἀνοιχθείς Th. 4.130, Pl. Smp. 216d; later ἠνοίχθην Paus. 2.35.7, LXX Ps. 105(106).17; and aor. 2 ἠνοίγην Ev.Marc. 7.35, Luc. Am. 14, etc.—In late Gr., very irreg. forms occur, ἠνέῳξα LXX Ge. 8.6; ἠνέωχα PMag.Par. 1.2261; ἠνέῳγμαι Apoc. 10.8, Hld. 9.9; ἠνεῴχθην LXX Ge. 7.11; also aor. 1 inf. ἀνωίξαι Q.S. 12.331; ἀνωίχθην Nonn. D. 7.317:—

children.definition: open, of doors, etc., ἀναοίγεσκον μεγάλην κληῗδα they tried to put back the bolt so as to open [the door], Il. 24.455, cf. 14.168; πύλας ἀνοῖξαι A. Ag. 604; θύραν Ar. V. 768; also without θύραν, ἐπειδὴ αὐτῷ ἀνέῳξέ τις Pl. Prt. 310b, cf. 314d; χηλοῦ δʼ ἀπὸ πῶμʼ ἀνέῳγε took off the cover and opened it, Il. 16.221; φωριαμῶν ἐπιθήματα κάλʼ ἀνέῳγεν 24.228; so ἀ. σορόν, θήκας, Hdt. 1.68, 187; κιβωτόν Lys. 12.10; ἀ. σήμαντρα, σημεῖα, διαθήκην, open seals, etc., X. Lac. 6.4, D. 42.30, Plu. Caes. 68; and metaph., καθαρὰν ἀνοίξαντι κλῇδα φρενῶν E. Med. 660; ἀ. βίβλινον (sc. οἶνον) tap it, Theoc. 14.15; γῆρυν ἀνοίξας, for στόμα, Tryph. 477; ἀ. φιλήματα kiss with open mouths, Ach.Tat. 2.37.

children.label: b
children.definition: throw open for use, γυμνάσιον OGI 529.11; κἀνῷξε σχολὰς opened school, Phld. Acad.Ind. p.103M.; εἰ ἀνοίξω ἐργαστήριον; shall I open a shop? Astramps. Orac. 43p.5H.
lay open, unfold, disclose, ὄνομα A. Supp. 322; ἔργʼ ἀναιδῆ S. OC 515, cf. E. IA 326; λανθάνουσαν ἀτυχίαν Men. 674.
get into the open sea, get clear of land, X. HG 1.1.2, 5.13, 6.21; but ἁλὸς κέλευθον ἀ. Pi. P. 5.88 is to open or first show the way over the sea.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be open, stand open, lie open, ὄπισθε τῆς ἀνοιγομένης θύρης Hdt. 1.9; ἀνεῳγμένην καταλαμβάνειν τὴν θύραν Pl. Smp. 174e; ἀνεῳγμένας πύλας Ἅιδου E. Hipp. 56; δικαστήρια ἀνοίγεται Pl. R. 405a; παρέξει τἀμπόριʼ ἀνεῳγμένα Ar. Av. 1523; ἀνέῳκται τὸ δεσμωτήριον D. 24.208; λέων τὰ ἐντὸς ἀνοιχθείς cut open, Arist. HA 497b17; κόλποι διʼ ἀλλήλων ἀνοιγόμενοι opening one into another, Plu. Crass. 4: metaph., θησαυρὸς ὡς ἀνοίγνυται κακῶν E. Ion 923.
blow up, inflate, Poll. 4.179: aor. inf. ἀνοιδῆναι Q.S. 14.470.

children.label: II
children.definition: Nic. Fr. 68.7.
dilatation, opp. συστολή, Plot. 4.5.7 (pl.).

definition: ἀνοιδέω, Ep. ἀνοιδ-είω Nic. Th. 855: fut. -ήσω: aor. ἀνῴδησα E. Hipp. 1210, Pl. Ti. 84e: pf. ἀνῴδηκα Hp. Acut. 10:—

children.definition: swell up, Hp. l.c.; of a wave, E. l.c., cf. Alciphr. 1.10; of wind in the body, Pl. l.c.; of figs ripening, Nic. l.c.; τὰ στέρνα ἀνῴδει Aeschin. Ep. 1.2; τὸ κάλυμμα ἀνῳδηκός swollen out, inflated, Arist. HA 625a2, cf. GA 728b28.

θυμὸς ἀνοιδέει Hdt. 7.39; ὀργαῖς . . -ούσαις Phld. Ir. p.63 W.; of anger, ἀνοιδήσας ὁ βασιλεύς Philostr. VA 7.33 (so in Med., θυμὸν ἀνοιδήσαντο they swelled with rage, Q.S. 9.345); ἀνοιδούσης τῆς νόσου Philostr. VA 4.4.
swelling, intumescence, τῶν μαστῶν Arist. HA 574b16, al.; θαλάσσης Id. Mu. 399a27 (pl.).
make to swell, σῖτον Thphr. CP 4.13.7:— Pass., = ἀνοιδέω, Hp. Acut. 10.
not of the family, S.E. P. 1.67: Comp. -ότερος less closely related, Phlp. in Ph. 256.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: unfitting, unseasonable, Cic. Att. 16.11.4, D.S. 3.56, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.102a: c. gen., foreign to, incongruous with, Epicur. Ep. 3p.60U., Plb. 6.10.1, 24.5.13, D.S. 12.21: c. dat., dissimilar to, Plb. 5.96.8; alien from, κενοδοξίᾳ Porph. Antr. 4 ( Sup.): abs., Phld. Po. 1676.9, Id. D. 3.8 ( Comp.). Adv. -ως, ῥηθῆναι Simp. in Ph. 350.27.

children.label: III
children.definition: not in its domicile, Vett.Val. 50.2. Adv. -ως Id. 44.5.
ineptitude, Eustr. in EN 364.18.
incongruity, Iamb. Myst. 1.4.
not to be adapted, alien, ἀλλήλοις M.Ant. 12.30.

definition: ἀνοικῆ παρὰ τὸ εἰκὸς εἰρημένον, EM 110.55, cf. Hsch. s.v. ἀνοκηδεολόγον.

children.definition: remove up the country, ἀ. τὴν Σπάρτην, i.e. break it up as a city, Arist. Rh.Al. 1423a7; ἀ. τινὰς ἐς τὴν Περσίδα Paus. 1.25.5, cf. Str. 13.3.3; ἀ. [τέττιγας] φθόνου ἐς δένδρα remove them out of envyʼs way, dub. in Philostr. VA 7.11 (leg. ἀπ-):— Pass. and Med., shift oneʼs dwelling up the country, migrate inland or to higher ground, αὐτοὶ δʼ ἀνῳκίσανθʼ ὅπως ἀνωτάτω Ar. Pax 207, cf. Av. 1351, Str. 9.2.17, App. Pun. 84; and of cities, to be built inland or away from the coast, Th. 1.7:—generally, migrate, ἀνοικίσασθαι εἰς Ὄλυνθον Id. 1.58, cf. 8.31.

children.label: II
children.definition: resettle, colonize afresh, Paus. 2.1.2, Memn. 60 ( Med.); rebuild, Aps. pp. 239,245 H.:— Pass., to be repeopled, Plu. Luc. 29.
shifting people upward and inland, App. Pun. 84.

definition: ἀνοικισμός, ὁ, = foreg., Str. 9.2.17, prob. in Ph. 2.526.

children.label: II
children.definition: rebuilding, restoration, πόλεων Hdn. 3.6.9.
without a dominant planet, Vett.Val. 134.17, 151.5.
build up, τὰ χείλεα τοῦ ποταμοῦ . . ἀνοικοδόμηδε πλίνθοισι Hdt. 1.186.

data.quote: τὰ χείλεα τοῦ ποταμοῦ . . ἀνοικοδόμηδε πλίνθοισι

children.definition: wall up, λαύρας καιναῖς πλίνθοισιν ἀ. Ar. Pax 100; θύραν Lycurg. 128; πύλας dub.l. in D.S. 11.21 (in this sense ἀποικ- is a freq. v.l.).

children.label: II
children.definition: build again, rebuild, πόλιν καὶ τείχη Th. 1.89, cf. Jusj. ap. Lycurg. 81, X. HG 4.4.19, etc.; ἀ. χώραν occupy again with buildings, D.S. 15.66:— Pass., metaph., to be exalted, LXX Ma. 3.15.
rebuilding, restoration, PLond. 2.216.18 (i A.D.), PAmh. 93.19 (ii A.D.); Dor. ἀνοικοδο-μά IG 12(1).9 ( Rhodes).

definition: ἀνοικοδόμησις, εως, ἡ, = foreg., Arist. Ath. 23.4.

children.definition: building up, IG 4.823.6 ( Troezen), Sch. Th. 8.90.
not set in order, unarranged, Macho ap. Ath. 8.341b, Longin. 33.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., managing badly, Plu. Curios. 2.517e, v.l. in Gell. 12.12.4.
houseless, homeless, ἄ. ποιέειν τινά Hdt. 3.145; cf. ἄοικος.
Hdn. Epim. 257.
one must open, E. Ion 1387.
one who opens, A.D. Synt. 324.6.
fit for opening, Lyd. Mens. 4.64: -κόν means of opening the mouth, Orib. Fr. 48.
pitiless, merciless, S. Fr. 659.8, AP 7.303 ( Antip. Sid.).
unmourned, σῶμα [ Arist.] Pepl. 28.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., pitiless, Περσεφόνης θάλαμοι IG 2.3765 ( Supp. p.283). Adv. -τως Antipho 1.25.
capable of being opened, Babr. 59.11, Luc. VH 1.24.
pitiless, ruthless, E. Tr. 787, Ar. Th. 1022. Adv. -τως without pity, without being pitied, S. OT 180, E. Tr. 756: also ἀνοίκτρως Ant.Lib. 39 (s.v.l.).
wail aloud, A. Pers. 465, Th. 3.113, Telecl. 1 D.
without need to wail, with impunity, S. Aj. 1227; without wailing, Philostr.Jun. Im. 10.
unmourned, unlamented, A. Ch. 433, 511.
Hdn. Epim. 216.

opening, πυλῶν Th. 4.67, 68; πόρων Thphr. Od. 13; χειλῶν Plu. QConv. 2.738c, cf. PMag.Lond. 46.274 (iv A.D.): pl., Porph. Antr. 27; ἄ. τοῦ στόματος, Hebraism for παρρησία, LXX Ez. 29.21, 2 Ep.Cor. 6.11, Ep.Eph. 6.19, etc.
bringing back, Suid.
to be referred, E. Fr. 970.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀνοιστέον one must carry back or report, S. Ant. 272, E. HF 1221:— one must refer, τι πρός τι Plu. Phoc. 5; ἐπί τι Thphr. CP 4.11.8.
brought back, ἀ. ἔς τινα referred to some one for decision, Hdt. 6.66 (v.l. ἀνωΐστου).
goad to madness, E. Ba. 979; ἔρωτι καρδίην ἀνοιστρηθείς Herod. 1.57.

definition: ἀνόκαιον ὑπερῷον, γράφεται καὶ ἀνώγεων, Hsch.

children.definition: POxy. 743.39 (i B.C.), PFay. 130.14 (iii A.D.).
hold back, stay, hinder, ἀ. τὰς νέας keep them riding at anchor, Hdt. 6.116 (cf. Hsch. s.v. ἀνακωχεύω), etc.: metaph., of a chariot, hold it in, keep it back, S. El. 732; also ἀ. πόλεμον D.H. 9.16.
ἀ. τὸν τόνον τῶν ὅπλων keep up the tension of the ropes, keep them taut, Hdt. 7.36.
keep afloat, Arist. Cael. 313a23.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἑαυτόν), keep still, Hdt. 9.13; hold back, of ships, D.S. 11.18.—The form ἀνακωχέω support, relieve strain upon, is found in Hp. Art. 9, 38, Mochl. 2.
ὄκωχα pf. of ἔχω), stay, cessation, κακῶν Th. 4.117; ἀ. νομῆς a stay in the spreading of the ulcer, Aret. SD 2.9, cf. 1.8.
cessation of arms, truce, διʼ ἀνοκωχῆς γίγνεσθαί τινι to be at truce with one, Th. 1.40; ἀ. ἐστί τινι πρός τινα one party has a truce with another, Id. 5.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: hindrance, τριβὴ καὶ ἀ. τῶν Ἐλλήνων Id. 8.87. (Archaic word used by Th. acc. to D.H. Amm. 2.3. Mss. generally have the corrupt form ἀνακωχή, which gave rise to a deriv. παρὰ τὸ ἄνω τὰς ἀκωκὰς ἔχειν EM 96.52: but Hsch. gives the correct form. Ammon. Diff. 19 attempts to distinguish the forms.)

data.quote: παρὰ τὸ ἄνω τὰς ἀκωκὰς ἔχειν

definition: ἀνοκώχησις, εως, ἡ, glossed by σύμπτωσις, Bacch. ap. Erot. s.v. ( ἀνακ- codd.).

children.definition: to be ἄνολβος, Epic. Oxy. 1794.13.
the state of an ἄνολβος, misery, Hes. Op. 319 [ ῑ].

definition: ἀνόλβιος, ον, = sq., v.l. in Hdt. 1.32.

children.definition: unblest, wretched, luckless, ἦμαρ Orac. ap. Hdt. 1.85; γαῖα, ὄμμα, E. Hel. 247, IA 354; ὤμοι ἐμῶν ἄνολβα βουλευμάτων, for ἐμὰ . . βουλεύματα, S. Ant. 1265: of persons, Thgn. 288 ( Comp.), A. Eu. 551, S. Aj. 1156, etc.
without means, poor, Arat. 1073.
not ruined, having escaped ruin, Il. 13.761.
slip or glide back, return, ἔς τινα Call. Fr. 96.
hauling up, λίθων Th. 4.112; ἀ. καὶ καθολκή Aen.Tact. 10.12.
cry aloud, shout aloud, ἀνωλόλυξα χαρᾶς ὕπο A. Ag. 587, cf. Simon. 148.2, S. Tr. 205, E. Med. 1173, etc.
bewail loudly, S. El. 750: but c. acc. cogn., βοὴν ἀ. E. Tr. 1000.

children.label: II
children.definition: excite by Bacchic cries, πρώτας δὲ Θήβας . . ἀνωλόλυξα Id. Ba. 24.
bewail aloud, Th. 8.81, X. Cyr. 7.3.14, J. AJ 2.6.4: c. part., ἀ. ποθῶν . . Pl. Prt. 327d.
an Olympiad omitted in the list, Paus. 6.22.3.
restore to equality, equalize, Pass., pf. inf. ἀνωμαλίσθαι Arist. Rh. 1412a16: fut., cj. in Pol. 1265a40; cf. sq. [ἀνομάλωσις]
restoration of equality, equalization, Arist. Pol. 1274b9.
gush out with water, πηγή Ph. 2.91: metaph., ὥσπερ ἀπὸ γῆς τῆς αἰσθήσεως -ησάντων παθῶν 1.575: c. acc., Pour forth, ὕδωρ 2.115: metaph., LXX Si. 18.29, al., Ph. 1.477.

data.quote: ὥσπερ ἀπὸ γῆς τῆς αἰσθήσεως -ησάντων παθῶν

children.definition: rainy, Nic. Al. 288.
want of rain, Arist. HA 606b20, D.S. 1.29, J. AJ 8.13.2, Ph. 2.383: metaph., [ τὴν παίδευσιν] οὔτε ὄμβρος οὔτε ἀ. ἀφαιρεῖται Antipho Soph. 60.

data.quote: τὴν παίδευσιν] οὔτε ὄμβρος οὔτε ἀ. ἀφαιρεῖται

children.definition: without rain, of countries, Hdt. 2.22, 4.185.
ἄ. ῥοαί streams not fed by showers, E. Ba. 406.
to be ἄνομος, act lawlessly, περὶ τὸ ἱρόν Hdt. 1.144.
Pass., to be unlawfully used, POxy. 1465.9 (i B.C.).
of unlike age, Procl. in Prm. p.949S.
transgression of the law, Lys. ap. Phot.p.143 R., LXX Le. 20.14, al., Stoic. 3.136, D.S. 17.5.

lawlessness, lawless conduct, opp. δικαιοσύνη, Hdt. 1.96, 97; ἀ. νόμων κρατεῖ E. IA 1095 (lyr.); ἀ. ἀμύνειν Antipho 4.1.7; ἀ. ὀφλισκάνειν E. Ion 443; ἀντὶ αὐτονομίας . . εἰς ἀνομίας ἐμπίπτειν Isoc. 6.64, cf. Plu. Amat. 2.755b; ζῆν ἐν πάσῃ ἀναρχίᾳ καὶ ἀ. Pl. R. 575a.

data.quote: ζῆν ἐν πάσῃ ἀναρχίᾳ καὶ ἀ.

children.definition: the negation of law, opp. νόμος, D. 24.152.
having no communion with others, unsociable, Pl. Lg. 951a, Plu. Adul. 2.50b, etc.
ἀ. παιδείας uneducated, Pl. Ep. 332c: abs., Luc. Merc.Cond. 14: c. dat., ἀ. τοῖς ἔργοις τῆς τέχνης Gal. 15.159, 18(1).287.
Pl. Min. 314d.
not customary, Orac. ap. Phleg. Mir. 10.
without mist, ἀήρ Arist. Mu. 394a23.
eyeless, sightless, S. Ph. 856 (lyr.), Orph. Fr. 82.
difference in kind, Epicur. Fr. 36.
of different kind, Epicur. Fr. 36 (prob.), Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.81, Arr. Epict. 1.20.2, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 116.10, al., S.E. M. 8.229.
differing in species, Plot. 4.3.2, Iamb. Myst. 1.19, Dam. Pr. 34; v.l. for ἀνομοιοειδής, Arist. EN 1163b32. Adv. -ειδῶς Dam. Pr. 37.
having a different bent, S.E. M. 7.56.
unregulated by law, Pl. Lg. 781a, 785a, Arist. Pol. 1269b19; ἄγραφον καὶ ἀ. φύσεως δίκαιον D.H. 7.41.
of unevenly distributed weight, Arist. Cael. 273b23.
of different kind, Ph. 2.307. Adv. -νῶς in a different gender, Sch.rec. S. Ant. 74.
with dissimilar angles, Papp. 216.20.
of unlike kind, heterogeneous, φιλίαι Arist. EN 1163b32, cf. Dam. Pr. 440:—hence Subst. ἀνομοιο-είδεια, ἡ, A.D. Pron. 101.22.
with different terminations, A.D. Synt. 167.25.
consisting of unlike parts, not homogeneous, esp. of organs, opp. tissues, Arist. HA 486a7, Mete. 388a18, GA 722b31, Thphr. Fr. 22, Gal. 6.844, al.
συστήματα] κατὰ περικοπὴν ἀνομοιομερῆ Heph. Poëm. 4.
causing unlikeness, Dam. Pr. 342.
with unlike inflexions, Eust. 1228.62. Adv. -τως Id. 631.27.

definition: ἀνόμοιος, ον, Pl. Phlb. 13e, etc., also α, ον Isoc. 12.225, etc.:—

children.definition: unlike, dissimilar, Pi. N. 8.28; ἀ. τινι unlike it, Pl. Grg. 513b, al.; ἐξ ἀνομοίων ἡ πόλις is composed of dissimilar elements, Arist. Pol. 1277a5. Adv. -ως Th. 1.84, Pl. R. 388c, al.; ἀ. ἔχειν X. An. 7.7.49.
Theol.Ar. 9,58.
consisting of unequal strophes, Heph. Poëm. 5.3.
of unlike form, Gal. 18(1).774, Procl. Inst. 210, Phlp. in Ph. 677.2.
unlikeness, dissimilarity, Pl. Prm. 159e, Plt. 273d, Thphr. CP 1.2.2, Hierocl. in CA 26p.481M.: in pl., Pl. Plt. 294b, Arist. Po. 1448a10.
differing in modality (including quantity and quality, πρότασις Eustr. in A. Po. 52.17.
of different kind, Sm. Le. 19.19.
of dissimilar quantity, Eust. 13.7.
of different colour, Alex.Aphr. de An. 146.8.
make unlike or dissimilar, Pl. R. 546b, Prm. 148b:— Pass. (c. fut. Med., Porph. Abst. 1.37), to be or become so, Pl. Tht. 166b, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀνά, ὁμοιόω) make even again, PHal. 1.100 (iii B.C.).
unlike, Procl. Inst. 203.
a making unlike, dissimilarity, Pl. Tht. 166c.

agree upon a thing, come to an understanding, περί τινος Pl. R. 442e; πρὸς ἀλλήλους ib. 348b; πρός τι with a view to . ., Id. Tht. 164c; τινί with a person, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1070d ( Act. in codd.): abs., admit, Muson. Fr. 17p.92H., Sammelb. 4638.14.
recapitulate, sum up oneʼs conclusions, τὰ εἰρημένα Pl. Smp. 200e.
pay money by note of hand or order, Lys. ap. Phot.p.143 R., IG 1.188.34:— hence Subst. ἀνομολόγημα, ατος, τό, promissory note, ib. 17.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., in later Prose, ἀ. τινί Plu. Comm.not. 2.1070d codd.; D. 18.86 uses the pf. in pass. sense, ἀνωμολόγημαι . . τὰ ἄριστα πράττειν I am allowed by all to have done what is best, cf. ib. 266, 60.4, and late Prose, Ph. 1.161, al.: aor. part. Pass. -ηθείς 2.520.
one must admit, τοῦτο περὶ αὐτῶν Pl. R. 452e, cf. Lg. 737c.
agreed on again, under a renewed bill for both the principal debt and the unpaid interest, AB 211.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ- priv.) inconsistent, τὸ ἀ. Ptol. Tetr. 47.
verbal agreement, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀνομόλογος) disagreement, Str. 2.3.3, Plu. Comp.Nic.Crass. 1.
failure to lead a consistent life, title of treatise by Chrysipp., Stoic. 3.94, cf. Posidon. ib. 112; generally, inconsistency, Hierocl. p.56A.
not agreeing, incongruous, S.E. M. 8.331, cf. Harp. s.v. ἀσυνθετώτατον, Apollon.Cit. 3: c. dat., Alex.Aphr. in Top. 548.17. Adv. -γως Porph. Abst. 2.40.
not agreeing, inconsistent, ἵνα μὴ ἀ. ἦ ὁ λόγος Pl. Grg. 495a; ἀ. τοῖς προειρημένοις Arist. APr. 48a21, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.125.

data.quote: ἵνα μὴ ἀ. ἦ ὁ λόγος

children.definition: not admitted, not granted, τὰ ἀνομολογούμενα συνάγειν Arist. Rh. 1396b28, cf. 1400a15:— Adj., compd. of ἀ- priv. and ὁμολογούμενος; for a Verb ἀνομολογέομαι, disagree with, does not occur. Adv. -νως Gal. 5.470.

lawless, impious, τράπεζα Hdt. 1.162; of persons, S. OC 142, al.; στρατός Tr. 1096; Ἐχίονος γόνος E. Ba. 995; of things, θυσία A. Ag. 151; πάθη E. Or. 1455; μοναρχία Pl. Plt. 302e: τὰ ἄνομα lawless acts, Hdt. 1.8: Comp. -ώτερος Pl. Hp.Ma. 285a. Adv. -μως E. Med. 1000, Antipho 4.1.2, Th. 4.92.
ἀ. θεοῦ, i.e. without (the Mosaic) Law and therefore without God, 1 Ep.Cor. 9.21. Adv. ἀνόμως, = χωρὶς νόμου, Ep.Rom. 2.12.
illegal, κατοχή POxy. 237 vii 11 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: unmusical, νόμος ἄ. A. Ag. 1142 (lyr.).
contradictory, PHib. 31.4.15.
differing in οὐσία, Ps- Alex.Aphr. in SE 12.17.
of a different order, Dam. Pr. 119; not co-ordinated, of lines of vision, prob. l. in Gal. UP 10.12; cf. ὁμοταγής.
differing in substance, Phlp. in de An. 526.18.

definition: ἀνονδόκως ἄνωθεν, Hsch. (fort. ἀνοκόνδως, cf. ἀνάκανδα).

children.definition: irreproachable, Nic.Dam. p.119D.

unprofitable, περισσὰ κἀνόνητα σώματα S. Aj. 758; ὦ πολλὰ λέξας . . κἀνόνητʼ ἔπη v.l. ib. 1272; ἀ. γάμος E. Or. 1501 (lyr.), cf. Hel. 886; ἀ. γίγνεσθαι D. 9.40, cf. Plu. Mul.virt. 2.248a; τινί Arist. EN 1095a9, cf. Pol. 1334b40; ἄργυρον εἰς ἀνόνατα ῥέοντα Cerc. 4.4:—neut. pl. ἀνόνητα is freq. in E. as Adv., in vain, as Hec. 766, Alc. 412 (lyr.), al.; ἀνόνητα πονεῖν Pl. R. 486c: regul. Adv. -τως Pall. in Hp. 2.147D, Sch. E. Or. 1501: Comp., ibid.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., c. gen., τῶν ἀγαθῶν ἀ. τινα ποιῆσαι deprive of all benefit from . ., D. 18.141, cf. 19.315, Plu. Praec. 2.800d, Nic.Dam.p.13D.

definition: ἀνονόμαστος, ον, faulty form for ἀνωνόμαστος, Gal. 7.425, Hdn. Epim. 203, Suid.

children.definition: not to be written with the acute accent, Eust. 930.57.

without understanding, silly, κραδίη Il. 21.441; ψυχή Pl. Ti. 44a, etc.; of persons, S. Ant. 99; ἄνους τε καὶ γέρων ἅμα ib. 281; πλοῦτος ἄ. wealth without wit, AP 9.43 ( Parmen.): Comp. ἀνούστερος A. Pr. 987: Sup. ἀνούστατος Pherecr. 19D. Adv., Comp. ἀνουστέρως S. Fr. 589.1.

definition: ἀνοπαῖα, only in Od. 1.320 ὄρνις δʼ ὣς ἀνοπαῖα διέπτατο, where it is variously written and explained:

children.definition: Hdn.Gr. 2.133, it is an Adv. (compd. of ἀνά, *ὄπτομαι), she flew away unseen, unnoticed; or, acc. to Eust., = ἄνω, ἀνωφερές, up into the air, cf. καρπαλίμως ἀνόπαιον Emp. 51, and Ἀνόπαια, the name of the pass above Thermopylae ( Hdt. 7.216).
Aristarch., ἀνόπαια or πανόπαια, a kind of eagle, cf. Hebr. ᾰνᾱπηᾱ ‘heron’.
An.Ox. 1.83, ἀνʼ ὀπαῖα ( ἀνὰ ὀπήν) up by the hole in the roof, up the smoke-vent.
backwards, Hsch.; farther back, in a book. etc., Eust. 1031.46.

without the ὅπλον or large shield, of the Persians, who bore only γέρρα, Hdt. 9.62: generally, unarmed, Pl. Euthd. 299b, Onos. 42.17; τὸ ἄ., opp. τὸ ὁπλιτικόν, of citizens not entrusted with arms, Arist. Pol. 1289b32:—of ships, unarmed, Plb. 2.12.3. (On the form v. ἄοπλος.)
unseen, Suid.

definition: ἄνορ νοῦς, Scythian word, Hsch., cf. Hdn. Epim. 240.

children.definition: Pl. Ti. 51a, Polycharm. 1.
knead up: in Pass., ἀνωργασμένον σῶμα relaxed, Hp. Int. 21.

children.label: II
children.definition: toss, dandle, παιδία Hsch. (nisi ad ἀνορταλίζειν spectat).
without instruments, Plu. Per. 16; βίος Porph. Abst. 1.6; κίνησις ἀ. monement without limbs for the purpose, of serpents, Plu. Isid. 2.381b.

definition: ἀνόργητος, ον, Hellenistic for ἄνοργος, Moer. 12, cf. Sch. Pi. P. 10.33.

children.definition: Hsch., Suid.
not celebrated with orgies, ἱερά Ar. Lys. 898; τελεταί, i.e. no true mysteries, Ph. 1.156.
in whose honour no orgies are held, Pl. Epin. 985d.

children.label: II
children.definition: uninitiated, Ph. 2.268; ἀμύητος καὶ ἀ. τῶν ἱερῶν Them. Or. 13.166c.
not wrathful, Cratin. 385.

definition: ἀνορέα, ἡ, more common in Ion. form ἠνορέη (q.v.), Pi. O. 8.67, al., Theoc. 29.19.

children.definition: hand up, of the elephantʼs use of his trunk, Arist. HA 497b28.
have no appetite, Antyll. ap. Orib. 5.29.8, Sor. 2.43.
without appetite for, ἀπολαύσεως Arist. VV 1250b9; ἡδονῆς Andronic. Rhod. p.576 M.; περὶ τὰς ἀπολαύσεις Arist. VV 1250a8: abs., Sor. 1.24, Plu. Cohib. 2.460a, etc. Adv. ἀνορέκτως, ἔχειν Gal. 10.576.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., not desired, of food, Plu. QConv. 2.664a.
want of desire or appetite, Ti.Locr. 102e, Aret. CA 2.3.
call out, shout aloud, And. 1.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: prick up, τὰ ὦτα Ph. 2.188, al.:— Pass., ἐγήγερται καὶ ἀνωρθίασται 1.381.
sloping, ἄ. εἰς τὸ εἴσω IG 2(2).463.60; prob. corrupt in Herophil. ap. Gal. 2.571.

definition: ἀνορθόω, aor. ἀνώρθωσα E. Alc. 1138, Isoc. 5.64, etc.: plpf. with double augm. ἠνωρθώκει v.l. in Lib. Ep. 1039: the double augm. is common in the compd. ἐπανορθόω:—

children.definition: set up again, restore, rebuild, τὸν νηόν Hdt. 1.19; τὸ τεῖχος 7.208; τὸ στρατόπεδον Th. 6.88, etc.; τὸ σῶμά τινος E. Ba. 364:— Med., ἀνορθοῦσθαι τὰ πίπτοντα τῶν οἰκοδομημάτων have them rebuilt, Arist. Pol. 1322b20.
restore to health or well being. πόλιν S. OT 46: τινά Pl. Lg. 919d.
set straight again, set right, correct, τινά E. Supp. 1228; τὰ ἀλλότρια κακά Pl. R. 346e.
restoration, τειχῶν PRyl. 157.13 (ii A.D.); = ἐπανόρθωσις, Ph. Fr. 54 H.; f.l. in Plb. 15.20.5, Corn. ND 16.
stir up, arouse, (sc. παφλάσμους) Alc. Supp. 25.8.
bound by no oath, Poll. 1.39.
start up, try eagerly to do a thing, c. acc. cogn., στόλον Opp. H. 3.105.— Hsch. has the Act. in neut. signf., and so Ruf. ap. Orib. 45.30.40, mount, of a disease.
with an upward rush, Sch. Opp. H. 5.210.
impetuous, Erot. s.v. ἀνάσσυτος.
take [ships] from their moorings, ἐς τὸ πέλαγος τὰς ναῦς D.C. 48.48:— Med., put to sea, Id. 42.7:— Pass., anchor above, ὑπὲρ τόπον Id. 71.2.
without harbour, πέτραι Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. λισσάδας πέτρας: metaph., ὑμέναιον ὃν δόμοις ἄνορμον εἰσέπλευσας S. OT 423.

rouse, stir up, ἀνὰ μὲν φόρμιγγʼ, ἀνὰ δʼ αὐλὸν ὄρσομεν Pi. N. 9.8; τινά A.R. 4.1352:— Pass., ἂν δʼ ἄρα Τυδεΐδης ὦρτο ( Ep. aor.) up he started, Il. 23.812, cf. Od. 8.3; ἀνὰ δʼ ὤρνυτʼ Ἰήσων A.R. 1.349.

data.quote: ἀνὰ μὲν φόρμιγγʼ, ἀνὰ δʼ αὐλὸν ὄρσομεν

definition: ἀνορούω, poet. Verb, used by Hom. only in aor. 1 ( X. Eq. 3.7, 8.5 has pres. inf. and part.):—

children.definition: start up, leap up, abs., Il. 9.193, Od. 3.149, Sapph. 44.11 L.-P., etc.; ἐκ δὲ θρόνων ἀνόρουσαν Od. 22.23; ἐξ ὕπνοιο μάλα κραιπνῶς ἀ. Il. 10.162, etc.; ἐς δίφρον δʼ ἀ. 11.273; so Ἠέλιος δʼ ἀνόρουσε . . οὐρανὸν ἐς . . Helios went swiftly up the sky, Od. 3.1; τοῖσι δὲ Νέστωρ ἡδυεπὴς ἀ. Il. 1.248; ἀνορούσαις ( Aeol. part.) Pi. O. 7.37.
roofless, πέτρα E. Ba. 38.
without rump, καρκίνος Arist. HA 525b31; πτῆσις ἀ. without help from the tail or rump, of insects, ib. 532a24.
clap the wings and crow, like a cock, Ar. Eq. 1344.
not obtained by digging, ἅλες Orib. Eup. 4.24.

definition: ἀνορύσσω, Att. ἀνορύττω, pf. Pass. ἀνορώρυγμαι Men. 468:—

children.definition: dig up what has been buried, τὰ ὀστέα Hdt. 2.41, Lycurg. 113; ὑδρίας Ar. Av. 602; τινά Id. Pax 372, Plu. Ages. 20; χρυσόν Luc. Cont. 11.
ἀ. τάφον dig up, break open, destroy it, Hdt. 1.68, Isoc. 16.26.
leap up and dance, E. Supp. 719; of the soul, Ph. 1.379.
without testicles, i.e. castrated, Hp. Vict. 2.49.

children.label: II
children.definition: without stones, φοίνικες. Arist. Fr. 267.
untended, S. Fr. 264.
without sickness, S. Fr. 1014, PIand. 13.11 (iv A.D.).
freedom from sickness, Poll. 3.107.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ- priv., ὅσιος) ἀνοσίhα ϝοι γένοιτυ may he be accursed, Inscr. Cypr. 135.29 H. (perh. neut. pl. ἀνόσιhα); cf. sq. [ἀνόσιος]

definition: ἀνόσιος, ον, more rarely α, ον E. Tr. 1316 (lyr.), Aeschin. 2.157 (dub.), and later:—

children.definition: unholy, profane, opp. ἄδικος, as ὅσιος to δίκαιος (v. ὅσιος I.1), of persons, A. Th. 611, S. OT 353, etc.; ἀ. ὁ θεομισής Pl. Euthphr. 7a; ἄδικος καὶ ἀ. Id. Grg. 505b.

ἔργον, μόρος, στόμα, etc., Hdt. 2.114, 3.65, S. OC 981, etc.; αὐδῶν ἀνόσιʼ οὐδὲ ῥητά μοι Id. OT 1289; ἀνόσια πάσχειν Antipho 2.4.7; ἀσεβὲς μηδὲν μηδὲ ἀ. X. Cyr. 8.7.22; οὐ μόνον ἄνομον ἀλλὰ καὶ ἀ. Id. Lac. 8.5; ἀ. νέκυς a corpse with all the rites unpaid, S. Ant. 1071; ἀ. τι γεγένηται ἐμοῦ παρόντος the holy rites have been profaned, Antipho 5.84.

data.quote: οὐ μόνον ἄνομον ἀλλὰ καὶ ἀ.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -ίως in unholy wise, S. Ph. 257; κάτω γῆς ἀ. οἰκῶν without funeral rites, or through an unholy deed, E. El. 677.
unholiness, wickedness, v.l. in Pl. Euthphr. 5d; ἀ. καὶ δεινότης τῶν πεπραγμένων Isoc. 12.121.
act impiously, wickedly, Pl. Lg. 905b, Ph. 2.128, D.C. 56.5, 77.12.
impious act, Ph. 2.313, Porph. Chr. 58.
impiety, wickedness, Pl. Ep. 335b, Plu. Arat. 54, D.C. 71.30.
acting impiously, Pl. Ep. 352c, Arist. EN 1166b5, Ph. 2.313.
without smell, v.l. in Hp. Acut. 63, cf. Arist. HA 634b19, etc.; ἴχνη ἄνοσμα footsteps that leave no scent, Poll. 5.12:—but ἄοσμος (q.v.) was preferred.

definition: ἄνοσος, Ion. and Ep. ἄνουσος, ον,

children.definition: without sickness, healthy, sound, of persons, ἀσκηθέες καὶ ἄ. Od. 14.255; ἄ. καὶ ἀγήραοι Pi. Fr. 143, cf. Pl. Ti. 33a; ἄπηρος, ἄ. Hdt. 1.32; λῶστον δὲ τὸ ζῆν ἄ. S. Fr. 356. Adv. ἀνόσως, διάγειν Hp. Epid. 1.1; ζῆν Ph. 1.267; ἄ. ᾤχετʼ ἐς ἡμιθέους IG 5(2).472.13 ( Megalopolis, ii/iii A.D.).
ἄ. κακῶν untouched by ill, E. IA 982; ἄ. πρὸς τὰ ἄλλα ἀρρωστήματα, τῶν ἄλλων ἀρρωστημάτων, Arist. HA 604a12, 22.
free from sickness, ἔτος ἄ. ἐς τὰς ἄλλας ἀσθενείας Th. 2.49; ἕξις, λόγος ἄ., Plu. Cic. 8, Lib.educ.2.7b.

data.quote: ἔτος ἄ. ἐς τὰς ἄλλας ἀσθενείας

children.label: II
children.definition: not causing disease, harmless, E. Ion 1201.
boneless, of the polypus, Hes. Op. 524 ( Lacon. acc. to Clitarch. ap. Procl.ad loc.) cf. Hp. Epid. 2.2.19; ἀ. ἡ καρδία Arist. PA 666b17; τὰ περὶ τὴν κοιλίαν ib. 655a2; φυὴ μελέων Opp. H. 1.639.
unreturning, Orph. A. 1269.

children.label: II
children.definition: whence none return, χῶρος ἐνέρων AP 7.467 (Antip. Sid.), cf. Opp. H. 3.586, etc.
not returning, κεῖνον ἀ. ἔθηκεν cut off his return, Od. 4.182.
not to be retraced, κέλευθος E. HF 431 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: giving a low yield, of corn, Thphr. CP 3.21.1 ( Sup.); not nutritious, Sor. 1.91.
unreturning, without return, πάντας ὄλεσαν καὶ ἔθηκαν ἀνόστους Od. 24.528; πάντες ἐγένοντο ἄ. Arist. Fr. 145: Sup., ἡβάσεις ἥβαν ἀνοστοτάταν never, never to return, AP 7.482.

children.label: II
children.definition: = foreg. [ἀνόστιμος] ΙΙ, Thphr. CP 4.13.2 ( Comp.).
with no shell, ᾠά Sch. Nic. Al. 295.
not stolen, Eust. 1768.54.
that cannot be smelt, Arist. de An. 421b6:—also ἀνόσφρ-ητος, ον, Alex.Aphr. de An. 52.15.
free from moisture, dry, τόποι Dsc. 1 Praef. 9; κονιορτός Archig. ap. Orib. 8.2.6.
without the south wind, Hsch. s.v. βορεασμοί.
break out into wailing, A. Ag. 1074, E. Hel. 371 (lyr.).
without ear: without handle, Theoc. Ep. 4.3.
of Anubis, epith. of a kind of thread, PMag.Par. 1.1083.
PMag.Par. 1.901.
sanctuary of Anubis, Roussel Cultes Égyptiens 224 ( Delos, ii B.C.):— also Ἀνουβιεῖον, τό, ib. 229, 231 (ii B.C.).
unwarned, unadmonished, Isoc. 2.4, D. Ep. 3.11.
that will not be warned, Men. Mon. 49, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.283f.
less wavy, cj. in Thphr. HP 3.11.3.
οὐσιώδης, Corp.Herm. 2.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: without the use of an οὐσία (q.v.), PMag.Par. 1.2441.

without substance, οὐδὲ ἄρα ἡ ἑτερότης ἀ. Dam. Pr. 192; ἀ. καὶ νεκροί Procl. in Alc. p.271C., cf. Olymp. in Alc. p.92C.; δύναμις, of God, opp. οὐσιώδης, Procl. Inst. 121. Adv. -ίως Syrian. in Metaph. 114.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: not affecting substance, superficial in action, σώματα Zos.Alch. p.160B., al.
unsubstantiality, Simp. in de An. 247.9.
conferring of non-existence, Simp. in Ph. 433.18.
unwounded bv stroke of sword, ἄβλητος καὶ ἀ. 11.4.540, cf. A.R. 2.75.

children.label: II
children.definition: invulnerable, Nonn. D. 16.157, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: where no wounds are inflicted, ἀγωνες ib. 37.774.
without inflicting a wound, οὐδʼ ἄρα οἵ τις ἀνουτητί γε παρέστη Il. 22.371.

data.quote: οὐδʼ ἄρα οἵ τις ἀνουτητί γε παρέστη

children.label: II
children.definition: without receiving a wound, Q.S. 3.445.
Nic. Th. 719.

children.label: II
children.definition: invulnerable, Nonn. D. 16.382, etc.
brushwood, PPetr. 3p.101.
free from ophthalmia, Dsc. Eup. 1.29.
without eyes, Tz. H. 3.219.
arch oneʼs eyebrows: metaph., to be supercilious, Com.Adesp. 842.
suspensory membrane, in pl., Aret. SA 2.6, 11.
non-copulating, Arist. HA 546b16, al.
raise up, Olymp. in Mete. 24.13.

holding back, stopping, esp. of hostilities: hence mostly in pl., armistice, truce, X. Mem. 4.4.17; ἀνοχὰς ποιεῖσθαι Decr. ap. D. 18.164; διδόναι D.H. 8.68; σπείσασθαι Plu. Pel. 29; αἱ Καλλισθένους ἀ. Aeschin. 2.31; αἱ ἑξαετεῖς ἀ. D.H. 3.59; cf. ἀνοκωχή.
time, opportunity, οὐκ ἔδωκεν αὐτοῖς ἀνοχὴν ἐμβατεῦσαι LXX 1 Ma. 12.25; ἡμερῶν ἀ. delay of some days, POxy. 1068.15 (iii A.D.).
ἀνοχαί, = Lat. feriae, D.C. 39.30.
ἀνοχαὶ δικῶν, = Lat. iustitium, Id. 55.26.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀνέχομαι) long-suffering, forbearance, Ep.Rom. 2.4, 3.26.
ἀνοχὴν ἀναπαύλης διδόναι permission to rest, Hdn. 3.6.10.
relief from disease, Philum. ap. Orib. Syn. 8.3.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: Poll. 4.157, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -κῶς connectedly, Simp. in de An. 285.19.
heaving upwards. Adv. -κῶς S.E. M. 10.83.
heave up, A.R. 1.1167, Opp. H. 5.128, Hsch.
heave out of the way, A.R. 3.1298.
not in the way, not an impediment, Arist. PA 663b20 ( Sup.).
hoist, lift up, AP 9.204 ( Agath.).
evacuation of the bowels, Thphr. HP 3.18.13.
tolerable, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.184.35.
fortify, dub. in Polyaen. 4.11.2.
want of fish ( ὄψον) to eat with bread, ἔφερον δεινῶς τὴν ἀ. Antiph. 190.8; ἀνοψίαν ὑποφέρειν Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.237f.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ion. ἀνοψίη, ἡ, = τὸ μὴ βλέπειν, Hsch. ( ἀνοψοφίην cod.).
without relish, Plu. Sanit. 2.123b.

definition: ἀνρεία, ἡ, coined by Pl. Cra. 413e as etym. of ἀνδρεία.
ἀνσατήρ βουβών ( Lacon.), Hsch. ἄνσατον· ἅψασθαι, συνάψαι (Cret.), Id. ἀνσερίσασθαι· τὸ μόνον πρὸς τὸ πῦρ στῆυαι ( Lacon.), Id.
ἄνστα, ἀνστάς, ἀνστήμεναι, ἀνστήσεις, ἀνστήσων, ἀνστήτην, poet. forms, v. ἀνίστημι.
ἀνσχεθέειν, ἄνσχεο, poet. forms, v. ἀνέχω.

children.definition: over against, face to face, in Hom. mostly in the phrases, ἄ. μάχεσθαι fight man to man, Il. 19.163; ἄ. ἰδεῖν look before one, ib. 13.184, cf. E. Alc. 877 (lyr.); θεοῖς ἄ. ἐῴκει he was like the gods to look at, Il. 24.630; εἴδεται ἄ. πελιδνή Nic. Th. 238; ἄ. τιτύσκεσθαι aim straight at them, Od. 22.266, cf. Pi. N. 6.27; ἄ. πρός τινος Epigr.Gr. 223.4 ( Milet.).

children.label: II
children.definition: over against, Ἤλιδος ἄ. Il. 2.626; ἄ. παρειάων σχομένη κρήδεμνα . . before her cheeks, Od. 1.334; ἄντʼ ὀφθαλμοῖϊν 4.115; also of persons, ἄ. σέθεν before thee, to thy face, ib. 160, cf. 22.232; so in Il. 21.331, with a notion of comparison, confronted with thee; ἕρπει ἄ. τῶ σιδάρω τὸ καλῶς κιθαρίσδεν rivals it, Alcm. 35.
against, Διὸς ἄ. πολεμίζειν Il. 8.428; Διὸς ἄ . . . ἔγχος ἀεῖραι ib. 424; εἴ κέ μευ ἄ. στήης 17.29; Αἴαντος στήμεναι ἄ. ib. 166.

definition: ἄνται ἄνεμοι, and ἀντάς· πνοάς, Hsch. (leg. ἀῆται, ἀήτας).

children.definition: to be indignant in turn, Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 6.7.
love in turn or return, in Pass., Ph. 2.8, Them. Or. 4.55d.
rival as a collector, beggar, Celsus ap. Orig. Cels. 6.42.
shine brightly, Ps.-Callisth. 2.26.
buy with money received in payment for something else, πωλεῖν τι καὶ ἀ. σῖτον X. An. 1.5.5; τὰ ἀνταγορασθέντα D. 35.24.
speak against, reply, ἀντᾱγόρευσεν Pi. P. 4.156.

children.label: II
children.definition: gainsay, contradict, τοῖς ἄρχουσιν Ar. Ra. 1072.
adversity, dub. in IG 14.1977 (pl.).

children.label: I
children.definition: struggle against, prove a match for, τινί, esp. in war, Hdt. 5.109, Th. 6.72, X. Cyr. 1.6.8, etc.; ἀ. ταῖς παρασκευαῖς τινός D. 43.81; πρὸς τοὺς βαρβάρους Inscr.Prien. 17.15, cf. Ep.Hebr. 12.4.
struggle, vie with, τινί Th. 3.38; περί τινος And. 4.2; οἱ ἀνταγωνιζόμενοί τι the parties in a lawsuit, X. Cyr. 8.2.27; [ οἱ ἐλευθέριοι] οὐκ ἀ. περὶ τῶν χρημάτων Arist. Rh. 1366b8.

data.quote: οἱ ἐλευθέριοι] οὐκ ἀ. περὶ τῶν χρημάτων

children.definition: act a part in rivalry with, τινί Plu. Dem. 29.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be set against, τινί X. Oec. 10.12.
competition Hld. 7.6.4.
oppose, be a rival, Arist. Rh. 1416b14.

opponent, competitor, rival, Dialex. 2.7, X. Cyr. 1.6.8, 3.3.36, Alex. 272; τινί τινος X. Hier. 4.6, etc.; ἀ. ἔρωτος a rival in love, E. Tr. 1006, cf. Pl. R. 554e, al.; χαλεποὶ ἀ. τοῖς βαρβάροις Isoc. 4.75; ἀ. τῆς παιδείας opponents of their system of education, Arist. Pol. 1338b37; ἀ. ἔχειν τινὰ ταῖς ἐπιβολαῖς Plb. 2.45.5.

definition: ἀνταγώνιστος, ον, in Poll. 3.141, is interpreted,

children.definition: contending as an adversary;—but ἀνταγωνίστως ( Id. 1.157) is f.l. for ἀνανταγώνιστος in Lib. Decl. 15.21.
injure in return, retaliate upon, ἀλλήλους Pl. Tht. 173a, cf. Cri. 49b, 49c, Max.Tyr. 18.5.
one must retaliate, Max.Tyr. 18.5

sing in answer, esp. of the partridge, answer when another calls, ἀ. ὡς μαχούμενος Arist. HA 614a11, cf. Mir. 845b25, Ael. NA 4.16; ἀ. Μούσαις Luc. Pisc. 6; τοῖς φθεγγομένοις Plu. An seni 2.794c; cry out at one, ἐγὼ δʼ, ἢν τοῦτο δρᾷς, ἀντᾴσομαι Ar. Ec. 887:— Pass., στροφῇ ἀντᾳσθῆναι Poll. 4.112.

data.quote: ἐγὼ δʼ, ἢν τοῦτο δρᾷς, ἀντᾴσομαι

children.definition: Med., ἀνταείρεσθαι χεῖράς τινι raise oneʼs hands against one, make war upon him, Hdt. 3.144, 7.101; or without τινί, 6.44.7.212; also πόλεμον βασιλέϊ ἀ. 8.140.αʹ.
contending against, rivalling, τινός AP 12.68 ( Mel.).
respect in return, αἰδουμένας ἀ. X. Cyr. 8.1.28.
set over against, right opposite, ἀνταία πληγή a wound in front, right in the breast, S. El. 195, E. Andr. 844; ἀνταίαν ἔπαισεν (sc. πληγήν) S. Ant. 1308.
opposed to, hostile, hateful, κνώδαλον ἀ. βροτοῖσιν A. Ch. 588 (lyr.); πομπά E. IA 1323 (lyr.), cf. S. Fr. 72, 334; θεός ib. 335; τἀνταῖα θεῶν their hostile purposes, A. Pers. 604.

children.label: II
children.definition: besought with prayers, epith. of Hecate, etc., A.R. 1.1141, cf. Orph. H. 41.1; ἀνταία· . . ἱκέσιος, A. ( Fr. 223) ap. Hsch.; ἀνταῖος Ζεύς Sch. Il. 22.113.

raise against, χεῖράς τινι AP 7.139 (so in Med., Th. 3.32, 1.53); πόλεμόν τινι Plb. 15.7.8; πρὸς Ἔρωτα μάχην AP 12.147 ( Mel.); raise in reply, λαμπτῆρας Aen.Tact. 26.13:— Med., ὅπλα ἀνταιρόμενοι Th. 1.53, cf. 3.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: rise up or rebel against, withstand, ἀντᾶραί τινι Pl. Euthd. 272a, D. 2.24; πρός τι or τινα, Id. 6.5, Plu. Pyrrh. 15, D.H. 6.48:—so in Med., τινί Luc. Herm. 33, JTr. 34.
rise opposite to or in the same parallel with, τοῖς κατὰ Μερόην τόποις Str. 2.1.2, cf. 20; πρὸς τὴν Λιβύην Plu. Aem. 6.
to be ashamed in turn, Ach.Tat. 8.4.
demand in return, Th. 4.19, Lib. Or. 54.75; σμικρὰ τῆς ἀμνηστίας τὴν βουλήν App. BC 3.35.

children.label: II
children.definition: contest with, τινὶ τὴν ὑπατείαν D.C. 40.53.
make a countercharge, D.C. Fr. 99.
rise over against, Plot. 6.5.11.
sturgeon, Hdt. 4.53, Lync. 1.9, Ael. NA 14.23.
Adj., τάριχος ἀν καῖον Antiph. 186.

definition: ἀντακάς σήμερον, and ἀντακές· σημεῖον (sic), Hsch.; cf. ἀνταλλές.

children.definition: to be reciprocally implied, of the virtues, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.72, cf. S.E. P. 1.68 (abs.); ἀ. ἀλλήλαις αἱ εὐφύειαι Anon. in Tht. 11.16; οὐδὲ ἀ. ἀλλήλαις [ἀκμὴ καὶ λαμπρότης] Hermog. Id. 1.10, cf. Them. in Ph. 150.29.
reciprocal implication, of the virtues, Stoic. 3.76, Procl. in Alc. p.319C.
correspondence, Iamb. in Nic. p.39P.
reciprocally implied, τὸ ἀ. ἀλλήλαις Eustr. in EN 311.15: abs., corresponding, ἕξις dub. in Phld. Rh. 1.27S. (cf. Supp. 15).
hurl against in return, λίθον D.C. 59.28.

hear in turn, ἀντὶ τῶν εἰρημένων ἴσʼ ἀντάκουσον Id. OT 544; ἅ. γʼ εἶπας ἀντήκουσας E. Heracl. 1014 (cj.); κἀμοῦ νῦν ἀντάκουσον Id. Supp. 569; ἀντακούσει τοῦτον ὡς τεθάψεται S. Aj. 1141: abs., listen in return, ἀ. ἐν μέρει A. Eu. 198, cf. Crates Com. 5D.: also in Prose, X. An. 2.5.16, Lib. Decl. 5.89.
hear in turn, Ar. Lys. 527.
opposite headland, Str. 6.1.1.
boast in reply, Eust. 590.11.
return a shout, of friendly armies, Plu. Pyrrh. 32, Flam. 4; of an echo, A. Pers. 390.
exchanging, exchange, barter, Gloss., Simp. in Ph. 1350.32.
that which is given or taken in exchange, φίλου for a friend, E. Or. 1157, cf. LXX Jb. 28.15, al.; τῆς ψυχῆς Ev.Matt. 16.26, cf. Ph. Fr. 110H.
exchanged for another, Men. 16, 254, 513.
one must give in exchange, τινός for a thing, D. 19.223.
one who requites, τῶν κακῶν Phld. Mort. 17 (pl.).
taken as equivalent, πρός τι Porph. Abst. 1.51.

exchange one thing with another, δάκρυα δʼ ἀνταλλάσσετε τοῖς τῆσδε μέλεσι E. Tr. 351; τὴν ἀξίωσιν τῶν ὀνομάτων ἐς τὰ ἔργα ἀ. they changed the signification of the names in relation to things, Th. 3.82; τὴν ψυχὴν τοῦ χρυσίου Poll. 3.113.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., take in exchange, ἄνδρα A. Ch. 133; ἀνταλλάσσεσθαί τί τινος take one thing in exchange for another, E. Hel. 1088, etc.; τι ἀντί τινος D. 16.5; ἀνταλλάσσεσθαι τῇ διανοίᾳ interchange in thought, Pl. Tht. 189c; θάνατον ἀνταλλάξεται shall receive death in exchange, i.e. as a punishment, E. Ph. 1633:—so in Pass., ἀντηλλαγμένου τοῦ ἑκατέρων τρόπου having made an interchange of each otherʼs custom, i.e. having each adopted the way of the other, Th. 4.14.
give in exchange, μηδεμιᾶς χάριτος μηδʼ ὠφελίας τὴν εἰς τοὺς Ἕλληνας εὔνοιαν D. 6.10.

data.quote: μηδεμιᾶς χάριτος μηδʼ ὠφελίας τὴν εἰς τοὺς Ἕλληνας εὔνοιαν

definition: ἀνταλλές ταύτης τῆς ἡμέρας, Hsch.; cf. ἀντακάς, ἀντακές.

children.definition: exchanged, Sch.D.T. p.343 H.
exchange one thing with another, ὅταν δελφῖσι θῆρες ἀνταμείψωνται νομόν Archil. 74.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: repay, requite, punish, ἀνταμείβεσθαί τινα κακοῖς Id. 65; κακαῖσι ποιναῖς A. Pr. 225; παθὼν κακῶς κακοῖσιν ἀντημείβετο Id. Th. 1054; ἀνταμειψόμεσθά σʼ ὥσπερ εἰκὸς ἀντὶ τῶνδε Ar. Th. 723.

data.quote: ἀνταμειψόμεσθά σʼ ὥσπερ εἰκὸς ἀντὶ τῶνδε

children.definition: answer again, τοῖσδε Hdt. 9.79; πρὸς τοὺς φίλους οἷʼ ἀνταμείβει ῥήματʼ S. OC 814; τινὰ οὐδέν ib. 1273; also ὑμᾶς . . τοῖσδʼ ἀνταμείβομαι λόγοις E. Andr. 154.

data.quote: πρὸς τοὺς φίλους οἷʼ ἀνταμείβει ῥήματʼ

children.definition: exchanging, requital, v.l. in LXX Ps. 118 ( 119). 112, Hsch.
neglect in turn, Ph. 2.275.

definition: ἀνταμοιβαῖος, sc. πούς, the foot ⏑ ⏑ - - ⏑, Diom. 1.481 K.

children.definition: interchange, πυρὸς ἀ. τὰ πάντα καὶ πῦρ ἁπάντων Heraclit. 90.

children.definition: repayment, requital, εὐεργεσίας Charito 5.2.
defend oneself against another, resist, Th. 4.19.

children.label: II
children.definition: requite, ἐχθρὸν κακοῖς S. Ant. 643; οἱ ἀνταμυνόμενοι Th. 3.84.
miss a person in the street going to meet him, BGU 1030.5 (iii A. D.).
make go up in turn, X. HG 3.2.15.
cry out in answer or opposition, App. BC 2.131.
read and compare, Cratin. 386; νόμους D. 20 Arg. ii 8, cf. PPetr. 3p.50 (III B.C.).

lead up against, esp. ἀ. νέας put ships to sea against, Hdt. 6.14, cf. Th. 7.37: also ἀ. ναυσὶν ἓξ καὶ ὀγδοήκοντα ib. 52: more freq. abs. in same sense, whether in Act., as Id. 8.38, X. HG 2.1.23, or in Med., as Th. 4.13, X. HG 1.1.5:— Pass., ναυσὶν ἀνταναχθείς D.S. 13.71:—generally, attack, ἀντανήγετο πρὸς τὸ μειράκιον Pl. Erx. 398e.
raise in opposition, [ὄρος] τῇ Οἴτῃ Philostr. VA 4.23.
bring up instead, AP 9.285 ( Phil.).
corresponding diminution, Arist. Top. 158b33.

children.label: II
children.definition: alternate removal, Eust. 1397.44.

children.definition: cancellation, Simp. in Ph. 1237.23.
to be struck off, PTeb. 61(6).220 (ii B.C.).
cancelling opposite sides of an account, striking a balance: metaph., εὐλογιστία ἐστὶν ἐπιστήμη -κή Stoic. 3.64.
strike out of an account, D. 18.231:— Pass., to be cancelled correspondingly, Arist. Metaph. 1040a22, Demad. 59; to be struck off, PTeb. 60.111, al. (ii B.C.).
kill in return, Ph. 2.321 ( Pass.).
set off against, deduct, Sammelb. 4369(a).10, al. (iii B.C.), PRyl. 154.33 ( i A. D., Pass.); prob.l. for ἀνταναίρειν ( ἀνθυφελεῖν), Ar. Fr. 12D.
Med., resume, ἀποβεβληκὼς τὴν ἁλουργίδα οὐκέτι ἀντανείλετο Agath. 4.29.
reflection of light, Placit. 4.14.3, cf. Vett.Val. 1.14, Ath.Med. ap. Orib. 9.12.1 (pl.); also, of sound, echo, Plu. Garr. 2.502d.
bending back, ἀγκίστρου Sch. Opp. H. 1.216.

children.label: II
children.definition: use of a word in an altered sense, Lat. contraria significatio, Quint. Inst. 9.3.68, Sch. A.R. 1.746.
reflexive sense, of words, A.D. Pron. 43.12.
reciprocal, προσηγορία Priscian. Inst. 11.1.
reflect, φῶς v.l. in Plu. QConv. 2.696a:— Pass., ἀντανακλᾶται ἀκτίς S.E. M. 5.82; ὀφθαλμοὶ ἀλλήλοις ἀντανακλώμενοι reflected one in another, Ach.Tat. 1.9.
Pass., to be reflected or echoed, LXX Wi. 17.19, Placit. 4.20.2.
bend back, τὸν ἀγκῶνα Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.13.8.
Pass., to be reflexive, of pronouns, A.D. Synt. 175.12, cf. Pron. 28.3, al.
cause to revert, in writing, εἴς τι πάλιν ἀ. τὸ πέρας CPHerm. 18.11.

throw back again, Phryn. PS p.61B.
cry out in turn or reply, App. Mith. 26.
take over instead, Ptol. Phas. p.11H.
destroy in return, E. Or. 1165.
counteraction, incongruity of position, Vett.Val. 186.28, Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).107.
counteract, Vett.Val. 289.17 ( Pass.).
wait instead of taking active measures, c. inf., Th. 3.12.
rest correspondingly, Polyaen. 1.14.
fill in return, v.l. in X. HG 2.4.12.
plait in rivalry with, ἄνθεα τοῖς Μελεαγρείοις στεφάνοις AP 4.2 ( Phil.).

fill up, τὴν θέσιν τοῦ ὀνόματος A.D. Synt. 14.1; τὰ ὑστερήματα τῶν θλίψεων τοῦ Χριστοῦ Ep.Col. 1.24; ἀ. πρὸς τὸν εὐπορώτατον ἀεὶ τοὺς ἀπορωτάτους put in the poorest so as to balance the richest, D. 14.17.

compensate, IG 14.956 A19.
return, of the foreskin, Paul.Aeg. 6.60.
bring back in turn, ἀ. τὴν πίστιν Plu. Aud.poet. 2.20c.

children.definition: make compensation, τῇ λοιπῇ δόξῃ πρὸς τὴν δυσφημίαν Them. Or. 7.99c.

instead of a man, as a substitute, ἀντί τινος Luc. DMort. 11[16].2, etc.
rise so as to balance, τινί Th. 2.75.
contrary wind, Simp. in de An. 60.32.
hold up in turn or in reply, πυρσούς Polyaen. 6.19.2, cf. 1.40.3, Men.Prot. p. 72 D.
make equal adjust, compensate, Lib. Or. 59.161 (dub.):— Pass., Them. in Ph. 137.21.
set up against or in rivalry, λόγον Plu. Aud. 2.40e; τρόπαιον D.C. 42.48; τί τινι Plu. Glor.Ath. 2.348d.

an equivalent, J. AJ 18.9.7.
balancing, equalizing, Boethus ap. Porph. ap. Eus. PE 11.28, David Proll. 214.11, Simp. in Cael. 458.2.
open against, ἀ. ὄμματα κεραυνοῖς face them, Longin. 34.4.

definition: ἀντάξιος, α, ον, also ος, ον Theoc. 17.114:—

children.definition: worth just as much as, c. gen., ψυχῆς ἀ. worth life itself, Il. 9.401; πολλῶν ἀ. ἄλλων 11.514; ἕκαστος δέκα ἀνδρῶν ἀ. worth as much as ten, Hdt. 7.103, cf. 2.148, Pl. Lg. 730d, X. Mem. 2.10.3 etc.; worthy of, τέχνας Theoc. l.c.
worth as much, worth no less, Il. 1.136.
demand as an equivalent or in turn, Th. 6.16: c. dupl. acc., ἀνταξιῶσαι δωρεὰν αὐτόν Macho ap. Ath. 13.570a.
demand in return, Th. 3.58, 5.17, Plu. Sol. 3:— Pass., to be called on for a thing in turn, λόγον Id. Cat.Mi. 53.
obey in turn, ῥήτραις Tyrt. 4.6.
deceive in turn, τινά J. AJ 5.8.11.

give back, repay, tender in repayment or requital, Batr. 186; ἀ. τὸ ὅμοιον, τὸἴσον, Hdt. 1.18, Th. 1.43; χάριν Pherecr. 2D.; τὴν ἴσην Arist. Rh. 1379b7; ἀ. τροφεῖα Lys. 6.49; ἀρετήν Th. 4.19; ὕβριν Plu. Praec. 2.825c; τὰ αὐτὰ ἀ. react in the same way, Pl. Ti. 79e; of counter-arguments, Id. Prm. 128d: abs., pay back, Th. 3.40, Arist. Rh. 1367a21.
take vengeance, LXX De. 32.35, al., Ep.Rom. 12.19.

answer to, correspond with, εἰ μὴ ἀνταποδιδοίη τὰ ἕτερα τοῖς ἑτέροις Pl. Phd. 72a, cf. b; οὐκ ἀνταποδίδωσι τὸ ὅμοιον there is no similar correspondent, Arist. Mete. 347b32, cf. IA 707b16, Ps.-Alex.Aphr. in SE 192.14.
