giving back in turn, opp. ἀποδοχή, Th. 4.81; rendering, requiting, repayment, Arist. EN 1133a3, 1163a11, al.; χάριτος Men. Mon. 330, D.S. 20.100; τῶν εὐεργεσιῶν Phld. Piet. 14; retribution, LXX Is. 61.2, 63.4, al.; reprisals, γίγνεται ἀ. ἔκ τινος Plb. 5.30.6; reward, LXX Ps. 18 ( 19). 11, Ep.Col. 3.24.

children.definition: ἀ. ἕξιν τινί one must make it correspond to . ., Pl. Phlb. 40d.

correspondence (cf. foreg. II), Nicom. Ar. 1.8.8, Iamb. in Nic. p.36P.

receive or accept in return, ἑστίασιν Pl. Ti. 27b; χάριν D. 20.46.
destroy in return, E. Ion 1328, Pl. Cri. 51a.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass. and Med., with pf. 2 Act., perish in turn, αὐτὸς ἀνταπωλόμην E. Hel. 106, cf. IT 715; ὑπὲρ ἀνδρὸς ἑκάστου δέκα ἀνταπόλλυσθαι Hdt. 3.14.
speak for the defence or in reply, Is. 5.17, D.C. 50.2.
lose what one has won at play, ἀστραγάλους Menecr. 1D.
rebounding, revulsion, Cass. Pr. 26.
fart back at, [add. HD] πρὸς τὰς βροντάς Ar. Nu. 293.
raise questions in turn, S.E. M. 1.231.

send in exchange, ὁμήρους Plb. 21.43.22; send backwards and forwards, πρέσβεις D.C. 50.2, cf. Aen.Tact. 31.9 ( Pass.); refer one back again, ἐπί τι S.E. M. 8.86; of an echo, τὰς ἀνακλάσεις ἀ. Plu. Mul.virt. 2.248c.
turn back again, Tz. H. 5.903.
turning away from one another, of places which face opposite ways, Str. 6.1.5.
cut off in turn by trenches, App. BC 2.61.
wall off, fortify on the other side, D.C. 43.7.
requite, repay, AP 9.223 ( Bianor), Orph. Fr. 32d, e.
show on the other hand, Th. 3.38, 67.
catch in turn, of a ball, Poll. 9.107.
counter-receipt, POxy. 1542.1 (iv A. D.), BGU 974.10 (iv A. D.).
repel in turn, Arist. Pr. 936b35:— Pass., Id. Somn.Vig. 457b23.
mutual repulsion, Placit. 2.23.2.
Euph. 147.
the star α Scorpii, Heph.Astr. 1.3, Ptol. Calend. p.214W., Id. Alm. 8.1.
count against one another, Paus. 10.20.1.

definition: ἀνταριθμητέον, ἑκάστῳ σταγόνι τοὺς ἴσους [ὀδόντας] Poll. 2.93.

children.definition: hold out against, τοῖς παροῦσιν Th. 7.15; πρός τι Plu. Cleom. 30.

children.label: II
children.definition: hold out, persist, Ar. Eq. 540, Isoc. 6.79, 19.26: c. part., τρέφουσα . . ἀντήρκεσεν D.C. 68.25.
antarctic, πόλος Arist. Mu. 392a4; κύκλος Gem. 5.16; without κύκλος, ib. 39; ζώνη Placit. 3.14.1.
insurrection, Lyd. Ost. 33, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.171.

definition: ἄνταρσις, εως, ἡ, = foreg., Sm. 4 Ki. 11.14.

children.definition: pro-magistrate, Gloss.
vice-president, τοῦ ἀγῶνος IG 2(2).1077, cf. ib. 12 (2).35e (Mytil.); pro-magistrate, SIG 785.17 ( Chios), POxy. 907.21 (iii A. D.); ἀ. τῶν στρατηγῶν AJA 18.329 ( Sardes, i B.C.).
welcome, greet in turn, X. Cyr. 1.3.3; return greeting, Hierocl. Facet. 7; receive kindly, X. Cyr. 5.5.42, Pl.Com. 12D., Plu. Tim. 38.
lighten against, ἀστραπαῖς D.C. 59.28.
surety, GDI 5015.23 ( Gortyn).
requite with dishonour, prob. cj. in S. Aj. 1339.

children.label: II
children.definition: expose to the light, illuminate, ἡλίῳ βίον ἀ. Ph. 2.260.

reflection of light, Gloss.:—also ἀνταύγ-εια or ἀνταυγ-ία, ἡ, Placit. 2.20.12, X. Cyn. 5.18, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.921b, Ps.- Hp. Hebd. 1.52; ἡλίου Onos. 29.2; τῆς χιόνος from the snow, D.S. 17.82; shining in oneʼs face, ἡλίου Ascl. Tact. 12.10.
reflect light, Hp. Carn. 17, Arist. Pr. 932a27, Chaerem. 14; πρὸς Ὄλυμπον Emp. 44; φάσγανον ἀνταυγεῖ φόνον flashes back murder, E. Or. 1519; gleam, glitter, Eub. 56.
reflecting light, sparkling, κάλλος Sannyr. 1D.; κόραι Ar. Th. 902; χιών D.S. 17.82: pr. n. Ἀνταύγης, of the sun, Orph. Fr. 237.
address face to face, τινά S. El. 1478.
play on the flute against, τινί Agath. 4.23.
sound in turn, answer, οἱ ἀντάϋσε [ῡ] βροντᾶς φθέγμα Pi. P. 4.197, cf. Opp. C. 2.78.
take away in return, in Med., Antipho 4.1.7:— Act., intr., diminish in turn, Aristid. Or. 23(42).50, cf. 2.309J.

children.label: II
children.definition: subtract from the opposite side, and ἀνταφαίρ-εσις, εως, ἡ, subtraction from the opposite side, Nicom. Ar. 1.13.
feast in return, Pl. Ti. 17b.
let go in turn, δάκρυ ἀ. let the tear fall in turn, E. IA 478.

children.label: II
children.definition: send back, σφαῖραν Poll. 9.107.

children.label: I
children.definition: come opposite to, meet face to face, meet with, ἥ οἱ ἔπειτʼ ἤντησʼ ib. 6.399; ἤντεον ἀλλήλοισιν 7.423; so also in Trag., ἀνέμοις ἀ. A. Supp. 36; πατρί S. Tr. 902, etc.
meet in battle, εἴ κεν πάντων ἀντήσομεν Od. 16.254, cf. Il. 16.423: also without any hostile sense, σπέρμα μὲν ἄντασʼ Ἐρεχθειδᾶν by lineage she reached, went up to the Erechtheidae, S. Ant. 982.

meet with, take part in, partake in or of, μάχης, δαίτης, Il. 7.158, Od. 3.44; κατάλεξον ὅπως ἤντησας ὀπωπῆς how thou hast gained sight of him, ib. 17.44, cf. 3.97; so ἀ. ξεινίων Hdt. 2.119; ἁλώσιος Pi. O. 10(11).42; ἀ. τινὸς ὑπό τινος meet with such and such treatment from another, Hdt. 1.114; σφῷν . . θεοῖς ἀρῶμαι μή ποτʼ ἀντῆσαι κακῶν S. OC 1445.

data.quote: σφῷν . . θεοῖς ἀρῶμαι μή ποτʼ ἀντῆσαι κακῶν

children.label: III
children.definition: ἤν νιν πομπαῖς ἀντήσῃς E. IA 150 (s.v.l.).— The simple Verb never in Com. or Att. Prose; but cf. ἀπαντάω.
insert one name instead of another, Arist. Ath. 36.2, D. 25.73 ( Pass.).
raise or build instead, D.C. 69.12; build in opposition, τί τινι App. Pun. 114.
make a counter-claim, D. 40.14.
bring a countercharge, τινί Isoc. 17.12, D.H. 8.64, Plu. Ant. 55, etc.; ἀλλήλοις δώρων Hermog. Stat. 3.
to be urgent on the other side, Eun. VS p.470B.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be inserted in place of another letter (as θ for ε), Eust. 1863.56.
counter-claim or -charge, Hermog. Stat. 2, cf. 11: pl., Corn. Rh. p.387H.
of or for a counter-accusation, ἀντίθεσις Hermog. Stat. 6, 12; τὸ -κόν Antipho 4.2 Arg.; τὰ -κά Aps.p.235H. Adv. -κῶς Sch. A.R. 1.834.
entrust to another instead, τινὶ δίκας D.C. 60.24.
pour in instead, Gal. 18(1).282.

definition: ἀντεικάζω, fut. -άσομαι Pl. Men. 80c: aor. -ῄκασα Ar. V. 1311, subj. -εικάσω Pl. l.c.:—

children.definition: compare in return, τινά τινι Ar. l.c.: c. acc., Pl. l.c.:—hence ἀντεικ-ασία, ἡ, Sch. Ven. Il. 8.560.
unwind in opposite direction, Orib. 49.22.18 ( Pass.).

definition: ἀντεῖν ὁ ἐναντίος τῇ ἀγωγῇ, Hsch.
ἀντεῖπον, aor. 2 without any pres. (cf. ἀντερῶ, ἀντιλέγω, ἀνταγορεύω),

children.definition: speak against or in answer, gainsay, c. dat., S. OC 999, etc.; ἀ. τινὶ δεομένῳ Th. 1.136: abs., οὐδὲν ἀντειπεῖν ἔχω A. Pr. 51; ἀ. πρός τινα or τι, Th. 3.61, X. HG 3.3.3; oppose, Pl. Thg. 131a; ἀ. ὑπέρ τινος speak in oneʼs defence, Ar. Th. 545: c. acc. cogn., ἀ. ἔπος utter a word of contradiction, E. IA 1391; δύο λόγω περὶ τῶν αὐτῶν ἀντειπεῖν speak on both sides of a question, Isoc. 10.1; τούτῳ ἂν δίκαιον λόγον ἀντείποιμι Pl. Ap. 28b.
κακῶς ἀ. τινά malign him in turn, S. Ant. 1053.
ask in turn, Hdt. 1.129, 3.23, X. Cyr. 2.2.22: in part., Plu. QConv. 2.739b.
introduce, import instead, D. 9.39 ( Pass.), Pl. Ax. 369e, Men. 402.16, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: bring into office, etc., in turn, ἀλλήλους εἰς ἐπαρχίας κτλ. Plu. Caes. 14.

children.label: III
children.definition: restore, Gal. 6.75, al.
compensatory antithesis (as οἰκτρόν . . σεμνὸν δέ), Alex. Fig. 1.25, Zonae. Fig. 20.
one must restore, Gal. 1.393.
make an inroad in reprisal, D.C. 48.21.
enter instead, εἰς τοὺς πόρους Eust. 1111.45.
enter in turn or in return, Simp. in Ph. 573.4.
one must introduce instead, Hermog. Stat. 3.
enter in turn or instead, Aristid. Or. 37(2).27, Hero Spir. 2.36, Them. in Ph. 113.26.
to be introduced in place of, Hero Spir. 1.3.
bring in, introduce in turn, Sch.D.T. p.72H.
contribute in return, τὰς εἰσφοράς Ar. Lys. 654: metaph., οὐδὲ τυχόντα ἔρανον ἀλλήλαις Gal. UP 8.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: νόμον ἀ. substitute a new law for an old one, D. 20.97; καινὰ δαιμόνια D.C. 52.36.

children.label: III
children.definition: introduce as a counter measure, Onos. 42.12.
contribution in return, Milet. 3 No.147.22 (iii B.C.).
to be produced in an opposite direction, Theol.Ar. 26; ἀλλήλοις to be correspondingly projected, Anon. in EN 224.24.
deputy defensor, POxy. 1987 ( vi A.D., cf. PLond. 5.1709.80 (vi A.D.).
rush out on the other side from, Arr. An. 1.21.3.
squeeze out in turn, Hp. Loc.Hom. 9.
kindle in turn, metaph. of passion, J. AJ 15.7.3 (Pass.).
steal away in return, Ar. Ach. 527.
carry out or away in return, in fut. ἀντεκκομιεῖ, Hsch.
knock out in return, ὀφθαλμόν D 24.140; εἴ τις τὸν ὀφθαλμὸν ἐξέκοψέ τινος, ἀντεκκοπῆναι Arist. MM 1194a38, cf. D.S. 12.17.

data.quote: εἴ τις τὸν ὀφθαλμὸν ἐξέκοψέ τινος, ἀντεκκοπῆναι

children.definition: excrete in turn, Gal. 4.517 ( Pass.).
send out in turn, X. HG 4.8.25; expel, discharge in turn, of respiration, Gal. 5.710.
sail out against, τινί Th. 4.13: abs., Plu. Lys. 10.
frighten in return, Ael. NA 12.15, Aristid. 1.130J.
breathe out in turn, Gal. Nat. Fac. 3.13, al.
flow out in turn, Gal. Nat. Fac. 1.13, UP 6.11.
draw up troops in opposition, App. BC 4.108.
stretch out in rivalry, ἀ. αὑτόν τινι match oneself with another, Ar. Ra. 1042; τῇ ἐκείνου δεινότητι τὸν ἐκείνου πλοῦτον Philostr. VS 1.21.4.

data.quote: τῇ ἐκείνου δεινότητι τὸν ἐκείνου πλοῦτον

children.label: II
children.definition: contrast with, S.E. M. 1.251.
repay, Ph. 2.78, al.
retribution, Ph. 1.159; requital, Sch. Pi. P. 1.112.
punished in turn, Sch. Il. 24.213.
to maintain in return:— in Pass., ἀντεκτρέφεσθαι ὑπὸ τῶν ἐκγόνων Arist. HA 615b25.
train as a rival, βότρυν βότρυϊ Lync. ap. Ath. 14.654a.
sally out against, X. HG 4.3.17, Ages. 2.10.
bring out against, oppose, τί τινι Plu. Adul. 2.72e.
grow out, issue opposite, Gal. 5.537.
to be worsted in turn, D.C. 44.27.
sail against, τριήρει with a trireme, Plu. Nic. 24.
deduct, POxy. 1578.11 (iii A.D.).
compensation, Gloss.
= foreg.: metaph., ἐν ἀντελλόγῳ σταθμᾶσθαι Eust. 997.54.

substitute, κίκεως PHolm. 10.11.

to be plunged in in revenge, τισί Ar. Ach. 230.

to be inserted opposite, Gal. 4.384.

give contrary indications, of symptoms, Gal. 10.626.
counter-indication, Steph. in Hp. 2.282D.
give way in turn, of sawyers, ὁ μὲν ἕλκει, ὁ δʼ ἀντενέδωκε Ar. V. 694 (Dobree, for ἀντανέδωκε).

counter-ambuscade, Plb. 1.57.3.
lay a counter-ambuscade, Hp. Ep. 17, D.C. 41.51.
to be efficacious against, θανασίμοις Dsc. 1.115.
counter-pledge, Sch. A.R. 1.1355:—hence ἀντεν-εχῠράζομαι, take a counter-pledge, Hsch. s.v. ῥυσιάζει.
insertion instead, Eust. 1079.12.
insert instead, prob. rest. in IGRom. 4.293 i37 ( Pergam., ii B. C., Pass.).

insert in turn or instead, Nicom. Ar. 2.27.
export in return, X. Vect. 3.2.
evict in return, BGU 1273.34 ( iii B. C.; written ἀντιεξ-).

raise to an equal height, λόγοις ἔργα Philostr. VS 1.19.1.

rise up against, πρός τι Hld. 7.19.

southerly elevation ( i.e. latitude), corresponding to a northerly one, Theol.Ar. 25.
go out against, X. HG 4.5.10, Plb. 1.24.10.

Aps. p.247 H., etc.:— Pass., to be measured or compared, παρά or πρός τι, Plu. Tim. 36, Adul. 2.65b; τινί Ph. 2.45, al., D.Chr. 31.126:— Med., measure oneʼs strength against another, τινί Luc. DMort. 25[12].2: esp. dispute with him at law, like ἀντιδικέω, ib. 23[29].1: metaph., ἀ. τῇ νόσῳ Id. Abd. 16.
comparison, A.D. Synt. 161.10, Aps. p.248H., al.
term of comparison, of an integer compared with the sum of the preceding integers, Theol.Ar. 10.
one must compare, Max.Tyr. 30.6.
comparative, Aphth. Prog. 10. Adv. -κῶς Men. Rh. p.403S.
counter-explanation, αἱ πρὸς Ἰόβαν ἀ., title of work by Didymus, Ath. 14.634c.
deputy-ἐξηγητής BGU 362 xv 10 (iii A. D.), PMeyer 6.9 (ii A. D.), PRyl. 397.1 (iii A. D.).
ride out against, Plu. Pomp. 7.
make equal, compare, Sch. Od. 11.308.
yield to an attack, retire from the contest, Plu. Frig. 2.946d.
military movement, τὰς διʼ ἀλλήλων ἀ. καὶ εἰσόδους Onos. 10.2.

children.definition: sail or march out against, D.C. 48.47, 63.24.
sailing against, v.l. in Th. 2.91; countercharge, Plu. Pomp. 69.

entrance in return, ἀ. παρέχειν Placit. 4.22.1.

sail or march out against, Th. 8.104, Luc. Bacch. 3: c. acc., στρατιάν, δύναμιν, J. AJ 6.9.1, 8.14.4:—also in Med., D.C. 50.31.
march out to meet an enemy, πρός τινα Th. 7.37: abs., X. Cyr. 3.3.30, etc.
Th. 4.131, Aristid. 1.149J.
sally in turn, D.C. 47.37.
obnitor, Gloss.
march against in return, Aristid. 1.150J., cf. D.C. 36.51.
restipulor, Gloss.

mutual attack, contention, Ph. 1.7, al.

accuse in return, ἀ. ὅτι . . App. BC 5.59.
to be placed upon, Gal. 12.604.

lay hold on the other side, Luc. Symp. 43.

turn against, retort, Plu. Praec. 2.810e; turn round and back, of a needle, Gal. 10.418.
turning back upon, χειρὸς ἐπὶ τὸν ὦμον Placit. 4.14.3; κατʼ ἀ. Ruf. ap. Orib. 49.35.4.
order in turn, τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Th. 1.135; τινί τι Pl. Ti. 20b.
excite by contrast, τὴν φαντασίαν Plu. Fac.lun. 2.933c.
raise a counter-work: metaph., Λυκείῳ τὴν Ἰταλίαν ἀ. Him. Or. 7.13: so as Dep. with pf. Pass., establish a fort in the enemyʼs country, Th. 1.142.
put on in exchange, D.C. 58.7 ( Pass.).
ἀ. ἐπιστολὴν πρός τινα give a letter in answer, Th. 1.129, Is. Fr. 49, cf. J. AJ 17.5.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., make a counter-attack, throw oneself upon, D.S. 36.4, Ph. 1.661; simply, attack, 2.111:— Act. in same sense, ἀλλήλοισιν make mutual plots, Hp. Ep. 17.
turn and attack, of animals at bay, Ph. 2.354.
sub-procurator, Ephes. 2 No.28, cf. CIL 3.141954, al.; ἀπὸ τῶν ἀ.: a ramulariis, Gloss.
lay, inflict in turn upon, κακὰ πόλεσι Ph. 1.407; ἀντεποισόμεθα· ἀντεπενέγκω . ., Hsch. ( -επονης-cod.).
Pass., rush upon in turn, Ti.Locr. 102a.
make a counter-attack, Str. 5.2.2, cf. (Max.Tyr. 18.9; τινί Plu. Them. 31.

children.label: II
children.definition: make attempts to prove the contrary, Arist. Top. 160b10; τὰ ἀντεπιχειρούμενα controversial efforts to prove or disprove, S.E. M. 9.191.
a counter-attack, D.H. 9.14.

definition: ἀντεπόπτευσις, v.l. ἀντεμπότευσις, εως, ἡ, Lat. compensatio, reputatio, Gloss.

children.definition: to be a rival in love, τινί τινος Luc. Musc. Enc. 10.
contribute oneʼs share in turn:— Pass., to be repaid, ὄμμασιν ἀλλοτρίοις AP 9.12 ( Leon.).
rival in love, τινός Ar. Eq. 733; generally, rival, Pl. R. 521b, Arist. Rh. 1388a14:—fem. ἀντεράστρια, Gloss.
love in return, τῶν ἀντερώντων ἱμέρῳ πεπληγμένος A. Ag. 544; ἐρῶν ἀντερᾶται X. Smp. 8.3, cf. Bion Fr. 8.1; ἀντερᾶν τινός Luc. DMar. 1.5; ἀντερᾶσθαι ὑπό τινος Plu. Dio 16.

children.label: II
children.definition: rival in love, τινί Id. Sollert. 2.972d; ἀ. τινί τινος rival one in love for . ., E. Rh. 184: abs., τὸ ἀντερᾶν jealous love, Plu. Lyc. 18.
retaliate, τὰ αὐτά τινας ἀ. D.C. Fr. 36.21.
compete with, τι in a thing, Posidipp. 3.1.
provoke in turn, τινὰ πρὸς μάχην Eust. 848.17.

set firmly against, χειρὶ χεῖρʼ ἀντερείσαις clasping hand in hand, Pi. P. 4.37; but ἄκναμπτον Ἥρᾳ μένος ἀν[τ]ερείδων Id. Pae. 6.87; ἀντέρειδε τοῖς Ἐρεχθείδαις δόρυ E. Supp. 702; ἀ. ξύλα [τῷ πύργῳ] set wooden stays or props against it, X. HG 5.2.5; ἀ. βάσιν plant it firm, S. Ph. 1403; λίθοι οἱ -οντες τὰς περιφερεῖς στέγας springers of a vault, Demetr. Eloc. 13.

children.label: II
children.definition: stand firm, resist pressure, offer resistance, opp. ὑπείκω, X. Cyr. 8.8.16, cf. Cyn. 10.16, Pl. Ti. 45c, Arist. MA 698b18, Epicur. Fr. 76 bis; exert counter-pressure, θέναρι ἀ. Hp. Fract. 14; τὸ ὠθούμενον ἀ. ὅθεν ὠθεῖται offers resistance in the direction from which the pressure comes, Arist. Mech. 858a26; πρός or περί τι, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.924d, 923e.
exert mutual pressure, of contending politicians, Phld. Rh. 2.51 S. (dub.); simply, argue against, Sor. 2.57.

thrusting against, resistance, Hp. Art. 50; esp. the fulcrum or resistance used in reducing a dislocation, ib. 2; of joints, Arist. IA 705a14; λάμπειν ἀντερείσει τοῦ αἰθέρος by its resistance, Plu. Lys. 12; forward pressure, Ael. Tact. 18.8; repulsion, Plu. Pyth. 2.396a, cf. Ph. 1.153, Plot. 4.3.26 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: buttressing, mutual support, of clauses in a period, Demetr. Eloc. 12.
prop, Hsch. s.v. στῆλαι.
of or for resistance, ἕξις Metop. ap. Stob. 3.1.115, Hierocl. p.23A.; κίνησις Simp. in Ph. 1046.12.
row against, πρὸς αὐτὸν τὸν ἄνεμον D.C. 48.48.
strive against, contend, ταύροις Philostr. Her. 12b, cf. Hsch.
make equal in weight with, value equally with, c. gen., χρυσοῦ τε καὶ ἀργύρου ἀντερύσασθαι Thgn. 77:— Act., -ερύω pull in the opposite direction, Ep. impf. -ερύεσκε Nonn. D. 46.214.

definition: ἀντερῶ, fut. without any pres. in use: pf. ἀντείρηκα S. Ant. 47 (cf. ἀντεῖπον):—

children.definition: speak against, gainsay, S. l.c.; τεθνάναι δʼ οὐκέτʼ ἀ. θεοῖς A. Ag. 539; τι πρός τινα Ar. Nu. 1079; πρός τι Ach. 701; τινί Pl. R. 580a:— Pass., οὐδὲν ἀντειρήσεται no denial shall be given, S. Tr. 1184; τὰ -ημένα Gal. 5.477.
return-love, love-for-love, Pl. Phdr. 255d, Ach.Tat. 1.9, Them. Or. 24.305a.

children.label: II
children.definition: Anteros, personified as a god who avenged slighted love, Paus. 1.30.1, etc.:—but also (as it seems) a god who struggled against Ἔρως, Id. 6.23.5.

children.label: III
children.definition: gem, Plin. HN 37.123 (pl.).
question in turn, ἐρωτώμενος ἀντερωτᾷς; Pl. Euthd. 295b, cf. Aeschin. 3.226, Aen.Tact. 24.16, Plu. Cor. 18.

definition: ἀντεστραμμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἀντιστρέφω (q. v.).

children.definition: holding aloft, prob. in A.R. 2.119.

definition: ἀντεταιῶς ἀναγεγραμμένως, Hsch. (Perh. ἀντʼ ἔτεος ἀναγεγραμμένως ( Dor. acc. pl.), =

children.definition: enrolled in the same year.)

definition: ἀντετοῦς τοῦ αὐτοῦ ἔτους ( Lacon.), Hsch.

children.definition: rival in distinction, Lyd. Mens. 1.28 ( Pass.).
return a kindness, X. Mem. 2.6.4; ἀ. τοὺς εὖ ποιήσαντας Arist. Rh.Al. 1422a32.
kindness returned, Hsch. s.v. ἀνθυπούργησον.
one who returns kindnesses, Asp. in EN 113.14, Sch. A.R. 2.321.
disposed to return kindnesses, Arist. EN 1124b11.
south temperate zone, Cleom. 1.2, Stoic. 2.195.
wish well in return, τινί X. Cyr. 8.3.49 (divisim).

definition: ἀντευπάσχω, ἀντευποιέω. ἀντευπάσχω and ἀντευ-ποιέω are by recent edd. written divisim ἀντʼ εὖ π. (v. Pl. Grg. 520e, X. An. 5.5.21, D. 20.124), on the ground that εὖ never enters into direct composition with Verbs,

children.definition: ἀντευποιεῖν is read in Arist. EN 1179a28, Rh. 1374a24.
requital of benefits, Mich. in EN 465.27.
the opposite of joy, Agatho 30.
one must give thanks in turn, Porph. Abst. 2.37.
entertain in return, Ph. 2.139, Philostr. VS 2.5.3, Ael. NA 9.45, 15.7; as f.l. for ἀνταφεστιάω, Pl. Ti. 17b.
find out against, J. AJ 10.8.1.
exult over in turn, Ph. 2.313.
appoint against one, στρατηγούς τισι Aristid. 1.173J.
go forth to meet, Suid.
to be furnished instead of provisions: metaph. in J. AJ 15.9.1.
check, verify, SIG 1023.89 ( Cos).
rush against, attack, Hld. 8.16: abs., Ph. 2.122.
anchor over against the enemy, Plu. Alc. 36.
rushing against, attack, Ph. 2.31, Hld. l.c.

definition: ἀντέχω or ἀντίσχω, fut. ἀνθέξω; part. ἀντισχήσων (in sense II) Lib. Ep. 33.2: aor. ἀντέσχον:—

children.definition: hold against, c. acc. et gen., χεῖρʼ ἀ. κρατός hold oneʼs hand against oneʼs head so as to shade the eyes, S. OC 1651: c. dat., ὄμμασι δʼ ἀντίσχοις ( -έχοις codd.) τάνδʼ αἴγλαν mayʼst thou keep this sunlight upon his eyes, Id. Ph. 830 (lyr.); τοὺς χαλινοὺς τῶν ἵππων Hdn. 5.6.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: hold out against, withstand, Ἀρπάγῳ Hdt. 1.175, cf. 8.68.βʹ; τοῖς δικαίοις S. Fr. 78; τῇ ταλαιπωρίᾳ Th. 2.49; πρός τινα Id. 6.22; πρὸς τοὺς καμάτους Hdn. 3.6.10, etc.: c. acc., endure, ἀντέχομεν καμάτους AP 9.299 ( Phil.); but in Th. 8.63 ἀ. τὰ τοῦ πολέμου rather belongs to the next signf., hold out as regards the war; so πολλὰ ἀ. ib. 86.

hold out, endure, c. part., ἡ Ἄζωτος . . ἐπὶ πλεῖστον χρόνον πολιορκουμένη ἀντέσχε Hdt. 2.157, cf. 5.115, Th. 2.70; μηκέτι ἀντέχωσι τῷ πόνῳ διϊστάμενοι Pl. Ti. 81d; πολλάκις γιγνομένην ψυχὴν ἀντέχειν last through several states of existence, Id. Phd. 88a.

data.quote: ἡ Ἄζωτος . . ἐπὶ πλεῖστον χρόνον πολιορκουμένη ἀντέσχε

children.definition: hold out, stand oneʼs ground, Hdt. 8.16, A. Pers. 413, etc.; πῶς δύσμορος ἀντέχει; S. Ph. 176 (lyr.); νόσημα ἀντίσχει τὸν αἰῶνα πάντα Hp. Fract. 11; ἔστʼ ἂν αἰὼν ἀντέχῃ E. Alc. 337; βραχὺν χρόνον D. 2.10; ἀ. ἐπὶ πολύ, ἐπὶ πλέον, Th. 1.7, 65; ἀ. ἐλπίσιν in hope, D.S. 2.26; ἀ. περί τινος X. HG 2.2.16: peculiarly, ἀ. μὴ ὑπακοῦσαι I hold out against . ., refuse . ., Plu. QConv. 2.708a.

children.label: b
children.definition: hold out, suffice, Hdt. 7.196, cf. A. Pers. 413 (in full ἀ. ῥέεθρον Hdt. 7.58; ἀ. ὕδωρ παρέχων ib. 108); so ἀντέχει ὁ σῖτος Th. 1.65.
extend, reach, ἐς ὅσον ἡ ἐπιστήμη ἀ. Id. 6.69; prevail, διὰ τὴν λῃστείαν ἐπὶ πολὺ ἀντίσχουσαν I.7.

data.quote: διὰ τὴν λῃστείαν ἐπὶ πολὺ ἀντίσχουσαν

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., hold before one against something, c. acc. et gen., ἀντίσχεσθε τραπέζας ἰῶν hold out the tables against the arrows, Od. 22.74.

hold on by, cling to, ἐκείνου τῆς χειρός Hdt. 2.121.εʹ; πέπλων E. Tr. 750, cf. Ion 1404; τῶν θυρῶν Ar. Lys. 161: metaph., ἀ. τῶν ὄχθων cling to the banks, keep close to them, Hdt. 9.56; ἀ. Ἡρακλέος cleave to Hercules, i.e. worship him above all, Pi. N. 1.33; ἀ. τῆς ἀρετῆς, Lat. adhaerere virtuti, Hdt. 1.134; ἀ. τοῦ πολέμου Id. 7.53; τοῦ κέρδους S. Fr. 354; τῆς θαλάσσης Th. 1.13; σωτηρίας Lys. 33.6; τῆς ἀληθείας Pl. Phlb. 58e, cf. R. 600d, al.; τῶν παραδεδομένων μύθων Arist. Po. 1451b24; τῆς ἐλευθερίας Decr. ap. D. 18.185; τῶν δικαίων POxy. 1203.30 (i A. D.).

children.label: b
children.definition: care for, support, 1 Ep.Thess. 5.14.
αὐτὸς ἀντέχου S. Ph. 893, cf. Ar. Ach. 1121.
ἀνθέξεταί σου τῶν πατρῴων χρημάτων will lay claim to the property from you, dispute it with you, Ar. Av. 1658.
resist, Pl. R. 574b; φονεῦσαι τοὺς ἀντεχομένους D.S. 4.49.
adhere, Arist. HA 583a18: Medic., of constipation, γαστὴρ ἀντίσχετο Hp. Epid. 4.20; γαστρὸς ἀντεχομένης ib. 17.
prayer—a word preserved by Hsch. ( ἄντῃσι (cod. ἀντήσει) · λιτανείαις, ἀντήσεσι), and restored by Herm. for λιταῖς (metri gr.) in S. El. 139 (dub.).
in supplication, Hsch. ( -δης cod.).

definition: ἀντήεις, Dor. ἀντ-άεις, εσσα, εν, ( ἄντα)

children.definition: hostile, Pi. P. 9.93.
opposite the sun, i.e. looking east, S. Aj. 805, E. Ion 1550; δαίμονες ἀντήλιοι statues of gods which stood in the sun before the house-door, A. Ag. 519, cf. E. Fr. 538.
reflecting the sunʼs rays, AB 403 ( ἀνθ-), cf. Suid.: hence metaph., imitation, reflection, Theopomp.Hist. 367 ( ἀνθ-).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀντήλια, τά, = παρήλια, parhelia, Suid., cf. Men. 511.

screens or parasols, Eust. 1281.3; also, blinkers on horses’ bridles, Poll. 10.54 ( ἀνθ-), Eust. 1562.39.—The Ion. form ἀντήλιος is always used in Trag.; ἀνθήλιος first in Theopomp. l.c., cf. Ph. 1.656, Placit. 3.6.
corresponding, Call. Del. 52.

against, over against, οὔ μιν ἔγωγε φεύξομαι . . ἀλλὰ μάλʼ ἄ. στήσομαι I will confront him, Il. 18.307, cf. 11.590; ὁμοιωθήμεναι ἄ. match himself openly against me, 1.187, Od. 3.120; so πειρηθήμεναι ἄ. 8.213; more rarely with Verbs of motion, μηδʼ ἔα ἄ. ἔρχεσθαι straightforwards, opp. πάλιν τρέπε, Il. 8.399; also ἄ. βαλλομένων in front, 12.152; οὐδέ τις ἔτλη ἄ. εἰσιδέειν look him in the face, 19.15, cf. 24.223; ἄ. λοέσσομαι will bathe before all, openly, Od. 6.221, cf. 8.158; ἀγαπαζέμεν ἄ. greet in the face of all, Il. 24.464; νείκεσέτʼ ἄ. 10.158; ὅς μʼ εἴρεαι ἄ. 15.247:- -θεῷ ἐναλίγκιος ἄ. like a god in presence, Od. 2.5, 4.310; χελιδόνι εἰκέλη ἄ. 22.240; cf. ἄντα.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ep., as Nic. Th. 474, Opp. C. 3.210.
instead of a man, σποδὸς ἀ. dust for men, A. Ag. 442.—In Il.as pr.n.
row against or on the opposite side to another, EM 112.40.
one who rows against another, cf. AB 411: generally, opponent, adversary, A. Th. 284, 595; ἀ. δορός τινι ib. 997 (lyr.).

definition: ἀντήρης, Dor. ἀντ-άρης, ες, poet. Adj.

children.definition: set over against, opposite, λαβεῖν τινὰ ἀντήρη meet face to face in battle, E. Ph. 754, cf. 1367; ἀντήρεις στέρνων πληγάς blows on the breast, S. El. 89: c. gen., Φοινίκας ἀ. χώρα over against, facing it, E. Tr. 221 (lyr.): c. dat., ἀ. τινί opposite to a thing, Id. IA 224; ἀ. ὄψεσι, of the bat, hostile to, S. Fr. 747 (lyr.).
Dim. of ἀντηρίς, stanchion supporting the base of a torsion-engine, Hero Bel. 89.4.
support, base, Milet. 7p.60 (ii B.C.), Haussoullier Cinquantenaire de l’école des hautes études p. 89 (ii B.C.).

definition: ἀντήριος στήμων, καὶ κανὼν ὁ προσκείμενος τῇ θύρᾳ, Hsch.

children.definition: prop, stay, support, E. Fr. 1111: pl., Plb. 8.4.6; stanchion or strut in torsion-engines, Ph. Bel. 76.16, Hero Bel. 101.9; ἀρκύων X. Cyn. 10.7; in Th. 7.36 ἀντηρίδες are stay-beams fixed inside a shipʼs bow, and projecting beyond it, so as to support and strengthen the ἐπωτίδες.

children.label: II
children.definition: θυρίς, window, Suid.:—and in E. Rh. 785 it must mean nostrils, if it be the right reading. [ ῐδος E. ll.cc.: hence ἀντήρειδες in Apollod. Poliorc. 178.4, Hero Bel. 101.9, is wrong; so -είδιον ib. 89.4 is f.l. for -ίδιον as Inscrr. show.] ( -ηρῐδ = -ερῐδ-, weak form of stem of ἐρείδω (cf. ἔρις).)
entreaty, prayer, Hsch.
confronting, κατʼ ἄντηστιν θεμένη Od. 20.387.
sing in answer, παιᾶνα θεῷ E. Alc. 423; ἀντάχησʼ ἂν ὕμνον ἀρσένων γέννᾳ would have sung a song in answer to . ., Id. Med. 426.

children.label: II
children.definition: sound responsively, of a musical string, Arist. Pr. 919b16; of bronze vessels, Aen.Tact. 37.7, Plb. 22.11.12; resound, Hp. Morb. 4.56, cf. Carn. 18, Luc. VH 1.38; echo, φωναῖς ἀ. Plu. Def.orac. 2.414c.

children.label: III
children.definition: shout in opposition, Id. Mar. 19, cf. J. BJ 2.19.8, Them. Or. 21.255d
contradict, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.925e, cf. QPlat. 1000c.
echo, Sch. Philostr. Her. 19.12.
a re-echoing, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.589d.
sounding in response, ἁρμονία Ph. 1.312, 2.485.

definition: ἀντί, Prep. governing gen.:—orig. sense, over against. (Cf. Skt. ánti ‘opposite’, ‘facing’, Lat. ante, etc.)

children.label: I
children.definition: opposite, over against, formerly quoted from several places of Hom., as Il. 21.481 ἀντίʼ ἐμεῖο (where now ἀντίʼ ἐμεῖο, i.e. ἀντία) Τρώων ἄνθʼ ἑκατόν (i.e. ἄντα) 8.233; so ἄντʼ Αἴαντος (i.e. ἄντα) 15.415, cf. Od. 4.115, Hes. Op. 727; but ἀντί is so used in X. An. 4.7.6, IG 2.835 c-l 68; αἱ ὀπαὶ αἱ γιγνόμεναι ἀ. τόρμων mortises facing tenons, Hero Bel. 97.5; ἀντὶ μαιτύρων in the presence of witnesses, Leg.Gort. 1.40; ἀντὶ τῆς ὄψεως ἡμῶν Eudox. Ars 18.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀντὶ νυκτός the same night, SIG 1025.43 ( Cos); ἀντὶ ϝέτεος GDI 2561 A 45 (Delph.); ἀντʼ ἐνιαυτοῦ IG 5(2).266.8 ( Mantinea, i B.C.); ἀνθʼ ἡμέρας· διʼ ὅλης τῆς ἡμέρας, Hsch.; cf. ἀντετοῦς.

children.label: III
children.definition: instead, in the place of, Ἕκτορος ἀντὶ πεφάσθαι Il. 24.254; ἀντὶ γάμοιο τάφον Od. 20.307; so later πολέμιος ἀντὶ φίλου καταστῆναι Hdt. 1.87; ἀντὶ ἡμέρης νὺξ ἐγένετο Id. 7.37; ἀντὶ φωτῶν σποδός A. Ag. 434; τὸν πόλεμον ἀντʼ εἰρήνης μεταλαμβάνειν Th. 1.120, cf. 4.20, 7.75; βασιλεύειν ἀντί τινος X. An. 1.1.4; also ἀντὶ ἄρχεσθαι ὑπʼ ἄλλων ἄρχειν ἁπάντων Hdt. 1.210, cf. 6.32, 7.170 (where the usual constr. would be ἀντὶ τοῦ ἄρχεσθαι, cf. Th. 7.28, X. Cyr. 6.2.19, etc.); ὀργίλοι ἀντὶ θυμοειδοῦς γεγένηνται Pl. R. 411c: sts. used elliptically, ἦ ʼτολμήσατʼ ἀντʼ ἐμοῦ δοῦναί τινι; i.e. ἀντὶ τοῦ ἐμοὶ δοῦναι, S. Ph. 369, cf. OC 448, Ar. Av. 58.

data.quote: ἀντὶ ἄρχεσθαι ὑπʼ ἄλλων ἄρχειν ἁπάντων

children.definition: Hom. often to denote equivalence, ἀντί νυ πολλῶν λαῶν ἐστιν ἀνήρ he is as good as many men, Il. 9.116; ἀντὶ κασιγνήτου ξεῖνος . . τέτυκται a guest is as much as a brother, Od. 8.546; ἀντί τοί εἰμʼ ἱκέταο I am as a suppliant, Il. 21.75, cf. 8.163; so later τοῦτό σφι ἀντὶ λουτροῦ ἐστί serves as a bath, Hdt. 4.75; ὑπάρχειν ἀντὶ τῶν ἔνδον to be as hostages for . ., Th. 2.5; δουλεύειν ἀντὶ ἀργυρωνήτων just like bought slaves, D. 17.3; ἀντὶ [πλεύμονος] βράγχια Arist. PA 669a4.

at the price of, in return for, σοὶ δὲ θεοὶ τῶνδʼ ἀντὶ χάριν . . δοῖεν Il. 23.650; νῆσον ἀντὶ χρημάτων παρέλαβον for money paid, Hdt. 3.59; ἀντʼ ἀργυρίου ἀλλάξασθαι Pl. R. 371d; ἀμείβειν τι ἀντί τινος Pi. P. 4.17, cf. E. Or. 646, 651; ἀντὶ ποίας εὐεργεσίας; Lys. 6.40, etc.; τί δʼ ἐστὶν ἀνθʼ οὗ . .; S. Ant. 237; ὄνειδος ἀνθʼ ὅτου Id. OC 967; δοίην ἀντʼ ἀνιῶν ἀνίας grief for grief, Thgn. 344; ἀντʼ ἀγαθῶν ἀγαθοῖσι βρύοις A. Supp. 966:—hence ἀνθʼ ὧν wherefore, A. Pr. 31, S. OT 264, Th. 6.83, Ev.Luc. 12.3; ἀντὶ τούτου therefore, Ep.Eph. 5.31; but ἀνθʼ ὧν also for ἀντὶ τούτων ὄτι . ., because, S. Ant. 1068, Ar. Pl. 434; ἀντὶ τοῦ; wherefore? why? S. OT 1021; also ἀνθʼ ὧν ὅτι ἦτε . . instead of being as you were . ., LXX De. 28.62.

data.quote: σοὶ δὲ θεοὶ τῶνδʼ ἀντὶ χάριν . . δοῖεν

children.definition: for the sake of, Pl. Mx. 237a, Arist. EN 1110a21; with Verbs of entreaty, like πρός c. gen., ἀντὶ παίδων ἱκετεύομέν σε S. OC 1326.

ἓν ἀνθʼ ἑνός one set against the other, compared with it, Pl. R. 331b, Lg. 705b; χάριν ἀντὶ χάριτος, i.e. ever-increasing grace, Ev.Jo. 1.16; in preference to, ἀφνεὸν βούλεται ἀντʼ ἀγαθοῦ Thgn. 188; ἀντὶ αὐλοῦ καὶ ἀντὶ κιθάρας ὁ ἦχος ἀκούεται Demetr. Eloc. 71; αἱρεῖσθαί τι ἀντί τινος Isoc. 9.3, D. 1.1, cf. X. Lac. 9.1: even after Comparatives, πλέον ἀντὶ σοῦ S. Tr. 577; μείζονʼ ὅστις ἀντὶ τῆς αὑτοῦ πάτρας φίλον νομίζει Id. Ant. 182; so (esp. after a neg.) ἄλλος ἀντʼ ἐμοῦ A. Pr. 467, S. Aj. 444, Ar. Nu. 653; δόξαν ἀντὶ τοῦ ζῆν ἠγαπηκώς Plu. Alex. 42.

data.quote: ἀντὶ αὐλοῦ καὶ ἀντὶ κιθάρας ὁ ἦχος ἀκούεται
μείζονʼ ὅστις ἀντὶ τῆς αὑτοῦ πάτρας φίλον νομίζει

children.label: B
children.definition: ἀντί rarely follows its case, as in Il. 23.650, A. Ag. 1277, Ig 5(1).1119 ( Geronthrae, iv B.C.), AP 7.715 ( Leon.); but the Gramm. hold that it never suffers anastrophe.
over against, opposite, as ἀντιβαίνω, ἀντίπορος.
against, in opposition to, as ἀντιλέγω, ἀντίβιος.
one against another, mutually, as ἀντιδεξιόομαι.
in return, as ἀντιβοηθέω.
instead of, as ἀντιβασιλεύς, ἀνθύπατος.
equal to, like, as ἀντίθεος, ἀντίπαις, ἀντίδουλος.
corresponding, counter, as ἀντίφορτος, ἀντίτυπος.

definition: ἀντιάζω, impf. ἀντίαζον Hdt. 1.166 (but ὑπ-ηντίαζον 4.121), ἠντίαζον ( ὑπ-) X. An. 6.5.27, etc.: fut. ἀντιάσω [ᾰ]; Dor. -άξω (v. infr.): aor. ἠντίᾰσα Hdt. 4.80, 9.6; but these two tenses belong also to ἀντιάω : ( ἀντί):—

children.definition: meet face to face:

children.label: I
children.definition: encounter, whether as friend or foe, τὸν ἐπιόντα Id. 4.118, cf. 2.141, 4.80, etc.; ἀ. [τινὰ] ἐς τόπον Hdt. 1.166, cf. 9.6; πατέρʼ ἀντιάσασα πρὸς . . πόρθμευμα A. Ag. 1557: abs., κόρος . . βαρὺς ἀντιάσαι Pi. N. 10.20; μολπὰ πρὸς κάλαμον ἀντιάξει song shall answer to the pipe, Id. O. 10(11).84.

approach as suppliants, ἀ. τινὰ δώροισι Hdt. 1.105: hence simply, entreat, supplicate, Ἄρεα ἀντιάζω S. OT 192; καί σʼ ἀντιάζω πρὸς . . Διός Id. Aj. 492, cf. E. Andr. 572, etc.; freq. with acc. omitted, ἀλλʼ ἀντιάζω S. El. 1009, cf. Ph. 809, E. Alc. 400; βᾶθι καὶ ἀντίασον γονάτων entreat [her] by her knees, Id. Supp. 272.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀντάω, c. dat. pers. et acc. rei, ὅταν θεοὶ . . Γιγάντεσσιν μάχαν ἀντιάζωσιν in fight, Pi. N. 1.68.—This Verb is never used in correct Att. Prose.

definition: ἀντιάνειρα, ἡ, ( ἀντί, ἀνήρ), fem. form of a masc. in -άνωρ or -ήνωρ: in Il. always as epith. of the Amazons,

children.definition: a match for men, 3.189, 6.186, etc.; so of Athena, Coluth. 170.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pi. O. 12.16 στάσις ἀντιάνειρα faction wherein man is set against man.
tonsil, mostly in pl., Hp. Morb. 2.11 and 30: esp. when inflamed, Cels. 7.12, Gal. 7.263; cf. παρίσθμια.
Anti-Atticist, title of grammatical work, AB 77.
like an agate, dub. in Orph. L. 637 ( Abel).
cry or call against, Theoc. Ep. 4.11 codd. ( ἀνταχεῦσι Scal.), A.R. 2.828.
= foreg., Orph. A. 828; ἀμοιβήδην ἀντίαχεν A.R. 4.76.

definition: ἀντιάω, Hom. uses pres. only in the Ep. forms ἀντιόω, inf. ἀντιάαν, 3 pl. imper. ἀντιοώντων, part. ἀντιόων, όωσα, όωντες; but ἀντιόω, which is pres. in Il. 1.31, 23.643, serves as fut. in 13.752: fut. ἀντιάσω [ᾰ] Od. 22.28, Thgn. (v. infr.): aor. ἠντίᾰσα Hom. (these two tenses in form belong to ἀντιάζω; but such instances as belong in sense to ἀντιάω are given here):— Med., once in Hom. (v. infr.), A.R. 1.470, 2.24: ( ἀντί, ἀντίος):—

children.label: I
children.definition: Ep. Verb: go for the purpose of meeting or receiving:

go in quest of, when an aim or purpose is implied, πολέμοιο μενοίνα ἀντιάαν Il. 13.215; ὄφρα πόνοιο . . ἀντιάσητον 12.3; οὐκέτʼ ἀέθλων ἄλλων ἀντιάσεις Od. 22.28, al.: metaph. of an arrow, hit, ἀλλά κεν ἢ στέρνων ἢ νηδύος ἀντιάσειε Il. 13.290:— often of the gods, come (as it were) to meet an offering, and so, in past tenses, to have received, accepted it, ἀντιόων ταύρων τε καὶ ἀρνειῶν ἑκατόμβης Od. 1.25; ἀρνῶν κνίσης αἰγῶν τε τελείων . . ἀντιάσας Il. 1.67; generally, partake of, enjoy, αἲ γὰρ . . ὀνήσιος ἀντιάσειεν Od. 21.402; so ἔργων ἀντιάσεις χαλεπῶν Thgn. 1308; οὔτε του τάφου ἀντιάσας οὔτε γόων S. El. 869: abs., ἀντιάσαις having obtained [his wishes], Pi. I. 6(5).15:—once in Med., ἀντιάασθε, θεοί, γάμου Il. 24.62.

data.quote: ὄφρα πόνοιο . . ἀντιάσητον 12.3; οὐκέτʼ ἀέθλων ἄλλων ἀντιάσεις
ἀλλά κεν ἢ στέρνων ἢ νηδύος ἀντιάσειε
ἀντιόων ταύρων τε καὶ ἀρνειῶν ἑκατόμβης
ἀρνῶν κνίσης αἰγῶν τε τελείων . . ἀντιάσας
οὔτε του τάφου ἀντιάσας οὔτε γόων

children.definition: match or measure oneself with, ἡμεῖς δʼ εἰμὲν τοῖοι οἲ ἂν σέθεν ἀντιάσαιμεν ib. 7.231; δήων ἀντιάσειν Thgn. 552.

children.label: b
children.definition: come to aid, οὗ παιδὸς τεθνηότος ἀντιόωσα Od. 24.56.

children.label: II
children.definition: meet with, encounter, as by chance, μηδʼ ἀντιάσειας ἐκείνῳ ib. 18.147; δυστήνων δέ τε παῖδες ἐμῷ μένει ἀντιόωσιν Il. 6.127.

data.quote: δυστήνων δέ τε παῖδες ἐμῷ μένει ἀντιόωσιν

children.definition: encounter, ψύχεος Emp. 65.

children.label: III
children.definition: aor. part., ἀλλά τινʼ ὔμμʼ ὀΐω δόμεναι θεὸν ἀντιάσαντα having haply met you, Il. 10.551, cf. Od. 6.193, 13.312, 17.442.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἐμὸν λέχος ἀντιόωσα, euphem. for sharing it, only in Il. 1.31.

children.label: V
children.definition: approach as a suppliant, supplicate, like ἀντιάζω I.2, only in later Ep., c. gen. pers., A.R. 1.703: also c. acc. pers., Id. 3.694: c. acc. rei, ib. 717.

children.label: VI
children.definition: ἀντιόωσα σελήνη dub. in Orph. Fr. 168.16.
going against, opposite, ἀ. ὠθεῖν Plu. Isid. 2.381a.
go against, the contrary way, Phot. s.v. ῥαβάττειν.
obvagio, Gloss.

go against, withstand, resist, c. dat., Hdt. 5.40, A. Pr. 236, Decr. ap. D. 18.186, etc.; πλευραῖσιν ἀντιβᾶσα having set her foot against . ., E. Ba. 1126: abs., ἀντιβὰς ἐλᾶν row with foot planted against the stretcher, Ar. Ra. 202.
Hdt. 3.72, 8.3, E. IA 1016, etc.; βιασθεὶς πολλὰ κἀντιβάς reluctant, S. El. 575; εἰ . . μὴ περὶ σοῦ μάχομαι μόνος ἀντιβεβηκώς Ar. Eq. 767 ( ἀμφι- Dawes); ἀ. πρὸς τἀριστερὰ μόνον Pl. Lg. 634a.

data.quote: εἰ . . μὴ περὶ σοῦ μάχομαι μόνος ἀντιβεβηκώς

definition: ἀντιβάκχειος (sc. πούς), ὁ, the foot - - ⏑, Diom. 1.513 K., al.: —also ἀντί-βακχος, ὁ, Ter.Maur. 1411.

children.definition: throw against or in turn, Th. 7.25 (the acc. pers. being understood); βέλος Plb. 6.22.4: c. dat., ἀ. ἀκοντίοις Plu. Nic. 25; ἀ. τῷ κωρύκῳ practise by striking against the sack, in the gymnasium, Luc. Lex. 5; put back a protruding bone, Pall. in Hp.Fract. 12.285C.

children.label: II
children.definition: put one against the other, compare, collate, of Mss., Str. 13.1.54, 17.1.5, POxy. 1479 ( i B.C., Pass.); match, compare with, λέοντι τίς αἰετὸν ἀντιβάλοιτο; Opp. C. 1.68; λόγους ἀ. πρὸς ἀλλήλους exchange words in conversation, Ev.Luc. 24.17; πρὸς ἑαυτὸν ἀ. τὸ γεγονός weigh with oneself, LXX 2 Ma. 11.13.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., change, μορφήν dub.l. Opp. C. 3.16.
cassia, Hsch.
= Lat. interrex, D.H. 9.69.
reign as a rival king, τισί J. BJ 4.7.1.
resistance, Ph. Bel. 73.14, Plu. Caes. 38, etc.; πρός τι Id. Gen.Socr. 2.584f; ἡ κατʼ ἀντίβασιν ἁφή S.E. M. 10.2; opp. ἐπέρεισις, Sor. 2.10, cf. Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.23.11.
ground of opposition (?), διαφόρου τετευχότα -σεως Phld. Sign. 27.

children.label: II
children.definition: counter-prop, Vitr. 10.11.9.
support, prop, Eust. 1933.37.
bolt of a door, Sch. Ar. V. 202.
contrary, opposite, φορά Plu. Phoc. 2.

children.label: II
children.definition: firm, thorough, -κωτέρα ἡ κατὰ τὴν κίνησιν τοῦ οὐρανίου σώματος ἁφή Simp. in Cael. 440.19, cf. 9; resistent, Hierocl. p.23A., Alex.Aphr. Quaest. 62.4, Olymp. in Mete. 18.30; of the pulse, Gal. 8.949, cf. 644. Adv. -κῶς ib. 668: Comp., κλίνης -κώτερον ἐστρωμένης Sor. 2.61.

data.quote: -κωτέρα ἡ κατὰ τὴν κίνησιν τοῦ οὐρανίου σώματος ἁφή

children.definition: use force against, AP 12.183 ( Strat.): abs., Ph. 1.295, al.:— Pass., ῥώμη-βιασθέντες κραταιοτέρᾳ 2.423.
counter-account, PFlor. 388.48 (i A.D.); counter-summons, Just. Nov. 53.3.2 ( ἀντιβίβλῳ codd.).
eat in turn, Ath. 7.343c.
against, face to face, ἐριζέμεναι βασιλῆϊ ἀντιβίην Il. 1.278; Ἕκτορι πειρηθῆναι ἀ. 21.226, cf. 5.220, Orph. L. 26.

definition: ἀντίβιος, α, ον, also ος, ον : ( βία):—

children.definition: opposing force to force: as Adj. in Hom. only in the phrase ἀντιβίοις ἐπέεσσι with wrangling words, Il. 1.304, Od. 18.415, etc.; ἀ. ὅμιλος hostile, Tryph. 624.

children.label: b
children.definition: Subst., enemy, Jul. Caes. 319b (anap.), Nonn. D. 2.508, al., Opp. H. 5.114.
Adv., ἀντίβιον, = ἀντιβίην, ἀ. μαχέσασθαι Il. 3.20; Μενελάῳ ἀντίβιον . . πολεμίζειν ib. 435; εἰ μὲν ἀντίβιον . . πειρηθείης 11.386.
harm in return, Arist. EN 1138a8, Ph. 2.371.
retaliate with abuse, Sch. Aristid. p.673 D.
one must look in the face, μοι πρός τι Luc. Dem.Enc. 17.

look straight at, look in the face, c. dat. pers., τῷ ἐμῷ πατρὶ οὐδʼ ἀντιβλέπειν δύναμαι X. HG 5.4.27; τοῖς φίλοις Com.Adesp. 22.41 D.; εἰς or πρὸς τὸν ἥλιον, X. Mem. 4.7.7, Thphr. Sens. 18: metaph., πρὸς δωρεὰς βασιλέων Plu. Comp.Dem.Cic. 3: c. acc., ἀντιβλέπειν ἐκεῖνον οὐ δυνήσομαι Men. 586: abs., part., ἀντιβλέπουσαι . . αἱ αἶγες facing one another, Arist. HA 611a5.

data.quote: τῷ ἐμῷ πατρὶ οὐδʼ ἀντιβλέπειν δύναμαι

children.definition: looking in the face, look, X. Hier. 1.35, Plu. QConv. 2.681b.
stone inserted in vacant space in masonry, POxy. 498.16 (ii A.D.).
return a cry, of an echo, Bion 1.38; call aloud in answer, J. BJ 3.5.4: c. acc., ἰήϊον ἀντεβόησαν prob. in Euph. 80; ἴακχον θρήνοις Him. Ecl. 2.4.
help in turn, τινί Th. 6.18, 7.58, Pl. R. 559e, X. HG 7.4.2.
worth an ox or in place of an ox, of offerings, S. Fr. 405.
dictator, Gloss.

definition: ἀντιβολέω, impf. ἠντιβόλουν Ar. Eq. 667 codd., Lys. 1.25: fut. ἀντιβολήσω Od. (v. infr.), Lys. 14.16: aor. in Hom., ἀντεβόλησα; with double augm., ἠντεβόλησα Ar. Fr. 38:—

children.definition: meet, esp. in battle, c. dat. pers., Il. 16.847, al.: abs., 11.365, al.
to be present at, φόνῳ ἀνδρῶν ἀντεβόλησας Od. 11.416; τάφῳ ἀνδρῶν ἀ. 24.87; cf. ἀβολέω.

partake of, have oneʼs share of, μάχης καυστείρης ἀντιβολῆσαι Il. 4.342; οὐ γάρ τευ ἐπητύος ἀντιβολήσεις Od. 21.306; σὺ δέ κεν τάφου ἀντιβολήσαις 4.547; γάμου ἀ. Hes. Op. 784, cf. Pi. O. 13.30; even πυκινοῦ νόου ἀ. Timo 59.1.
fall to oneʼs lot, c. gen. pers., στυγερὸς γάμος ἀντιβολήσει . . ἐμέθεν Od. 18.272.

meet as a suppliant, entreat, supplicate, freq. in Com., Ar. Nu. 110, Pl. 444: c. acc. et inf., Id. Eq. 667, Ach. 147, D. 21.188: abs., περὶ τῶν ἀντιβολούντων those who supplicate, Ar. V. 559; freq. in parenthesis, εἴπʼ, ἀντιβολῶ, Id. Eq. 109, cf. Pl. 103 (freq. also ἀντιβολῶ σε Pl.Com. 43.5, 173.3; also in Lys. 1.25, 29, X. Ath. 1.18):— Pass., to be supplicated, ἀντιβοληθείς Ar. V. 560.

children.label: II
children.definition: cause to meet, τινά τινι IG 14.2431 (Fréjus).
confronting, comparing, collation, ἀντιγράφων Str. 17.1.5; opposition, ἐξ ἀντιβολῆς παραβάλλειν Hsch. s.v. παραβλήδην.

children.label: II
children.definition: discussion, A.D. Conj. 213.20.

children.label: III
children.definition: substitute, PHolm. 10.14.

definition: ἀντιβόλησις, εως, ἡ, = sq., Pl. Ap. 37a, Smp. 183a.

children.definition: an entreaty, prayer, Eup. 317, Th. 7.75.
return a humming sound, Ach.Tat. 3.2, cf. Eust. 1885.19.
sundial, Vitr. 9.8.1.
give contrary advice, Polyaen. 1.30.4.
delay in turn, Sch. Th. 3.10.
press down in the opposite scale, Ph. 2.170.
rival in thundering, τινί Luc. Tim. 2; βρονταῖς ἀ. D.C. 59.28.
marry in turn, Eust. 1796.53.
return a cry, AP 9.177.
give a different pedigree, Hdt. 2.143.
recasting of nativity in a later year, Vett.Val. 213.20, al.
generate in rivalry, Lync. ap. Ath. 7.285f; or in return, τοὺς γονεῖς Ph. 1.89.
land-agent, BGU 303.4 (vi A.D.), POxy. 943.8 (vi A.D.).
honour in turn, App. BC 2.140.
support in old age in turn, Lesb.Rh. 2.10.
substitute for blue dye, PLeid.X. 100.
to be of a different opinion, τινί D.C. 46.44; ἀ. μὴ οὐκ εἶναί τι think that a thing is otherwise, X. Cyr. 4.3.8.

definition: ἀντιγόνιος βόλος τις οὕτως ἐκαλεῖτο, Hsch.
Ἀντίγονος, ὁ, name of several Macedonian kings:—hence Ἀντιγόνειος, α, ον,

children.definition: of Antigonus, Polyaen. 4.9.1; Ἀντιγόνεια, τά, name of a festival in his honour, Plb. 28.19.3, IG 11.154 A42 ( Delos, iii B.C.): also Ἀντιγονικός, ή, όν, Plu. Arat. 54:—fem. Ἀντιγονίς, ίδος, a kind of cup named from him, Polem.Hist. 57, Plu. Aem. 33:— Ἀντιγονίζω, to be on Antigonus’ side, of his party, Polyaen. 4.6.13, D.T. 638.16.
duplicate letter, Luc. Herm. 40;= ἀντίγραφον, Gal. 17.59.
office of ἀντιγραφεύς, PPetr. 3p.162, PTeb. 5.85 ( ii B.C., pl.), cf. Inscr.Prien. 108.222 ( ii B.C.; -ία lapis).
office whence ἀντίγραφα were issued, Jahresh. 7 Beibl. 44 ( Ephesus), cf.ib. 18 Beibl. 286.

checking- or copying-clerk, a public officer, Aeschin. 3.25. cf. IG 2.408, al., cf. 575 (of a deme), SIG 364.22 ( Ephesus), etc., Plb. 6.56.13, PRev.Laws 12.1; ἀ. τῶν εἰσενεγκόντων one who keeps a check upon their accounts, D. 22.70.
a reply in writing, such as Caesarʼs Anticato in reply to Ciceroʼs Cato, Plu. Caes. 3, cf. Sol. 1, Id. Comm.not. 2.1059b, Herm. in Phdr. p.189A.

children.label: II
children.definition: answer put in by the defendant, plea, D. 45.46 (where a specimen is found); sts. of the plaintiffʼs plea, indictment, Pl. Ap. 27c, Hyp. Eux. 31:—sts. ἀντιγραφή was used indifferently of both parties, cf. Harp.:—in Ar. Nu. 471, generally, counter-pleas, cf. Poll. 8.58.

children.label: III
children.definition: transcribing, D.H. 4.62.
Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.577e.

children.label: IV
children.definition: rescript, imperial decree, OGI 262.27.

definition: ἀντιγραφικός, ή, όν, τὸ ἀ. κεφάλαιον

children.definition: concerning the indictment, Sch. Aristid. p.441D.
copied, in duplicate, στῆλαι, διαθῆκαι, etc., D. 20.36, 45.10, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., ἀντίγραφον, τό, transcript, copy, Decr. ap. And. 1.79, Lys. 32.7, D. 25.47, Arist. Pol. 1309a11; esp. of copies of a book, Ἀττικιανὰ ἀντίγραφα copies of an edition issued by Atticus, Harp. s.v. Ἀργᾶς, al.; certified copy of official document, CPR 1.4 (i A.D.); εἰκόνος ἀ. copy of a picture, Luc. Zeux. 3 (but -φος Jac.).

write against or in answer, write back, v.l. in Th. 1.129 ( Pass.), Phld. Ir. p.86 W., Plu. Luc. 21, D.Chr. 2.18, PFlor. 278ii 30 (iii A.D.), etc.; ἀ. τῆ γραφῇ vie in description with painting, Longus Prooem.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., with pf. Pass. ( Aeschin. 1.154, D. 45.45), as law-term, put in as an ἀντιγραφή, plead against, τι περί τινος Is. 11.17, cf. D. 48.31; also ἀ. τινί, c. inf., plead against another that such is the case, Lys. 23.5, D. 44.39:—also, bring a counter-accusation, Poll. 8.58, cf. Aeschin. 1.119, 154; later in Act., plead in answer to a charge, -γράψαι ὡς οὐκ ἔπραξεν D.S. 1.75.
keep a counter-reckoning of money paid or received (cf. ἀντιγραφεύς), Arist. Ath. 54.3; simply, check accounts, PTeb. 89.13 (ii B.C.).
issue a rescript, SIG 888.8.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., aor. ἀντιγραφῆναι to be copied, εἰς στήλας Milet. 3.148.93.
putting in of an ἀντιγραφή v.l. in Lys. 23.10.
to be deputy-gymnasiarch, AJA 19.324 ( Locr.).
marking opposite angles, of stars in a quadrilateral, Hipparch. 3.4.3, Ptol. Alm. 7.1.

definition: ἀντιδάκνω, fut. -δήξομαι Muson. Fr. 10p.55H.: the aor. ἀντέδακα dub. in Luc. Ocyp. 27:—

children.definition: bite in turn, Hdt. 4.168, Ael. NA 4.19, Muson. l.c.
thumb, Aq. Ex. 29.20.

children.label: II
children.definition: dactyl reversed, anapaest, Diom. 1.478K., Choerob. in Heph. p.215C.
one must lend in return, τῷ δανείσαντι Arist. EN 1165a8.
spend in turn upon, τοὺς δαπανωμένους Lib. Ep. 843 (dub.l.).
refutation, Corp.Herm. 16.1.
taking another’s place at dinner, Luc. Gall. 9.
give the right hand in turn, return oneʼs salute, τινά X. Cyr. 4.2.19, D.Chr. 38.47, Luc. Laps. 13.
entreat in return, Pl. La. 186d.
receive in return, A. Ch. 916; ἀμοιβὰς κακάς Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.211; ἔδωκα κἀντεδεξάμην E. IA 1222.
fetter in turn, Diog.Oen. 39.
practise counter-demagogy, πρὸς τὴν Κίμωνος εὐπορίαν Arist. Ath. 27.3, cf. Plu. CG 8.
harangue in opposition to, τινί Eust. 1029.1.
manufacture in competition, πρός τι Lync. ap. Ath. 11.469b.
cross over in turn, X. Ages. 1.8, dub.l. J. AJ 13.1.3.
to attack in return, τὸν διαβάλλοντα Arist. Rh. 1416a26.
pay in money instead of kind, PPetr. 2p.102 ( iii B. C., Pass.):— Med., Inscr.Magn. 103.68 (ii B.C.):—hence ἀντιδια-γρᾰφή, ἡ, Ostr. 1509, al. (ii B. C.).
pair off with, in dichotomy, S.E. M. 11.15; to be subjoined in turn, A.D. Synt. 126.10.
division by dichotomy, Plot. 4.4.28, 6.3.10, D.L. 7.61, Iamb. Myst. 1.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: counterincision, Paul.Aeg. 4.48.

distinguish logically, βαρβάρους πρὸς Ἕλληνας Str. 14.2.28, cf. Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.68, Phld. Oec. p.35J.; τὸ σύνθετον τῷ ἁπλῷ Plot. 6.3.10, cf. Iamb. Comm.Math. 4:— Pass., to be opposed as the members of a natural classification, Arist. Cat. 14b34, Top. 143a36, cf. Iamb. Myst. 9.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., τροφὴν τοῖς νεύροις, perh. distribute, Theo Gymn. ap. Gal. 6.208.
to be different, of mixed stuffs, Aq. De. 22.11.
serving in return, τοῖς ἄλλοις Str. 16.4.26.
arrange or array in opposition, of troops, App. BC 2.75.
reply to, answer in discussion, in Pass., περὶ τῶν ἀντιδιαλεγομένων τοῖς διαλεκτικοῖς, title of work by Chrysipp., D.L. 7.202.
exchange prisoners, τινά τινος D.H. 19.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: differ in an account, πρός τι Id. 1.84.
set off in compensation, Gloss.
bivouac opposite to, τινί App. BC 4.130.
retort, ἀντιδιαπλέκει ὡς . . Aeschin. 3.28, cf. AB 406.
distinctive, A.D. Pron. 24.12, Synt. 97.17. Adv. -κῶς Id. Pron. 40.4.
be at variance, ἀλλήλοις Ammon. Diff. 45.
distinguish, discriminate, Str. 10.2.17; ἁπλᾶ καὶ σύνθετα Plot. 6.1.29; τι ἀπό τινος Longin. Proll.Heph. p.83C.:— Med., controvert, Sor. 2.54.

children.label: II
children.definition: contrast, oppose, τί τινι S.E. P. 1.9; τινὰς πρός τινας D.H. Th. 32; τιπρός τι Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 400.17:— Pass., A.D. Synt. 14.24.
opposition, distinction, A.D. Pron. 23.24, Synt. 15.17, al., Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 11.12, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: counter-dilatation, ἀρτηριῶν πρὸς καρδίαν Gal. 8.760.
comparison of arguments for and against a thesis, Iamb. Comm.Math. 35.
oppose, τινὶ πρὸς τὰ ὅλα Arr. Epict. 3.24.24; τινὶ περί τινος S.E. M. 7.159: abs., ib. 8.126.
retaliate upon a person, D.S. 34.12; κακῶς παθόντα ἀ Eust. 546.28:— Med., offer resistance, πρὸς τὴν πειθώ Longin. 17.1; τοὺς ἀντιδιατιθεμένους opponents, 2 Ep.Ti. 2.25.
poets who are rivals in dramatic or lyric contests, Sch. Pi. N. 4.60.
inform, instruct in turn or on the other side, App. BC 5.19, AP 6.236 ( Phil.).

children.label: II
children.definition: contend for the prize, Ar. V. 1410, cf. Satyr. Vit Eur.Fr. 38.19, D.Chr. 37.40.

give in return, repay, τινί τι Hdt. 1.70, 3.135, A. Ch. 94, etc.; πόνον, οὐ χάριν, ἀντιδίδωσιν ἔχειν S. OC 232, cf. A. Ch. 498, Eu. 264; νέκυν νεκρῶν ἀμοιβὸν ἀ. S. Ant. 1067; ἀ. χάριν E. HF 1337, cf. Th. 1.41, 3.63; τιμωρίαν Id. 2.53; λαμβάνων ἀντεδίδου X. Cyr. 8.6.23:— Pass., ἔλεος πρός τινα δίκαιος ἀντιδίδοσθαι Th. 3.40.
give for or instead of, τί τινος E. Alc. 340, IT 28; τι ἀντί τινος Ar. Pax 1251.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. [τὴν οὐσίαν] offer to change fortunes with one (cf. ἀντίδοσις II), Lys. 24.9, D. 20.130; ἀ. τριηραρχίαν Id. 21.78; accept such an offer, Id. 28.17.

children.label: III
children.definition: give as an antidote, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.90.
go through, recount in turn, ὀνόματα Aeschin. 1.155.
go through in opposition, ἀ. λόγῳ Pl. Tht. 167d.

definition: ἀντιδιεσταλμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἀντιδιαστέλλω,

children.definition: as distinguished from, opposed to, Iamb. in Nic. p.12P.
introduce a counter narration, Corn. Rh. p.364 H.

children.label: b
children.definition: relate in turn, X.Eph. 5.9.10 (v.l.).
counter-narration, Fortunat.Rh. 2.19.
Dam. Pr. 67, Hsch., Suid. s.v. ἀντιδιαστέλλεται.
implead one another, Lys. Fr. 300S. ᾰσία, ἡ, litigation, Aq. Pr. 20.3.

definition: ἀντιδικέω, impf. ἠντιδίκουν Lys. 6.12, but ἠντεδίκουν (acc. to the best Ms.) D. 39.37, 40.18: aor. ἠντεδίκησα Id. 47.28:—

children.definition: to be an ἀντίδικος, dispute, go to law, περί τινος X. Mem. 4.4.8; οἱ ἀντιδικοῦντες ἑκάτεροι the parties to a suit, Pl. Lg. 948d: abs., of the defendant, ἀντιδικῶν Ar. Nu. 776; ἀ. πρός τι or πρός τινα to urge oneʼs suit against . ., D. 28.17, 41.10, Is. 11.9; join issue, ἠντιδίκει ἦ μήν . ., c. acc. et inf., Lys. l.c.; oppose, rebut, διαβολαῖς D. 41.13; ἀλλήλοις prob. in Thugen. 1 D.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be an object of dispute, Phot.p.147R.
litigation, contention, πρός τινα ὑπέρ τινος Plu. Frat. 2.483b; ὁ ἐξ -ίας the opponent in a process, Mitteis Chr. 88.14 (ii A.D.); Astrol., opp. συναφεῖαι, συνάψεις, Ptol. Tetr. 191.

opponent or adversary in a suit, Aeschin. 2.165, cf. Pl. Phdr. 273c: fem., ἡ ἀ. POxy. 37i8 (iA. D.): properly, the defendant, Antipho 1.2; but also, the plaintiff, Lys. 7.13; ἀ. πρός τινα Antipho 1.5:—generally, opponent, adversary, A. Ag. 41; ἀληθινῶν ἀ. [ Heraclit.] 133, cf. 1 Ep.Pet. 5.8, Phld. Ir. p.65W.
= Lat. pro dictatore, Lyd. Mag. 1.38.
define in turn, give a counter-definition, Gal. 18(2).837.
countermine, Str. 12.8.11.
doubling of the sunʼs disk, Lyd. Ost. 9c.
think oneself equal to, κύμασιν LXX 2 Ma. 9.8.
course supporting beams, ἀ. λίθινον Milet. 3p.172 (iii B. C.).
opposed or substituted building, Aen.Tact. 23.5.
to be of a contrary opinion, Pl. Tht. 170d, Epicur. Nat. 14.8, Phld. Sign. 19, cf. 31, D.L. 9.18.
τινί or πρός τινα. Plb. 2.56.1, 16.14.4; τινὶ περί τινος D.S. 2.29: abs., Boeth.Stoic. 3.267.
of a different opinion or sect, Luc. Herm. 17, Aristaenet. 1.10; μάχη φορᾶς ἀ. Luc. Par. 29.
instead of skin, κάρυον χλωρῆς ἀντίδορον λεπίδος with a green husk as integument, AP 6.22 ( Zon.).

giving in return, exchange, Arist. EN 1133a6, Call. Fr. 221; φορτίων D.S. 2.54; αἰχμαλώτων 12.63; καρπῶν D.Chr. 38.22; κακῶν App. BC 1.3; ἡ εἰς τὴν σιωπὴν ἀ. Ael. NA 5.9:— repayment, requital, ὕβρεως Orac. ap. Luc. Alex. 50; ἀντίδοσίν τινος in return for . ., IG 3.172.

children.label: II
children.definition: a form by which a citizen charged with a λειτουργία or εἰσφορά might call upon any other citizen, whom he thought richer than himself, either to exchange properties, or to submit to the charge himself, Lys. 3.20, etc., cf. Cratin. 14D.; καλεῖσθαί τινα εἰς ἀ. τριηραρχίας ἢ χορηγίας X. Oec. 7.3; καταστὰς (sc. χορηγὸς) ἐξ ἀντιδόσεως D. 21.156; ποιεῖσθαι ἀ. τινι Id. 4.36; ἀ. ἐπʼ ἐμὲ παρεσκεύασαν 28.17; cf. Isoc. 15, D. 42.

data.quote: καλεῖσθαί τινα εἰς ἀ. τριηραρχίας ἢ χορηγίας

children.definition: given in lieu of, πυρός AP 9.165 ( Pall.).

children.label: II
children.definition: given as a remedy for, κακῶν φάρμακον ἀ. ib. 10.118.

Subst., ἀντίδοτος (sc. δόσις), ἡ, an antidote, remedy, AP 12.13 ( Strat.), Gal. 14.1, etc.: in other places the gender is uncertain, Plu. Aud. 2.42d, Adul. 54e, etc.:—hence Dim. ἀντιδότιον, τό, Archig. ap. Philum. Ven. 14.7.
serve in turn, τοῖς τεκοῦσι γὰρ δύστηνος ὅστις μὴ ἀντιδουλεύει τέκνων E. Supp. 362.

data.quote: τοῖς τεκοῦσι γὰρ δύστηνος ὅστις μὴ ἀντιδουλεύει τέκνων

children.definition: instead of a slave, neut. pl. as Adv., ταύρων γονὰς δοὺς ἀντίδουλα A. Fr. 194.

children.label: II
children.definition: being as a slave, treated as a slave, Id. Ch. 135.
re-echoing, ᾄδειν A. Pers. 121 (lyr.); βοᾶν ἀντίδουπά τινι ib. 1040, parodied by Pl.Com. 27D.
lay hold of, καρδίας Them. Or. 32.357b.
retaliation, Anon. in Rh. 91.30.
act against, retaliate, παθὼν μὲν ἀντέδρων S. OC 271, cf. 953, E. Andr. 438, Antipho 4.2.2, etc.; πρὸς τὰς πράξεις ἀ. S. OC 959:— Pass., Iamb. Myst. 3.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: repay, requite, ἀ. τινὰ κακῶς S. OC 1191, cf. Pl. Cri. 49d; γενναῖα γὰρ παθόντες ὑμᾶς ἀντιδρᾶν ὀφείλομεν E. Supp. 1179.

data.quote: γενναῖα γὰρ παθόντες ὑμᾶς ἀντιδρᾶν ὀφείλομεν

children.definition: run in a contrary direction, Luc. Astr. 12.
set opposite to, Intr.Arat. p.328 Maass.
to be angry in turn, τοῖς δυσχεραίνουσιν M.Ant. 6.26.
a return-gift, recompense, Arist. EN 1123a3.

present in return, ἀ. τινά τινι one with a thing, Hdt. 2.30; τινί τι a thing to one, θεοὶ δέ σοι ἐσθλῶν ἀμοιβὰς ἀντιδωρησαίατο E. Hel. 159, cf. Pl. Euthphr. 14e; offer instead τούτου ἐφιέμενος ἀ. ἄλλο Arist. EN 1159b14.

data.quote: θεοὶ δέ σοι ἐσθλῶν ἀμοιβὰς ἀντιδωρησαίατο

children.definition: return-gift, Men.Prot. p.20 D., Just. Nov. 120.11, v.l. for ἀντίδουλα in A. Fr. 194.
annex, e.g. a word in the corresponding clause of a sentence, D.H. Amm. 2.11.
rivalry, Vett.Val. 39.27, Heph.Astr. 2.28.
rival, adversary, LXX Le. 18.18, Si. 26.6: as Adj., controversial, in rivalry, παράδοσις Vett.Val. 198.11: Astrol., ὁ διάμετρος ἀ. Porph. in Ptol. Tetr. 186.
to be emulous of, rival, Vett.Val. 47.15.
seek one who is seeking us, X. Oec. 8.23.
Petos. ap. Vett.Val. 128.25.
equivalence, Theol.Ar. 57.

children.label: II
children.definition: diametrical opposition, Vett.Val.123.26.
put in the opposite scale: hence, balancing, correspondent, Arist. PA 666a27, Plu. QConv. 2.723c; ζῴδια Anon. II Intr. Arat. p.128 Maass.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀντίζυγα, τά, vertical cross-pieces, in building, IG 2(2).463.
insert cross-pieces, IG 2(2).463.

children.label: II
children.definition: counterbalance, πρός τι Eust. 60.29.
save alive in turn, Babr. 107.16.
warm mutually, ἀλλήλους J. BJ 4.4.6.
devise death in turn, Eust. 1029.40.
bury opposite:— Pass., aor. ἀντετάφην IG 14.1721.
IG 4.823.69, Haussoullier Milet p.163.

equal to the gods, godlike (cf. S.E. M. 7.6): Homeric epith. of heroes, Il. 5.663, etc.; of nations, ib. 12.408, Od. 6.241; of women, only ib. 11.117; applied even to Polyphemus and the suitors, ib. 1.70, 14.18; ἥρωες ἀ. B. 10.79.

children.label: II
children.definition: contrary to God, Ph. 1.566, al.
Subst. ἀντίθεος, ὁ, hostile deity, Hld. 4.7, Iamb. Myst. 3.31, PMag.Lond. 121.635 (unless Adj., disguised as a god).
take care of in turn, γονέας X. Cyr. 8.3.49.
court in return, in Pass., J. AJ 17.2.4, Max.Tyr. 20.6.
warm in turn, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.115, Gal. 1.656.
opposition, Pl. Sph. 257e, 258b; ἀντίθεσιν ἔχειν πρός τι correspond to . ., Arist. HA 503a25; resistance, AP 12.200 ( Strat.).
opposition of propositions, in pl., Arist. Int. 19b20, Top. 113b15, Metaph. 1054a23.

children.label: b
children.definition: substitution of the contradictory, as ‘not-man’ for ‘man’, ἡ σὺν -θέσει ἀντιστροφή, conversion by negation, e.g. ‘man is an animal ∴ what is not an animal cannot be a man’, Anon. in SE 15.23, al.
antithesis, Isoc. 12.2, Arist. Rh. 1410a22; in forensic oratory, counter-proposition, Hermog. Id. 1.4, al.
change or transposition of a letter, Hdn.Gr. 2.945, Diom. 1.442K.
one must oppose, πρός τι ὅτι . . Arist. Pol. 1286b2.
setting in opposition, contrasting, ἀ. δύναμις φαινομένων τε καὶ νοουμένων S.E. P. 1.8; antithetical, Eust. 1325.19; ἀντιθετικά, τά, D. 21 Arg.ii9; ἀ. στάσις Hermog. Stat. 4, al.

data.quote: ἀ. δύναμις φαινομένων τε καὶ νοουμένων

children.label: II
children.definition: contrasted, correspondent, of poems in which a number of κῶλα are repeated in reversed order, Heph. Poëm. 4.6.

opposed, antithetic, ἀ. εἰπὼν οὐδέν Timocl. 12.7; φύσιν ἔχειν ἀ. πρός τι Plu. QConv. 2.672c; ἀρεταῖς κακίαι ἀ. S.E. M. 9.156, cf. Plot. 2.5.2, Phld. Ir. p.87 W.: c.gen., inconsistent with, PTeb. 24.63. Adv. ἀντιθέ-τως, συζυγεῖν Plu. An.procr. 2.1022e, cf. Demetr. Eloc. 24; ἀ. ἔχειν, of bones in arm, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.23.27; ἀ. ἀντικεῖσθαι, of ὑγίεια and νόσος, opp. ἀντιφατικῶς, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 580.1.
διάμετρος, Vett.Val. 340.23.
ἀ. ψᾶφος blackball, GDI 4p.1204 ( Itanos).
ἀντίθετον, τό, antithesis, Ar. Fr. 326, Arist. Rh.Al. 1435b26, Aeschin. 2.4.
run against another, compete in a race, l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: run contrary ways, AP 9.822.
whet against another, ὀδόντας ἐπί τινα Luc. Par. 51.
revetment of wall, IG 1.321, cf. 11.203 A45 ( Delos).
press against, counteract, ἀλλήλους Archyt. ap. Stob. 2.13.120:— Pass., ἀντιθλίβεται τὸ θλῖβον crushing produces counter-crushing, Arist. GA 768b20.
die in turn or for another, EM 114.14.
wail in return, τινί An.Ox. 3.180.
echoing, resounding, Coluth. 118, APl. 16.153 ( Satyr.).
leap to meet, Emp. 105.1.
show anger in turn, Ael. NA 17.13 codd. ( ἀντιφιλοτιμ- Hercher).

opposite the door, κατʼ ἀντίθυρον κλισίης opposite the door of the house, Od. 16.159, as the Sch.; or it may be a neut. Subst. ἀντίθυρον the part facing the door, vestibule, as it is in βᾶτε κατʼ ἀντιθύρων S. El. 1433, ubi v. Herm.: in Luc. Symp. 8, the side of a room facing the door, cf. Alex. 16, Dom. 26.
sacrifice in turn, Philox. 10 ( Pass.).
pull down or destroy in turn, D.C. 46.34.
sleep again or instead, AP 11.366 ( Maced.).

definition: ἀντικάθημαι, Ion. ἀντικάτ-, properly pf. of ἀντικαθίζομαι, but used as pres.:—

children.definition: to be set over against, τινί Archyt. ap. Stob. 4.1.138.
lie over against, so as to watch each other, ἡμέραι σφι ἀντικατημένοισι ἐγεγόνεσαν ὀκτώ Hdt. 9.39, cf. 41, Th. 5.6, X. Eq.Mag. 8.12, etc.: metaph., λόγος ἀ. τινι S.E. M. 1.145.

definition: ἀντικαθίζομαι, Ion. ἀντικατ-, fut. -εδοῦμαι: aor. -εζόμην:— Med.,

children.definition: sit or lie over against, of armies or fleets watching one another, Hdt. 4.3.5.1, Th. 1.30, 4.124.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., place or settle instead of another, LXX 4 Ki. 17.26.
replace, substitute, ἄλλα Hdt. 9.93; μὴ ἐλάσσω ἀντικαταστῆσαι πάλιν replace an equal quantity of gold, Th. 2.13; ἄλλους ἀ. set up others in their stead, Arist. Mir. 838a3.
set against, oppose, τινὰ πρός τινα Th. 4.93; establish as a counterpart, τινά τινι Pl. R. 591a.
set up or bring back again, ἀ. ἐπὶ τὸ θαρρεῖν Th. 2.65; rally, τοὺς θορυβηθέντας D.H. 6.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., with aor. 2 and pf. Act.; also aor. 1 κατεστάθην X. An. 3.1.38:— to be put in anotherʼs place, reign in his stead, Hdt. 2.37, X. l.c.
to be pitted against another, opposed, abs., Th. 1.71, 3.47, etc.; τινί X. Eq.Mag. 7.5.

children.label: b
children.definition: to be confronted with, τινί, πρός τινα, POxy. 97.9 (ii A. D.), BGU 168.11 (ii A.D.).
set on fire in turn, Pl. Ti. 65e.
damage in return, τινά Pl. Cri. 49c, 54c.
invite in turn, X. Smp. 1.15 (in fut. Pass. -κληθήσομαι), cf. Ev.Luc. 14.12.
adorn oneself in rivalry with, πρὸς τὴν πολυτέλειαν εὐτελείᾳ Plu. Pyth. 2.406d.

children.label: II
children.definition: cost of carriage, Just. Edict. 13.15.
pit of the stomach: but Ruf. Onom. 68 makes it the depression in the throat above the clavicle, = σφαγή, λαυκανίη, cf. hsch. ( ἀντικαραῶν cod.).
hold out against, πρός τι D.C. 39.41.
repay, render, τὴν προσήκουσαν χάριν Lib. Decl. 43.3.
bring in instead:— Pass., ἀντικαταχθῆμέν τινι come into the place of another, Ti.Locr. 101d.
set over against, of stars setting at sunrise, Hipparch. 2.2.11, al., Theo Sm. p.137H.
stoop down in turn or in opposition, Ach.Tat. 6.18.
setting in the opposite quarter, in pl., Hipparch. 2.1.14, 2.2.1.
die or be slain in turn, τοὺς κτανόντας ἀντικατθανεῖν A. Ch. 144.
to be enclosed in turn, Ruf. Oss. 38.
take possession of in turn, Ti.Locr. 102d.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pl.Com. 9D.

children.label: III
children.definition: occupy in opposition, λόφον D.C. 36.47, cf. 42.31.
enroll instead, soldiers or senators, D.C. 40.65, 54.14.
leave in oneʼs stead, Pl. R. 540b, Pyth. Sim. 36.
exchange, τινὸς πρός τι Plu. Adul. 2.49d, cf. PFlor. 47.15 (iii A. D.); requital, Sch. Opp. H. 2.687.
satisfaction, J. AJ 15.9.2, Onos. 34.4 (pl.).
one must exchange, τινά τινων Arr. Epict. 4.3 tit.
profits of commerce, D.L. 7.99, BGU 1210.177 ( ii A. D., pl.).
exchange one thing for another:
give one thing for another, τὴν ἰδίαν ψυχὴν ἀντὶ τῆς κοινῆς σωτηρίας Lycurg. 88; τὸ ζῆν ὑπὲρ ἄλλου οὐδενός Isoc. 5.135.

data.quote: τὴν ἰδίαν ψυχὴν ἀντὶ τῆς κοινῆς σωτηρίας

children.definition: receive one thing in exchange for another, τι ἀντί τινος Id. 6.109, Aeschin. 3.92, D.Chr. 40.30.

set off or balance one thing against another, εὐεργεσίας κρίσεως Din. 1.14; ἀ. τι πρὸς τὴν περὶ τὰ θεῖα φιλοσοφίαν afford some compensation for . ., Arist. PA 645a3; ἀ. ἀδικοῦντα, εἰ βλαβερόν, ἀλλὰ καλόν submit in justification a balance in case of injury . ., Id. Rh. 1416a11.
interchange, Id. EN 1157a12.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., ἀντικαταλλαγῆναι (sc. τῆ τύχῃ) to be reconciled, Plb. 15.20.5: abs., come to an agreement, περὶ οὗ ἀντικατηλλάγη PFlor. 47.13.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., come to an agreement, ὁμολογῶμεν ἀντικατηλλαχέναι πρὸς ἀλλήλους ib. 3 (iii A. D.).
assign land in compensation or exchange, PTeb. 61b111,72.39 ( ii B. C., Pass.).
shut oneʼs eyes in turn, Poll. 9.113.
